From thence he was Sold to Albert Achilles, Elector of Brandenburg; and by him a ≈øecond time to Henry Duke of Bavaria in Land≈øhut, for two and thirty thou≈øand Florins; in who≈øe Cu≈øtody he died at Burchau≈øen, An. 1447. His Wives were, two French Ladies, Anne of Bounbon, and Catharine, Daughter of Peter Count d' Alen√ßon. By the fir≈øt he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Lewis the Crooked, decea≈øed before his Father, An. 1445. and without I≈ø≈øue, notwith≈øtanding he had married Margaret, Daughter of Frederick the Second, Elector of Brandenburg.
2. Elizabeth, married to Otho of Au≈øtria, An. 1312.
3. Frederick, who had Land≈øhut, and the Lands belonging thereunto, a≈ø≈øigned him for his Patrimony; of who≈øe Po≈øterity we ≈øhall immediately treat. And,
4. John, of whom more in the next Section, as only Propagator of this Line.

Now Frederick was ≈øurnamed The Wi≈øe, and very happy in making People Friends, when at difference. He departed this Life at Land≈øhut, Dec. 4. 1393. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Magdalen, Daughter of Bernabovius, Vice-Count of Milan, his Second Wife (for by Anne, Daughter of the Earl of Neyffen, his fir≈øt, he had never any) as followeth.

list.item: 1. Magdalen, given in Marriage to John Meinhard, Count of Goritia.
2. Elizabeth, e≈øpou≈øed by Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg; decea≈øed 1443.
3. Margaret, by Mark Vice-Count of Milan.

4. Henry, who being left an Orphan by his Parents in his tender Years, had his E≈øtate ruin'd, in a manner, by the ill management of Guardians; yet afterwards, by the more prudent Conduct of a certain Prie≈øt, very well acquainted with the methods of Hou≈øe-keeping, and improving an E≈øtate, not only redeem'd all things that had been any ways Imbezel'd or Mortgaged; but being given to Parcimony, laid up ≈øuch great Trea≈øures, that in ≈øhort, he obtain'd the name of Rich. He departed this Life in the Year 1450. having had to Wife, Anne, Daughter of Albert the Fourth of Au≈øtria: His Children by her, nece≈ø≈øary to be here mention'd, were Joan and Elizabeth; the one married to Otho Count Palatine in Mosbach; The other to Ulrick Count Wirtenburg, and died 1478. As al≈øo,

div.p: 1. Lewis, a very dutiful Son, who was likewi≈øe his Succe≈ø≈øor, and had many Wars. In 1450. he bani≈øhed the Jews, confi≈øcating their E≈øtates and Effects to his Exchequer; and departed this Life 1479. At which time he left I≈ø≈øue by Amalia, Daughter of Frederick the Second, Elector of Sax. who died 1502. Margaret, married to Philip, Elector Palatine, An. 1474. deca≈øed 1501. And,

1. George, ≈øurnamed the Rich, who Founded the Univer≈øity at Ingol≈øtadt, and took to Wife Hedewig, Daughter of Ca≈øimire, King of Poland, by whom he had I≈ø≈øue, ≈øurviving at his death, which happened in 1503. Elizabeth, whom he married to Rupert the Tenth, Count Palatine; leaving her al≈øo his Heire≈øs by Will, which gave ri≈øe to a very bloody War 'twixt the Palatine and Bavarian Lines. Margaret, profe≈ø≈øed a Nun; Lewis the Ninth, decea≈øed before his Father; And Rupert in his Infancy.

¬ß. XX. Matters thus far cleared, return we now to John, younge≈øt Son of Stephen the Fir≈øt, who, in the divi≈øion of the Hereditary Teritories, had Munchen for his Patrimony, where he decea≈øed 1397. His Wife was Catharine, Daughter of Meinhard, Earl of Goritia, decea≈øed 1391. who bore him I≈ø≈øue,
1. William the Third, a great defender of the Council of Ba≈øil, who died 1463. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Margaret of Cleves, Adolph and William, both ≈øhort-liv'd.
2. Sophia, married in 1389. to the Emperor Wence≈ølaus; decea≈øed 1428. And,
3. Erne≈øte, decea≈øed 1438. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Elizabeth, Daughter of Bernabovius, Vice-Count of Milan; Elizabeth, married to Adolph Duke of Bergen, An. 1434. and after his decea≈øe to He≈ø≈øon Count de Leiningen; Beatrice the Wife of Herman, Count de Calley, and afterwards of John Count Palatine in Amberg, and Albert the Third.

This Albert, ≈øurnamed The Pious, had Ten Children, by his Wife Anne, Daughter of Erick the Fir≈øt, Duke of Brun≈øwick, whereof Erne≈øt and Albert died Young, the re≈øt were,
1. John the Fourth, born in Nov. 1437. decea≈øed of the Plague, and without I≈ø≈øue, 1463.
2. Sigi≈ømund, born 1439. He likewi≈øe died I≈ø≈øuele≈øs, An. 1501.
3. Albert the Fourth, born Oct. 15. 1440. of whom in the next Section.
4. Margaret, married to Frederick, Marque≈øs of Mantua, 1462. decea≈øed 1480.
5. Elizabeth, born 1442. ≈øhe was married to Erne≈øtus, Elector of Saxony, and died 1484.
6. Chri≈øtopher, born Jan. 5. 1450. a Prince of great Courage, and famous for his Strength, yet lead a ≈øingle Life, and died 1493.
7. Barbara, born 1451. ≈øhe was veiled a Nun. And,
8. Wolfgang, who likewi≈øe died a Batchellor, An. 1514.

¬ß. XXI. We now return to Albert, who maintained a very bloody War again≈øt Philip, Elector Palatine for the Succe≈ø≈øion to the Inheritance of George the Rich, Duke of the Lower Bavaria. He departed this Life 1508. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Cunigund, Daughter of the Emperor Frederick the Third, as followeth,
1. William the Fourth, of whom beneath.
2. Sidoni ‚Ä¢ , born 1488. decea≈øed 1505.
3. Sibilla, married to Lewis the Fifth, Elector Palatine.
4. Sabina, born 1492. married to Ulrick the Second, Duke of Wirtenburg.
5. Su≈øanna, born 1502. married, after the decea≈øe of Ca≈øimire, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, her fir≈øt Husband, to Otho Henry, Elector Palatine; decea≈øed 1543.
6. Lewis the Tenth, born 1495. decea≈øed a Batchellor 1545.
7. Erne≈øte, born 1500. elected Arch Bi≈øhop of Salisbury and Pa≈ø≈øaw, which Churches he not only freed from Debt, without oppre≈ø≈øing his Subjects, but likewi≈øe inrich'd the ≈øame. In 1554. he re≈øigned, and liv'd upon his own E≈øtate in Stle≈øia, till the Year of his death 1560.

William the Fourth mu≈øt now appear, born 1493. decea≈øed 1550. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Mary Jaqucline, Daughter of Philip, Marque≈øs of
Baden; Maud, married to Philibert, Marque≈øs of Baden; decea≈øed 1565. And,
1. Albert the Fifth, born 1526. decea≈øed 1579. having had to Wife, Anne, Daughter of the Emperor Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, by whom he had a fair I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names we ≈øhall ≈øet down in this following Order.
1. Charles, born 1547. decea≈øed 1551.
2. William the Fifth, born 1548. of whom more in the next Section.
3. Ferdinand, born 1550. decea≈øed 1608. who, by Mary of Prettenbeck, had I≈ø≈øue Francis William, Bi≈øhop of O≈øenburg; as al≈øo Erne≈øte Benno, and Francis Laurence; from which two le≈øt the Counts of Wirtenburg, and Schaumburg are de≈øcended.
4. Frederick, born 1553. decea≈øed the Year following.
5. Mary Maximiliana, born 1552. decea≈øed 1614.
6. Mary, born 1553. married to Charles of Au≈øtria, Duke of Stiria, &c. 1571. decea≈øed 1608.
7. Erne≈øtus the Third, Arch-Bi≈øhop and Elector of Cologne, Bi≈øhop of Frie≈øingen, Hilde≈øheim, and Liege; born 1554. decea≈øed 1612.

¬ß. XXII. We now return to William the Fifth, Propagator of the Bavarian Line, in whom al≈øo the Wilhelmine Line began. He was a mo≈øt devout Prince, and a great admirer of Learning. His Dutche≈øs was Renata, Daughter
of Francis Duke of Lorrain, decea≈øed 1602. whereas him≈øelf ≈øurviv'd till Feb. 7. 1626. having had I≈ø≈øue Ten Children, whereof Four died young; the re≈øt were,
1. Maximilian, of whom beneath.
2. Mary Anne, born 1574. married to Ferdinand of Au≈øtria, afterwards Emperor, by the name of Ferdinand the Second, An. 1600. decea≈øed March 8. 1616.
3. Philip Bi≈øhop of Ratisbonne, and Cardinal, born 1576. decea≈øed 1598.
4. Ferdinand the Second, born Oct. 7. 1577. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop of Cologne, 1612. He was al≈øo Bi≈øhop of Liege, Mun≈øter, Hilde≈øheim, and Paderborn; and died 1650.
5. Albert the Sixth, born Ap. 3. 1584. Tutor to his Nephew, Elector Ferdinand, and Admini≈øtrator of the Electorate, during his Minority. This Prince had the Landtgraviate of Leuchtenberg in Dowty, with his Wife Maud, la≈øt Heire≈øs thereof; and died 1666. leaving I≈ø≈øue, fir≈øt, Mary Renata 1616. decea≈øed in her Infancy; ≈øecondly, John Francis Charles, born Nov. 18. 1618. decea≈øed 1640. thirdly, Ferdinand William, decea≈øed an Infant; fourthly, Maximilian Henry, born 1621. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop and Elector of Cologne, 1650. as al≈øo, Bi≈øhop of Liege and Hilde≈øheim. In 1658. he had a conte≈øt with the Bi≈øhop of Mun≈øter, about Crowning the King of the Romans. In 1683. him≈øelf was elected Bi≈øhop of that Dioce≈øs; and at length ended his days on the third of June, New-Stile, or twenty fourth of May,
Old-Stile, 1688. about Ten in the Morning. And,
6. Albert Sigi≈ømund, Bi≈øhop of Frei≈øingen and Ratisbonne, born Aug. 5. 1623. decea≈øed 1685.

Maximilian, born April 17. 1573. ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy of Bavaria. In 1609. he was declared Head of the Catholick League, and ≈øeiz'd on Donawert. Feb. 25. 1623. he obtain'd the Electoral Dignity, together with the Upper Palatinate, and County of Chamb, which was afterwards confirmed by the Treaty of We≈øtphalia. In 1646. upon the death of the la≈øt Landtgrave of Leuchtenberg, that Country fell to Albert Duke of Bavaria, and from him to the Electoral Line. As for Maximilian, he departed this Life in Sept. 1651. having had Elizabeth, Daughter of Charles the Second, Duke of Lorrain, to his fir≈øt Wife, and Mary Anne of Au≈øtria, Daughter of the Emperor Ferdinand the Second, decea≈øed 1665. to his Second. By the la≈øt Lady he had I≈ø≈øue Two Sons that out-liv'd him; namely,
1. Ferdinand Maria Francis Ignatius Wolfgang, born Sept. 30. 1636. O. S.
2. Maximilian Philip Jerome, Governour of Leuchtenberg, born Sept. 20. 1638. who took to Wife Lovi≈øe Frebon de Turr, Daughter of Frederick Maurice, Duke of Bouilion, Ap. 15. 1668. and died in January 1689.

Ferdinandus Maria ≈øucceeded his Father in the Electoral Dignity, An. 1651. and married Henrietta Adelheid, Daughter of Victor Amadeus, Duke of Savoy, decea≈øed March 18. 1676. as did him≈øelf on May 26. 1679. having had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Mary Anne Chri≈øtina Victoria, born Nov. 17. 1660. and married March 7. 1680. to Lewis the Fifteenth, Dauphin of France.
2. Maximilian Maria Emanuel Cajetan Lewis Francis Ignatius Antonina Felix Nicholas Pius, the pre≈øent Elector, born June 11. 1662. who, by the Grand Services he daily performs for His Imperial Maje≈øty, both again≈øt the Turks and French, hath ≈øufficiently approved to the whole World his great Abilities, in re≈øpect both to Civil and Military Affairs. In 1685/6. he took to Wife the Prince≈øs Mary Antonia, Daughter to the pre≈øent Emperor, by his fir≈øt Wife, who was delivered of a young Prince, on the 21≈øt. of May, in the Year, 1689. but alas. it died ≈øoon after.
3. Lovi≈øe Margaret, born 1663. decea≈øed 1665.
4. Lewis Amadens, decea≈øed 1665.
5. Cajetan Maria Francis, decea≈øed 1670.
6. Jo≈øeph Clemens Cajetan Francis Anthony Ga≈øper Melchior Baltha≈øar John Bapti≈øt Nicholas Bi≈øhop of Ratisbonne and Frei≈øingen, born Jan. 23. 1671. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop and Elector of Cologne, July 14. 1688. And,
7. Violante Beatrice, born Jan. 23. and married in 1688. to Ga≈øton, elde≈øt Son and Heir to the pre≈øent great Duke of Tu≈øcany.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of the Palatine-Bavarian Family.
div.p:
¬ß. XXIII. AFter that Henry the Lyon, Duke of Saxony and Bavaria, had been Pro≈øcribed and Outed of all his Territories, by the Emperor Frederick Barbaro≈ø≈øa; Otho the Fir≈øt, Earl of Witelsbach, had both the Bavaria's, as well Upper as Lower, granted him for ever, by the ≈øaid Emperor: To which al≈øo belonged at that time, the Counties of Scherding and Newburg, together with the Lord≈øhip of Burchau≈øen: Moreover he purcha≈øed the Counties of Dachow and Ritenburg; as al≈øo the Lord≈øhips of Rotenburg and Rheningen. This Prince's Grand≈øon, Otho the Second, by a Marriage with the ≈øole Daughter and Heire≈øs of Henry Count Palatine, obtain'd by Permi≈ø≈øion of the then Emperor, the Palatinate of the Rhine, being inve≈øted al≈øo at the ≈øame time with the Electoral Dignity, An. 1227. After this he bought the Ca≈øtle of Lindenfeld, and City of Nu≈øloch in Cregovia, An. 1256. and had Waldorf, with the City of Wi≈øelach, given him by the Emperor Henry. In 1281. Rodulph the Fir≈øt, Emperor, gave the County of Mo≈øburg to Lewis the Fir≈øt, Elector Palatine: The ≈øame Prince became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of Ferden, Landberg, Wilswiburg, Chagen, Landau, Mumuro, Elbrecht-Kirchen, and Libenau, by right of Inheritance. Afterwards upon Conradine, Duke of Schwaben's being Beheaded, there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of Lawgingen Hoch≈øtadt,
Schongau, Swabeck, Tu≈ø≈øen, Moringen, Neumark, and Amberg, with ≈øome other Places, to his other Territories: Moreover, he bought Schrei≈øheim with the Ca≈øtle of Stralenberg; as al≈øo the City of Bretten in Cregovia. In 1392. Rupert had half the County of Sponbeim in Dowry with his Wife; the other half whereof together with the City Pfortzheim, fell likewi≈øe to this Family, in the time of the Elector Frederick the Fir≈øt. At the ≈øame time that Rupert the Son became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of half Sponheim: Rupert the Emperor, his Father, had the County of Simmeren Mortgaged to him, which was afterwards wholly a≈ø≈øigned over to this Family. Moreover, he bought the County of Deux-Ponts for 25000. Florins. In 1404. Lewis
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ Elector, ≈øecond Son to the ≈øaid Emperor, ‚Ä¢ nd E ‚Ä¢ pingon in Cregovia Sold him by the then Muque≈øs of Eaden. Much about the ≈øame time he was put in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the County of Kirchberg al≈øo. In 1410. Stephen the Fir≈øt, in Right or his Wife, had the County of Veldentz ≈øettled on him. In 1441. Frederick the Fir≈øt, Outed the Earls of Lowen≈øtein, and ≈øeized on their Lands; to which there was Acce≈ø≈øion of Lutzeil≈øtein, not many Years after. The ≈øame Frederick had Bergstra≈ø≈øe Mortgag'd to him by the Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz. Maximilian of Bavaria took Donawert 1607. bought the County of Middlebeim in Schwaben, 1618. and ≈øucceeded to the Landtgraviate of Leuchtenberg ≈øome Years after, by right of Confraternity, or Act of Agreement to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion. The ≈øame Prince had an Eighth Elector≈øhip confirmed on him, by the In≈øtrument
of the Peace of O≈øenburg, An. 1648. In 1654. Charles Gu≈øtavus of Deux-Ponts was Crowned King of Sweden; who≈øe Brother Adolph John has al≈øo acquired very large Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions in the ≈øaid Kingdom. In 1666. Philip William, Duke of Newburg, ≈øince Elector Palume, obtained the Dutchies of Julters and Mons, together with the County of Raven≈øtein, by an amicable agreement 'twixt his Serene Highne≈øs, and the Elector of Brandenburg.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øe.
div.p: ¬ß. XXIV. THe greate≈øt Lo≈ø≈øes ≈øuffered by the Palatine-Bavarian Family, have been in our Age; for by the Fourth Article of the Peace of O≈øenburg, Maximilian Duke of Bavaria, was obliged to Cancel the Mortgage he had on the Upper Au≈øtria; as al≈øo to re≈øtore Berg≈øtra≈ø≈øe to the Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz, by the ≈øame Pacification. In the next French War, the King of France, without a Blu≈øh, made him≈øelf Ma≈øter of the Dutchy of Deux Ponts, and County of Veldentz, together with many Cities, on pretence they were Dependants of Al≈øace. In 1689. upon pretence of ≈øome other ≈øham Title, he made no ≈øcruple to po≈ø≈øe≈øs him≈øelf of the Counries of Sponbeim, Simmeren, and Lautereck: Nay, he invaded the very Palatinate of the Rhine, putting the ≈øame under Contributions, and utterly ruining the Inhabitants by his Exactions. What will be the future State of the≈øe Provinces, time mu≈øt ≈øhow.

div.head: Of its Preten≈øions.
div.p: ¬ß. XXV. FRom the≈øe Encroachments ≈øome Preten≈øions mu≈øt needs ari≈øe: And indeed the King of Sweden has the faire≈øt Title in the World to the Dutchy of Deux-Ponts, as next Heir Male. And then the pre≈øent Elector Palatine, Philip William, demands not only Re≈øtoration of the Provinces taken from him by the French King; but likewi≈øe ≈øatisfaction for the Damages done him in tho≈øe that are left. Moreover, the Count Palatine in Veldeniz has lo≈øt his whole Earldom, which likewi≈øe demands to be re≈øtored.

div.head: CHAP. IX. Of the Family of Saxony, as well Electoral as Ducal.
div.p:
¬ß. I. ALbert the Third, Elector of Saxony, de≈øcended of the Family of Anhalt (of who≈øe Ance≈øtors we ≈øhall ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ y more, when we come to treat of that Family) coming to an unexpected and acciden
‚Ä¢ al end, as al≈øo without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1422 Fre
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ rick the Warlike, Marque≈øs of Mi≈ønia, and Landtgrave of Thuringe, Son of Frederick the Strong, was inve≈øted in the Electoral Dignity by the Emperor Sigi≈ømund, An. 1425. whence ‚Ä¢ he Marque≈ø≈øes of Mi≈ønia were de≈øcended, the ‚Ä¢ revity of our de≈øign will not permit us ‚Ä¢ o di≈øcour≈øe in this place; Tho≈øe that are de
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ rous, may be informed in that matter, by con≈øulting the Learned Spener's Sylloge Genealogica „Äà‚óä„Äâ Famili√¢ Witekinde√¢ Saxonic√¢. Now Frederick
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ d opened an Univer≈øity at Leip≈øick, ≈øome Years before he was made Elector, viz. 1209. ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ is Prince had al≈øo many Wars during his Government, as namely, in Franconia, with the Poles in Born≈øia; with the Counts of Schwartz
‚Ä¢ urg, Heldrungen, and Hohen≈øtein in Thuringia: Moreover, with the Elector of Brandenburg; and la≈øtly, with the Bohemians or Hu≈ø≈øites, by whom his Forces were defeated, with a very great Slaughter, An. 1426. His Death bears
date two Years after; and his Dutche≈øs was Catharine, Daughter of Henry Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, who bore him this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item: 1. Frederick, born Aug. 24. 1412. of whom in the next Section.
2. Sigi≈ømund, Bi≈øhop of Wurtzburg, born 1416. decea≈øed of a Drop≈øie, 1457.
3. Henry, born 1422. decea≈øed 1435.
4. Anne, married to Lewis the Third, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe; decea≈øed 1463.
5. Catharine, married in 1441. to Frederick the Second, Elector of Brandenburg. And,

6. William, born 1425. who had the Landtgrave≈øhip of Thuringe, a≈ø≈øigned him for his Patrimony. At fir≈øt he had Wars with his Brother; but in the end they were reconciled, and agreed very well. In ≈øhort, he refu≈øed the Crown of Bohemia, when offer'd: Took particular care for ≈øuppre≈ø≈øing the notorious In≈øolencies of the Robbers, that then infe≈øted his Countries: And after the decea≈øe of Anne of Au≈øtria, Daughter of Albert the Third, his fir≈øt Wife, An. 1462. took the Lady Catharine de Branden≈øtein, to his Second: By the fir≈øt of which he had I≈ø≈øue Two Daughters,
1. Anne, born 1453. betrothed to Henry Duke of Mun≈øterberg; but died before the Marriage was con≈øummated; And,
2. Margaret, married to John Elector of Brandenburg; decea≈øed 1511.

div.p:
Wherefore William ≈øeeing him≈øelf de≈øtitute of I≈ø≈øue Male, adopted Erne≈øtus and Albertus,
his Brother Frederick's Sons; and departed this World, 1482.

¬ß. II. Frederick the Second, who ≈øucceeded his Father in Mi≈ønia, and the Electorate, ≈øuffered very much from the Hu≈ø≈øites: He would not be prevailed with to make War upon the Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg. He departed this Life Sept. 7. 1464. having had to Wife Margaret, Daughter of Erne≈øte of Au≈øtria, and by her a large Off-≈øpring; whereof Three Sons and a Daughter died Young. Tho≈øe that out
‚Ä¢ iv'd him, were Two Sons, and Four Daughters, whom we ≈øhall-≈øet down in the following Order, viz.

list.item: 1. Amalia, the Wife of Lewis the Rich, Duke of Bavaria, born 1435. decea≈øed Nov. 18. 1502.
2. Anne, born 1436. married to Albert Achilles, Elector of Brandenburg, Nov. 12. 1458. decea≈øed Oct. 31. 1512.
3. Erne≈øtus, born March 25. 1441. of whom in the next Section, as Author and Progenitor of the Erne≈øtine Line.
4. Albert, born July 27. 1443. of whom ≈øee more below, in the Albertine Line.

5. Hedewig, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, who had much ado with the Inhabitants of that Place, yet Ma≈øter'd 'em in the end, by the a≈ø≈øi≈øtance of her Brother, Duke Albert, commanding at the ≈øame time the Roland, they had ≈øet up in ≈øign of Liberty to be thrown down: This Lady departed this Life Nov. 12. 1511. And,
6. Margaret, Lady Abbe≈øs of Seu≈øelitz.

div.head: Of the Erne≈øtine Line.
div.p: ¬ß. III. ERne≈øtus, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dignity of Elector, was a Wi≈øe Prince, and very happy in reconciling the Differences of Princes. He maintained the ≈øtricte≈øt Friend≈øhip with his Brother Albert, with whom he admini≈øtred all things (as it were) in Common. He bought the Dutchy of Sagan in Sile≈øia, of the la≈øt Duke thereof, for 55000 Hungarian Crowns. Moreover, he went to Rome, where he was pre≈øented with a Ro≈øe of Gold, by Pope Sixtus the Fourth. And la≈øt of all changed this Life for a better, in the Year 1486. His Dutche≈øs was Elizabeth, Daughter of Albert the Third, Duke of Bavaria, decea≈øed 1484. having born him this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item: 1. Chri≈øtina, born Sept. 28. 1462. married to John, King of Sweden and Denmark, 1478. decea≈øed 1531.

2. Frederick the Third, born 1463. who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Electorate, and was ≈øurnamed The Wi≈øe. He built the Ca≈øtle at Wittenberg; where he likewi≈øe opened an Univer≈øity, in the Year 1502. He reconciled Philip, Elector Palatine to the Emperor Maximilian, after who≈øe decea≈øe he might have been elected Emperor him≈øelf, but refu≈øed it. He appea≈øed the Commonalty of Erfurdt, when in uproar again≈øt the Senate. He ≈øtood up in Luther's defence, at his fir≈øt ≈øetting the Reformation on foot, ordering him
a Guard for his ≈øafety at Wurtzburg, in his return from the Dyet at Worms, An. 1521. La≈øt of all, this Religious Prince departed this Life, May 5. 1525. in the 63 d. Year of his Age, ju≈øt after the Ri≈øing of the Boors, having liv'd a Batchellor, and been long troubled with the Stone.
3. Albert the Second, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz, born 1464. not long liv'd; for he died May 1. 1484.
4. Erne≈øte, born 1466. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, 1476. made Admini≈øtrator of Halber≈øtadt, 1489. decea≈øed in the Ca≈øtle at Hall, 1513.
5. John, born June 29. 1469. of whom in the next Section, as only Propagator of this Line.
6. Wolfgang, decea≈øed an Infant. And,
7. Margaret, married to Henry Duke of Brun≈øwick, of the Line of Zell; decea≈øed Dec. 7. 1528.

div.p:
¬ß. IV. John, ≈øucceeded his Brother in the Electoral Dignity, and gave a total defeat to the Rebellious Boors; taking their Leader, Thomas Muntzer, Pri≈øoner. In 1529. he, with ≈øome other Princes, entred their ≈øolemn Prote≈øtation again≈øt the de≈øigns of the Catholicks. The Year after, he pre≈øented the Prote≈øtant Confe≈ø≈øion to the Emperor Charles the Fifth; and cau≈øed its Apology to be written: Moreover, he was Author of the League of Smalkald. He departed this Li≈øe Aug. 13. 1532. having had Sophia, Daughter of Magnus Duke of Meckleburg (married to him, An. 1500. decea≈øed
1503.) to his fir≈øt Wife: And Margarets Daughter of Woldemar, Prince of Anhalt, (e≈øpon≈øed by him, in 1513. decea≈øed 1521.) to his Second. By the≈øe Ladies he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. John Frederick, born June 30. 1503. of whom a little below.
2. Mary, born Dec. 6. 1515. ≈øhe was married to Philip Duke of Pomerania; and died 1583.
3. Margaret, born 1518. decea≈øed unmarried 1537.
4. John, born 1513. decea≈øed 1519.
5. John Erne≈øte, born May 10. 1521. who had his Re≈øidence at Coburg, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1553. notwith≈øtanding he had taken to Wife Catharine, Daughter of Philip, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg.

Return we therefore to John Frederick, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor, who had ≈øharp Wars with Henry Duke of Brun≈øwick, whom at length he took Pri≈øoner in the Year 1545. As al≈øo afterwards with the Emperor Charles the Fifth. But by him he was beaten, and ≈øuffered the ≈øame fate with Henry, being taken Pri≈øoner near the Wood of Lochin, not far from Mulberg, on the 24th of April, 1546. whereupon he was degraded from the Elector≈øhip, and kept in Pri≈øon till 1552. at which time he was ≈øet at liberty, but ≈øurviv'd it only two Years. The Partner of his Bed and Fortunes was Sibil, Daughter of John the Third, Duke of Cleves. by whom he had this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item:
1. John Frederick the Second, Duke of Saxony, born Jan. 8. 1529. This Prince
founded the Univer≈øity of Jena, by his Father's Orders, An. 1548. which had afterwards the Emperor's Confirmation in 1558. After this he was ≈øeized, and put in Cu≈øtody by command of the Emperor, as one of Grumbach's Complices, and for that he had protected him; upon which account he had his Ca≈øtle of Grimmen≈øtein likewi≈øe demoli≈øhed. He departed this Life in Pri≈øon, where he had been kept 28 Years, on the 9th day of May, 1595. The Partner of his Bed and Fortunes, was Elizabeth, Daughter of Frederick the Third, Elector Palatine (for Agnes of He≈ø≈øe his fir≈øt Wife, died ≈øoon after ≈øhe was Married) who bore him I≈ø≈øue,
1. Ca≈øimire, who had his ≈øeat at Coburg, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, 1633. And,
2. John Erne≈øte, who likewi≈øe had the ≈øame Fate with him, dying I≈ø≈øuele≈øs, 1638. His other two Sons, John Frederick, and Frederick died both young.
2. John William, born 1530. of whom more in the next Section.
3. John Erne≈øte, born 1534. decea≈øed 1553. And,
4. John Frederick the younger, born 1538. decea≈øed, 1565.

div.p:
¬ß. V. Return we therefore to John William, in who≈øe I≈ø≈øue alone this Line was continued. He departed this Life 1573. having had to Wife, Su≈øan Dorothy, Daughter of Frederick
the Third, Elector Palatine, decea≈øed 1592. and by her this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Frederick William, born Ap. 25. 1562. who, in the divi≈øion of his Father's Inheritance, 'twixt him and his Brethren, had Aldenburg a≈ø≈øigned for his Patrimony. The Prince admini≈øtred the Electorate, during the Minority of his Cou≈øin Elector Chri≈øtian the Second; and departed this Life July 7. 1602. His fir≈øt Dutche≈øs was Sophia, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher Duke of Wurtenburg, who dying in 1592. he took to his Second Wife, the Lady Anne Mary, Daughter of Philip Lewis, Prince Palatine of Newburg, decea≈øed 1643. By the≈øe he had a numerous Off-≈øpring, whereof we ≈øhall mention only Seven, the other Five dying Young. Their names were,
1. Dorothy Sophia, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, born 1587. decea≈øed 1645.
2. John Philip, born 1597. decea≈øed 1639. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Elizabeth, Daughter of Henry Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, an only Daughter; Elizabeth Sophia, born Oct. 10. 1619. married to Erne≈øtus, Duke of Sax Gotha, decea≈øed 1680.
3. Anne Sophia, born 1598. married to Charles Frederick, Duke of Mun≈øterberg; decea≈øed 1641.
4. Frederick, born 1599. and Slain in 1215. at a Battel fought not far from Nyenburg on the We≈øer.
5. John William the Second, born 1600. decea≈øed 1632.
6. Dorothy, born June 16. 1601. married to her Cou≈øin-Germain, Albert, Duke of Sax-Ey≈øenach, decea≈øed 1675.
7. Frederick William the Second, born Feb. 12. 1603. decea≈øed 1669. having had Sophia Elizabeth, Daughter of Chri≈øtian William of Brandenburg, who departed this Life, An. 1650. to his fir≈øt Wife; and Magdalen Sibil, Daughter of John George the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, decea≈øed 1668. to his Second. By the la≈øt he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Chri≈øtianus, born 1654. decea≈øed 1663.
2. Joan Magdalen, born 1656. married to John Adolph, Duke of Saxon-Wei≈ø≈øenfeld, 1671. decea≈øed 1686. And,
3. Frederick William the Third, born 1657. who indeed ≈øucceeded his Father, but did not long ≈øurvive him; for he died in 1672. and the fifteenth of his Age.
2. John, born 1570. of whom more in the next Section, as Propagator of the Branch of Weimar.
3. Mary, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, born 1571. decea≈øed 1610.

¬ß. VI. John the Second had the Principality of Weimar a≈ø≈øigned him for his Inheritance; and died Oct. 31. 1605. His Wife was Dorothy Mary, Daughter of Joachim Erne≈øte, Prince of Anhalt, who departed this Life 1617. having born him this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. John Erne≈øte the Fourth, born Feb. 21. 1594. an excellent Prince, and perfectly skill'd in Martial Affairs: He died in Hungary, Dec. 4. 1626. having given ≈øignal proofs of his Courage on all occa≈øions.
2. John William, decea≈øed an In≈øant.
3. Frederick the Seventh, born March 1. 1596. and Slain at the Battel fought in Brabant, 'twixt Don Gon≈øalvo de Corduba the Au≈øtrian General, and Chri≈øtian Duke of Brun≈øwick, and his Ally the Count de Mansfeldt, An. 1622.
4. John, born 1597. decea≈øed 1604.
5. William the Second, born Ap. 2. 1598. of whom in the next.
6. Anonymus, the time of who≈øe Nativity is uncertain.
7. Albert the Third, born July 27. 1599. who≈øe Re≈øidence was at Ey≈øenach, after the decea≈øe of his Kin≈øman, the Duke of that Place; where him≈øelf al≈øo died on the 20th. of Sept. 1644. leaving no I≈ø≈øue by his Wife, Dorothy of Altemburg.
8. John Frederick the Fourth, born Sept. 19. 1600. decea≈øed Oct. 17. 1628.
9. Erne≈øtus the Third, born Dec. 25. 1601. of whom more in the Eighth Section, as Propagator of the Branch of Gotha.
10. Frederick William the Fourth, born Feb. 7. 1602. decea≈øed Aug. 16. 1619.
11. Bernhard, born Aug. 6. 1604. This Prince filled the whole Earth with his Fame; and for Courage and Conduct, was looked upon as one of the greate≈øt
Generals of the Age. By his ≈øole Bravery the Victory was obtained in the Battel of Lutz, after the King of Sweden fell. The ≈øame Year (viz. 1632.) he po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed him≈øelf of Bamberg, Cronach, and Hoch≈øtadt. Moreover, he was created Duke of Franconia, in the name of his Swedi≈øh Maje≈øty: Rai≈øed the Siege of Mentz, took Bri≈øac in 1638. and la≈øt of all departed this Life at Newburg, July 8. 1639. His Body was kept at Bri≈øac, till 1655. when it was remov'd from thence by his Brethren, and repo≈øed in the Monument of his Ance≈øtor, with great Solemnity.

div.head: Of the Branch of Weimar.
div.p:
¬ß. VII. REturn we now to William the Second, Author and Propagator of the Branch of Weimar, a Prince no le≈øs acquainted with the Arts of War, than Peace. He took upon him the Government of this Principality, upon the decea≈øe of his Elder Brother John Erne≈øte; and departed this Life on the 20th of May, 1662. His Wife was Eleanor Dorothy, Daughter of John George Prince of Anhalt; who died in the Year 1664. having born him this following I≈ø≈øue;
1. William, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1626.
2. John Erne≈øte the Fifth, born Sept. 11. 1627. of whom a little below.
3. John William the Third, born Aug. 16. 1630. decea≈øed May 16. 1639.
4. Adolph William, born May 15. 1632. who had Ey≈øenach a≈ø≈øigned him for his Appennage, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, Nov. 21. 1668. notwith≈øtanding he had had Five Sons, who all died Young, by Mary Elizabeth, Daughter of Augu≈øtus, Duke of Brun≈øwick.
5. John George, born July 11. 1634. at fir≈øt he kept his Court at Marckful, but after the death of his Brother John Adolph of Ey≈øenach, ≈øucceeding to that Principality, remov'd it thither. In 1661. he married the Lady Johannetta, Daughter of Erne≈øtus Count de Seyne, by whom he had,
1. Eleanor Erdmuth Lovi≈øe, born Ap. 13. 1662. married to John Frederick, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg Ansbach, Nov. 4 1681. now a Widow.
2. Frederick Augu≈øt, born Oct. 29. 1663. decea≈øed at Presburg, Sept. 31. 1684 of a Wound received at the Siege of Buda.
3. John George, born July 25. 1665.
4. Maximilian Henry, Twins, born Oct. 17. 1666. the fir≈øt of which died July 22. 1668. the other is ≈øtill living. And,
5. John William, Twins, born Oct. 17. 1666. the fir≈øt of which died July 22. 1668. the other is ≈øtill living.
6. Lovi≈øe, born Ap. 18. 1668. decea≈øed 1669.
7. Frederica Elizabeth, born May 5. 1669.
8. Erne≈øtus Gu≈øtavus, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1672.
6. Wilhelmina Eleanor, born June 7. 1636. decea≈øed Ap. 1. 1653.
7. Bernhard the Second, born Feb. 21. 1638. who kept his Court at Jena, where he departed this Life May 3. 1678. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Mary de Tremouville.
1. Charlotte Mary, born 1669. and married in 1683. to William Erne≈øte, Duke of Saxon Weimar. And,
2. John William, born March 28. 1675.
8. Frederick the Eighth, born 1640. decea≈øed 1656.
9. Dorothy Mary, born 1641. married to Maurice, Duke of Saxony, and Admini≈øtrator of Naumburg, 1656. decea≈øed July 11. 1675.

Of the≈øe John Erne≈øte ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy of Saxon-Weimar; and kept his Court in the Ca≈øtle of Wilbelmsburg, ≈øo called from his Father William. On the 14th. of Aug. 1656. he took to Wife the Lady Chri≈øtina Elizabeth, Daughter of John Chri≈øtian, Duke of Hol≈øtein in Sunderburg, who departed this Life June 7. 1679. as did him≈øelf on the 25th. of May, four Years after. His I≈ø≈øue were,
1. Anne Dorothy, born Nov. 12. 1657. made Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, 1685.
2. VVilhelmina Chri≈øtina, born Nov. 26. 1658. and married to Chri≈øtian VVilliam, Count Schwartzburg, 1684.
3. Eleanor Sophia, born March 22. 1660. married July 9. 1684. to Philip Prince of Mersburg.
4. VVilliam Erne≈øte, the pre≈øent Duke of Saxon VVeimar, born Oct. 19. 1661. who, in 1683. took to Wife his Cou≈øin-Germain
Charlotte Mary, Daughter of Bernhard, Duke of Sax-Jena. And,
5. John Erne≈øtus, born June 22. 1664.

div.head: Of the Branch of Gotha.
div.p:
¬ß. VIII. ERne≈øte the Third, one of the Sons of John the Second, was Propagator of this Branch: A Prince (to u≈øe the words of the Noble Im Hoff) for his great Sincerity, for his Zeal to Religion, for his Political Prudence, and Oeconomical Indu≈øtry, ju≈øtly to be preferred before any that ever ruled: One in whom the divine Promi≈øe was apparently verified, viz. To tho≈øe that make it their fir≈øt care to ≈øeek the Kingdom of God and his Righteou≈øne≈øs, all other things ≈øhall be added. He was at the Battle of Lutz. In 1641. he obtain'd the Principality of Sax-Gotha: And great part of the County of Henneberg, in 1660. In 1672 Altemburg and Coburg fell to him, by the Death of Frederick VVilliam the Third, mentioned before in the fifth Section, Numb. 7. In ≈øhort, he rebuilt the Ca≈øtle of Gotha, formerly called Grimmen≈øtein; but by him Frieden≈øtein; Was Author of the VVeimar Bible; and departed this World, March 26. 1675. His Dutche≈øs was Sophia Elizabeth, Daughter of John Philip, Duke of Sax Aldenherg, decea≈øed Dec. 25. 1680. which happy Match gave Birth to this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. John Erne≈øtus, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1638.
2. Elizabeth Dorothy, born Jan. 8. 1640. and married in 1666. to Lewis of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt; who≈øe Relict ≈øhe now is.
3. John Erne≈øtus the Sixth, born 1641. decea≈øed 1657.
4. Chri≈øtian, born 1642. decea≈øed the ≈øame Year.
5. Sophia, born 1643. decea≈øed 1657.
6. Joan, born 1645. decea≈øed 1657.
7. Frederick the Ninth, the pre≈øent Duke of Sax-Gotha, born July 15. 1646. who keeps his Court at Frieden≈øtein-Ca≈øtle; and has had two Wives: The one being Magdalen Sibil, Daughter of Augu≈øtus Duke of Saxony, and Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, decea≈øed Jan. 20. 1681. whom he married on the 19th of Augu≈øt, 1669. The other, Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Frederick Marque≈øs of Baden, Albert, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg An≈øpach's Widow. His I≈ø≈øue by the fir≈øt, were,
1. Anne Sophia, born Dec. 22. 1670.
2. Magdalen Sibil, born 1671. decea≈øed 1673.
3. Dorothy Mary, born Jan. 22. 1674.
4. Frederica, March 25. 1675.
5. Frederick, July 28. 1676.
6. John William, Oct. 4. 1677.
7. Elizabeth, born 1679. decea≈øed 1680. And,
8. Joan, born Oct. 1. 1680.
8. Albert, born May 24. (as others the 16th.) 1648. who had Coburg for his Inheritance, and Mary Elizabeth, Daughter of Augu≈øtus the Second, Duke of Brun≈øwick, his
Cou≈øin-Germain Adolph of Ey≈øenach's Relict, to his Wife; which Lady decea≈øed in February 1687. having been brought to Bed on Sept. 1. 1677. of an only Son, named Erne≈øtus Augu≈øtus, who lived b ‚Ä¢ t till the 17th. of Augu≈øt, in the following Year.
9. Bernhard, born Sept. 15. 1649. who has his Re≈øidence in Meinung Ca≈øtle on the Werra, in the County of Henneberg. On Nov. 20. 1671. he took Mary Hedewig, Daughter of George the Second, Prince of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, to his fir≈øt Wife, after who≈øe decea≈øe, which happened Ap. 19. 1680. he in 81. married Elizabeth Eleanor, Daughter of Anthony Ulrick, Duke of Brun≈øwick, John George, Duke of Meckleburg's Widow, which Lady is likewi≈øe ≈øince decea≈øed, An. 1687. His I≈ø≈øue now living, by the fir≈øt Venture, are,
1. Erne≈øtus Lewis, born Oct. 7. 1672.
2. Bernhard, Oct. 28. 1673.
3. Frederick William, Feb. 16. 1679. And,
4. George Erne≈øte, March 26. 1680.
As al≈øo an only Daughter, born Dec. 3. 1081. and named Elizabeth Erne≈øta Augu≈øta, by the Second.

list.item: 10. Henry, born Nov. 19. 1650. who Re≈øides at Romhild in the County of Henneberg; and 1676. e≈øpou≈øed Mary Elizabeth, of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt; but (as far as we can learn) has no I≈ø≈øue by her.

11. Chri≈øtian, born Jan. 6. 1653. who≈øe Seat is at Ei≈øenberg, not far from Jena. On the 13th. of Feb. 1677. he married
Chri≈øtiana, Daughter of Chri≈øtian Duke of Saxony, and Admini≈øtrator of Mersburg, who died two Years after; and he took Sophia Mary, Daughter of Lewis, Prince of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, to his ≈øecond Wife. By the fir≈øt Venture he has an only Daughter, the Lady Chri≈øtina, born March 4. 1679.
12. Dorothy Mary, born Feb. 12. 1654. decea≈øed unmarried, 1684.

13. Erne≈øtus, born July 12. 1655. who has his Seat at Eisfeld, in the Confines of Thuringia and Franconia. On the 10th. of Feb. 1680. he e≈øpou≈øed Sophia Frederica, Daughter of George Frederick Prince Waldeck, who was brought to Bed of a Son, Aug. 21. 1681. whom they named Erne≈øtus Frederick; as al≈øo of a Daughter, who≈øe name is Sophia Charlotte, in the Year following.
14. John Philip, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1657.

15. John Erne≈øtus, born Aug. 22. 1658. who Re≈øides at Salfeld, with his Wife Sophia Hedewig, Daughter of Chri≈øtian Duke of Saxony-Mersburg, whom he married Feb. 10. 1680. and has I≈ø≈øue by her, Chri≈øtina Sophia, born July 14. 1681. and Chri≈øtian Erne≈øte, born 1683.
16. Joan Elizabeth, born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year, viz. 1660.
17. John Philip, born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year, viz. 1662. And,
18. Sophia Elizabeth. born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year, viz. 1663.

div.head: Of the Albertine Line.
div.p:
¬ß. IX. MAtters thus far cleared, we now return to the Albertine Line; which began in Albert the Fir≈øt, younge≈øt Son of Frederick the Second, Elector of Saxony; as we ob≈øerved above in the ≈øecond Section. He was born July 27. 1443. and by rea≈øon of his tall Stature, ≈øurnamed Roland. In 1468. he a≈ø≈øi≈øted George, King of Bohemia, again≈øt Matthias, King of Hungary. In 1471. he went into Bohemia, to accept the Crown of that Kingdom, then offered him, where he was in great danger of his Life, yet happily e≈øcaped; and afterwards went in Pilgrimage to the Holy Land. In 1491. he was In≈øtalled Knight of the Golden Fleece. Moreover, he reduced the Low-Countries to the Obedience of the Emperor Maximilian, and obtained a grant of Succe≈ø≈øion to the Dutchies of Juliers and Mons, in ca≈øe tho≈øe in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, or their Heirs, ≈øhould fail in I≈ø≈øue Male. In 1459. he married Sidonia, Daughter of George Podiebrach, King of Bohemia, which Lady departed this Life, An. 1500. as did him≈øelf a little afterwards, at the Siege of Groeningen, on Sept. 12. in the ≈øame Year, and 57th. of his Age, having had I≈ø≈øue Eight Children, whereof Four died in their Infancy. The re≈øt were,
1. Catharine, born July 28. 1468. and married after the decea≈øe of Signi≈ømund of Au≈øtria, her fir≈øt Husband (which happened in 1500.) to Erick the Elder, Duke of Brun≈øwick; ≈øhe died 1524.
2. George Barbatus, born Aug. 27. 1471. who ≈øucceeded his Father; and had I≈ø≈øue by Barbara, Daughter of Ca≈øimire, King of Poland,
1. John the Fir≈øt. And, both decea≈øed before him.
2. Frederick, both decea≈øed before him.

As al≈øo Two Daughters,
1. Magdalen, married to Joachim the Second, Elector of Brandenburg, An. 1524. decea≈øed 1534. And,
2. Chri≈øtina, who was born Dec. 15. 1505. married to Philip the Stout, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, and died 1549. As for their Father George, he departed this World Ap. 17. 1539.
3. Henry, ≈øurnamed The Pious, born Oct. 25. 1474. elected Grand Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order, 1498. decea≈øed Dec. 20. 1510.

¬ß. X. This Henry ≈øucceeded his Brother George, and was the only Propagator of the Albertine Line: He made Profe≈ø≈øion of the Reformed Religion, and entred into the League of Smalcald. His Wife was Catharine, Daughter of Magnus the Second, Duke of Meckleburg, who bore him this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item:
1. Maurice, born May 11. 1525. who ≈øucceeded his Father, and ≈øerved the Emperor in Hungary, again≈øt the Turks; as al≈øo in Flanders, again≈øt the French. Afterwards he carried on a bloody War again≈øt his Cou≈øin John Frederick the Elector, who being degraded of that Dignity, he was inve≈øted with the ≈øame, by the Emperor
Charles the Fifth, An. 1548. In 1551. he made an Alliance with the French King, and ≈øeveral of the German Princes; and then undertook an Expedition again≈øt the Imperiali≈øts. The Year after, he was concluded in the Tran≈øaction of Pa≈ø≈øaw, yet Slain in 1553. at the Battel of Siver≈øku≈øe in the Dutchy of Lunenburg. 'Tis likewi≈øe ob≈øervable, he founded Three famous Schools (or Colleges), one at Mei≈øen on the Elbe; another at Grimma, on the Multaw, and the third at Porta on the Saal. His Wife was Agnes, Daughter of Philip, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, by whom he had only a Daughter that ≈øurviv'd him; named Anne, married to Prince William of Orange, An. 1561. decea≈øed 1577.
2. Severinus, born 1522. decea≈øed at In≈øpruck, Oct. 10. 1533.

3. Augu≈øtus, born July 30. 1526. who was his Brother's Succe≈ø≈øor in the Electorate, and renewed the Act of Confraternity, with the Hou≈øes of Brandenburg and He≈ø≈øe. His Authority was always very great in the Empire; in≈øomuch as all things (in a manner) were managed by him: Moreover, he laid up a very great Trea≈øure. In 1580. he cau≈øed the form of Concord to be publi≈øhed, and departed this Life at Six a Clock in the Evening, on Feb. 11. 1586, his fir≈øt Wife was the Prince≈øs Anne, Daughter of Chri≈øtian the Third, King of Denmark, who died Oct. 1 1585. And his ≈øecond Agnes Hedewig, Daughter of Joachim Erne≈øte, Prince of Anhalt. By the
fir≈øt Venture he had Fifteen Children, Eleven whereof died Young. The re≈øt were,
1. Elizabeth, born 1552. married to John Ca≈øimire, Count Palatine of the Rhine, Fourth Son of the Elector Frederick the Third, An. 1568. decea≈øed 1590.
2. Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, of whom more in the next Section.
3. Dorothy, born 1563. married to Henry Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, 1585. decea≈øed 1587.
4. Anne, born 1567. married to John Ca≈øimire, Duke of Sax-Coburg, 1585. decea≈øed 1613.
4. Aemilia, e≈øpou≈øed by George, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, An. 1532. decea≈øed 1591.
5. Sibil, affianced in 1540, to Francis the Fir≈øt, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg. And,
6. Sidonia, married to Erick the Younger, Duke of Brun≈øwick, 1545. decea≈øed Jan. 4. 1575.

div.p:
¬ß. XI. Return we now to Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, who ≈øucceeded his Father Augu≈øtus in the Electoral Dignity, born Nov. 3. 1560. In 1582. he married Sophia, Daughter of John George, Elector of Brandenburg, who departed this World 1622. as him≈øelf had done many Years before, viz. 1591. His Children are ≈øaid to have been as follow;
1. Chri≈øtian the Second, born Sept. 23. 1583. who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Electorate, under the Government and Tuition of his Cou≈øin, Duke Frederick William of
Aldenburg. He commanded his Chancellor Nicholas Crelley to be beheaded. In 1610. he obtain'd of the Emperor Rudolph, to be inve≈øted in the Dutchies o ‚Ä¢
Juliers, Cleves, and Mons. The Year following he died of an Apoplexy, cau≈øed by taking too large a draught of Small-Beer, after over-heating him≈øelf with Tilting. Nor left he any I≈ø≈øue, tho' married to Hedewig, Daughter of Frederick the Second, King of Denmark.
2. John George the Fir≈øt, born March 5. 1585. of whom a little lower.
3. Anne Sabina, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1586.
4. Sophia, born 1587. ≈øhe was married to Francis Duke of Pomerania, and died 1635.
5. Elizabeth, born 1588. decea≈øed July 4. 1589.
6. Augu≈øtus, Admini≈øtrator of Naumburg, born Sept. 7. 1589. In 1612, he married Elizabeth, Daughter of Henry Julius Duke of Brun≈øwick; but died without I≈ø≈øue, Dec. 26. 1615. And,
7. Dorothy, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, born 1591. decea≈øed 1617.

Wherefore John George the Fir≈øt, in who≈øe I≈ø≈øue the de≈øcent of this Line was continued, ≈øucceeded in the Electorate at his Brother Chri≈øtian's decea≈øe, having fir≈øt Travelled Incognito into many Foreign Parts. In 1612. he took on him the Vicar≈øhip of the Empire, during the Interregnum. In 1617. he cau≈øed the fir≈øt Jubilee to be Celebrated in memory of the Reformation began by Luther an hundred
Years before: Another in 1630. for the Augu≈øtane Confe≈ø≈øion: And a third 1655. for the Peace of Religion, or Tran≈øaction at Pa≈ø≈øaw, cau≈øing ≈øeveral Medals to be Coined on tho≈øe Occa≈øions. He was a mo≈øt dutiful Son to his Mother, for whom he had a more than ordinary Veneration. He elected Matthias, Ferdinand the Second, Ferdinand the Third, and Ferdinand the Fourth, King of the Romans; and refu≈øed the Offer of the Bohemian Crown. About 1631. he leagued him≈øelf with the Swede, again≈øt the Emperor, with whom he again made Peace, in 1635. leaving his Ally the Swede: Who thereupon lay very hard on him, till a general Peace was once more re≈øtored to the Empire, An. 1648. This excellent Prince departed this Life in the Year 1656. and the 72d. of his Age. His fir≈øt Wife was Sibil Elizabeth, Daughter of Frederick Duke of Wurtenburg, who died 1606. And his Second, Magdalen Sibil, Daughter of Albert Frederick, Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia, and Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, whom he e≈øpou≈øed in the Year 1607. and had I≈ø≈øue by her, as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Anonymus, born July 18. 1608.
2. Sophia Eleanor, born Nov. 23. 1609. married to George the Second, Prince of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, 1627. decea≈øed June 2. 1671.
3. Mary Elizabeth, born Nov. 12. 1610. married to Frederick Duke of Sle≈øwick, 1630. decea≈øed 1684.
4. Chri≈øtian Albert, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1612.
5. John George the Second, born May 31. 1613. of whom more in the next Section.
6. Augu≈øtus the Third, Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, born Aug. 13. 1614. of whom in the 13th. Section.
7. Chri≈øtian the Third, Admini≈øtrator of Mersburg, born Oct. 27. 1615. of whom in the 14th. Section.

8. Magdalen Sibil, born Sept. 23. 1617. and remarried (after the decea≈øe of Chri≈øtian. Prince Royal of Denmark, Elde≈øt Son of King Chri≈øtian the Fourth, her fir≈øt Hu≈øband) to Frederick William the Second, Duke of Sax-Aldenburg; ≈øhe died Jan. 6. 1668.
9. Maurice, Admini≈øtrator of Naumburg, born March 24. 1619. of whom below in the 15th. Section.
10. Henry, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1622.

div.p:
¬ß. XII. Return we now to his Serene Highne≈øs John George the Second, a Prince always Loyal to God and his Country (the Empire.) After the decea≈øe of the Emperor Ferdinand the Third, he was Vicar of the Empire, and pre≈øent at the Election of a new King of the Romans. In 1671. he entred into Articles of a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion, with Julius Francis, Duke of the Lower Saxony. In 1638. he took to Wife the Prince≈øs Magdalen Sibil, Daughter of Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg-Culembach, decea≈øed 1687. whereas him≈øelf died at Freiburg, Aug. 22. 1680. leaving I≈ø≈øue,
1. Sibil Mary, born 1642. decea≈øed 1643.
2. Erdmuth Sophia, born Feb. 15. 1644. married to Chri≈øtian Erne≈øte, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg-Bareith,
1662. decea≈øed 1670. and an only Son, viz.
3. John George the Third, His pre≈øent Highne≈øs, born June 20. 1647. who entred on the Government of the Electorate, after the decea≈øe of his Father, of ever ble≈ø≈øed Memory, which he has ≈øince managed with much Prudence and Moderation. We need not here mention the many Negotiations he has underwent for the publick ≈øafety; nor his other Illu≈øtrious and Immortal Actions, ≈øince they are ≈øo vi≈øible to all Good Men. On Oct. 9. 1666. he, with great Solemnity, e≈øpou≈øed the Prince≈øs Anne Sophia, Daughter of Frederick, late King of Denmark, by whom he has I≈ø≈øue,
1. John George the Fourth, Heir Apparent, born Oct. 17. 1668. And,
2. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born May 12. 1670.

¬ß. XIII. Return we now to Augu≈øtus, Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, who died An. 1680. having had Two Wives; and by them a numerous Off-≈øpring. The fir≈øt of the≈øe was, Anne Mary, Daughter of Adolph Frederick, Duke of Meckleburg-Swerin; married to him 1646. (or 47.) decea≈øed 1669. having born him Twelve Children: The Other was, Joan Walpurg, Daughter of George William, Count de Leining, by whom he had twice I≈ø≈øue: This la≈øt Lady died a Widow, in the Year 1689. The Male I≈ø≈øue were,
1. John Adolph, Duke of Saxony in Wei≈ø≈øenfeld (or Sax-Wei≈ø≈øenfeld) born Nov. 2. 1649.
and married Oct. 25. 1671. to Joan Magdalen, Daughter of Frederick the Second, Duke of Sax-Altenburg, who died in the Year 1686. having born him I≈ø≈øue, as followeth, viz.
1. Magdalen Sibil, born Sept. 3. 1673.
2. Augu≈øtus Frederick, born 1674. decea≈øed 1675.
3. John Adolph, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1676.
4. John George, born July 13. 1677.
5. Anonymus, 1678.
6. Joanna Wilhelmina, born Jan. 20. 1682.
7. Frederick William, born 1681. decea≈øed 1683.
8. Chri≈øtian, born Feb. 23. 1682. And,
9. Anne Mary, June 17. 1683.
2. Augu≈øtus the Younger, born Dec. 3. 165 ‚Ä¢ and cho≈øen Provo≈øt of Magdeburg, by the Chapter thereof, An. 1661. This Prince ≈øerv'd in the King of Sweden's Army, as al≈øo under the Elector of Cologne, but died an untimely Death, in 1674 the very next Year after his Marriage with Charlotte, Daughter of Frederick Prince of He≈ø≈øe in E≈øchwegen, whom he left a Widow, but ≈øince married to John Adolph, Count de Tecklenburg.
3. Chri≈øtian, born June 25. 1655. who all along behav'd him≈øelf with great Bravery in His Electoral Highne≈øs of Saxony's Service; upon which account he was made Field Mar≈øhal Lieutenant: Neverthele≈øs, this Courageous Prince lo≈øt his Life at the Siege of Mentz, in Augu≈øt 1689.
4. Henry, born Sept. 29. 1657. who ≈øucceeded his Brother Augustus in the Provo≈øtry of Magdeburg; and is al≈øo a Colonel in the Elector of Brandenburg's Forces. In 1689. he e≈øpou≈øed Henrica Agnes, Daughter of John George the Second, Prince of Anhalt-De≈ø≈øaw.
5. Albert, born Ap. 14. 1659. who turn'd Catholick; and married a great Fortune on the Rhine.
6. Frederick, born Nov. 20. 1673. And,
7. Maurice, born Jan. 5. 1676

The Daughters were all by the fir≈øt Venture, and thus named,
1. Magdalen Sibil, born 1648. married to Frederick, Duke of Sax-Gotha, 1669. decea≈øed Jan. 20. 1681.
2. Anne Mary, born 1653. decea≈øed 1671.
3. Sophia, born June 23. 1654. and married to Charles William, Prince of Anhalt-Serve≈øt, An. 1676.
4. Catharine, born 1655. decea≈øed 1663.
5. Chri≈øtina, born 1656. and married June 21. 1676. to Augu≈øtus Frederick, Duke of Hol≈øtein, and Bi≈øhop of Lubeck.
6. Elizabeth, born 1660. decea≈øed 1663. And,
7. Dorothy, born 1662. decea≈øed the Year following.

¬ß. XIV. Now follows Chri≈øtian, Admini≈øtrator of the Bi≈øhoprick of Mersburg, third Son of John George the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, mention'd by us above in the eleventh Section, Numb. 7. born Oct. 27. and married Nov. 19.
1650. to Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Philip Duke o ‚Ä¢
Hol≈øtein-Glucksburg, with whom he now liveth having had I≈ø≈øue by her, as followeth,
1. Magdalen Sophia, born Nov. 19. 1651 decea≈øed 1675.
2. John George, born 1652. decea≈øed 1654.
3. Chri≈øtian, born Nov. 19. 1653. In 1679 he took to Wife Erdmuth Eleanor, his Uncle Maurice of Naumburg's Daughter and has I≈ø≈øue,
1. Chri≈øtian, born Nov. 7. 1680.
2. Maurice William, born Oct. 11. 168 ‚Ä¢ And,
3. Augu≈øtus Frederick, born March 10. 1684.
4. Augu≈øtus, born Feb. 15. 1655. and married in Augu≈øt 1688. to one of Gu≈øtav ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ Adolphus, Duke of Meckleburg Gu≈øtrow ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
Daughters.
5. Philip, born Oct. 26. 1657. who took t ‚Ä¢ Wife Eleanor Sophia, Daughter of Job. Erne≈øtus, Duke of Sax-Weimar, on July 9. 1684.
6. Chri≈øtiana, born 1659. married to Chri≈øtanus, Duke of Sax-Ei≈øenberg, 1677. decea≈øed March 13. 1679.
7. Sophia Hedewig, born June 4. 1660. an ‚Ä¢ married in 1680. to John Erne≈øtus, Duk ‚Ä¢ of Sax-Gotha in Salfeld.
8. Henry, born Sept. 2. 1661. who not lon ‚Ä¢ ≈øince e≈øpou≈øed the Lady Lovi≈øe Elizabet ‚Ä¢
Daughter of Chri≈øtian Ulrick, Duke „Äà‚óä„Äâ
Wurtenburg, of the Branch of Bern≈øtadt „Äà‚óä„Äâ Sile≈øia, by his fir≈øt Wife.
9. Maurice, born 1662. decea≈øed 1664. And,
10. Sibil Mary, born Oct. 28. 1667. the ≈øecond Wife of Chri≈øtian Ulrick, Duke of Wurtenburg and O≈øne, of the Branch of Bern≈øtadt, to whom ≈øhe was married, Oct. 27. 1683.

¬ß. XV. It now remains, we ≈øay ≈øomewhat of Maurice, Admini≈øtrator of the Bi≈øhopricks of Naumburg and Ceitz‚Äî Younge≈øt Son of his Electoral Highne≈øs John George the Fir≈øt, who departed this Life, Dec. 4. 1681. having had Three Wives; who≈øe names were, Sophia Hedewig, Daughter of Philip Duke of Hol≈øtein-Glucksburg, decea≈øed 1652. Dorothy Mary, Daughter of William, Duke of Sax-Weimar, who died July 11. 1675. And Sophia Elizabeth, Daughter of Philip Lewis, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Sunderburg, now a Widow. The Children, by the fir≈øt and ≈øecond Venture, were,
1. John Philip, born 1651. decea≈øed 1652.
2. Maurice, born 1652. decea≈øed the Year following.
3. Eleanor Magdalen, born 1658. decea≈øed 1661.
4. Erdmuth Dorothy, born 1661. and married in 1679. to Chri≈øtian, Prince of Mersburg.
5. Maurice William, Admini≈øtrator of Naumburg, who drew his fir≈øt Breath, March 12. 1664. and has taken to Wife, Mary Amalia, Daughter of Frederick William the Great, Elector of Brandenburg, Charles Prince of Meckleburg-Gu≈øtrow's Widow, whom he married on the 26th of June, 1689. O. S.
6. John George, born 1665. decea≈øed 1666.
7. Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, born Oct. 9. 1666.
8. Frederick Henry, born July 21. 1668.
9. Mary Sophia, born 1670. decea≈øed the Year following.
10. Magdalen Sibil, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1672. And,
11. Wilhelmina Sibilla, born 1675.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of the Saxon Family.
div.p:
¬ß. XVI. WE have already declared, how Frederick the Warlike, Marque≈øs of Mi≈ønia, and Landtgrave of Thuringe, obtained of the Emperour Sigi≈ømund, the Inve≈øtiture of the Electoral Dignity, together with the Palatinate of Saxony, and Burgraviate of Magdeburg, An. 1425. The ≈øame Prince is ≈øuppo≈øed by mo≈øt to have bought the Burgraviate of Mei≈ø≈øen al≈øo. In 1440. William had part of the Dutchy of Luxenbing in Dowry with his Wife. Erne≈øtus the Fir≈øt added Plaven, Voightsberg, Olnitz and Adorff, in the Land of Advocates. The ≈øame Prince bought the Dutchy of Sagan in Sile≈øia, paying down 55000 Hugarian Ducats. Albert the Stout had Ea≈øt Friezland a≈ø≈øigned him, to be held in Fee of the Hou≈øe of Au≈øtria. The Elector Augu≈øtus made the Dioce≈ø≈øes of Naumburg and Mersburg Hereditary to his Family. In 1583. the Principality of Henneberg fell to it, by Right of Agreement to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion; part of which (namely, the Di≈øtrict of Coburg) had been long before this, made over in Dowry to the Marque≈ø≈øes of Mi≈ønia. In 1635. John George the Fir≈øt, recovered
both the Upper and Lower Lu≈øatia' which of old belonged to his Ance≈øtors the Marque≈ø≈øes of Mi≈ønia. In 1648. Augu≈øtus was cho≈øen and declared Admini≈øtrator of the Arch-Bi≈øhoprick of Magdeburg. In 1659. John George the Second obtained the County of Barbie. Moreover, he added Querfurt, Iuterbock, Dam, Borck, Fraven≈øtein, &c. to his other Territories. And la≈øtly, part of the County of Mansfeld, fell into the Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of this Family, by the la≈øt German War, and is called in the German Language, Die Sachwi≈øche Hoheit.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øe.
div.p: ¬ß. XVII. WIlliam, Duke of Saxony ≈øold the Right he had to the Dutchy of Luxenburg to Philip Duke of Burgundy, for 11000 Schillings. In 1549. Elector Maurice made over in Change, the Principality of Sagan in Sile≈øia, to Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, afterwards Emperor. In 1680. upon the decea≈øe of Augu≈øtus, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, that Arch-Bi≈øhoprick, but with the Title of a Dutchy, fell to the Electoral Line of Brandenburg, according to the Tenor of the Pacification of O≈øenburg, great part of the Burgraviate of Magdeburg being annext thereunto at the ≈øame time, to the general ≈øatisfaction of all Parties.

div.head: Of its Preten≈øions.
div.p: ¬ß. XVIII. NOw, Its Preten≈øions are to the Dutchies of Juliers, Cleves and Mons, as al≈øo to that of Sax-Lawenburg.

div.head: CHAP. IX. Of the Hou≈øe of Brandenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THat the mo≈øt Potent and Serene Family of Brandenburg is de≈øcended from the Counts of Zollern in Schwaben, is not to be doubted; but from whence tho≈øe Counts drew their Extraction, doth not ≈øo well appear: Their Opinion ≈øeems to be be≈øt, which gives 'em the ≈øame Original with the Guelphs; yet ≈øo, as not entirely to exclude the Colonna's, a Family of an Italian Extraction al≈øo. In the Catalogue of the≈øe Counts, we find Conrade the Fir≈øt, who flouri≈øhed about the middle of the Twelfth Century, and married Anne of Vohburg, ≈øole Heire≈øs of the la≈øt Burgrave of Nuremburg, whereupon he obtained of the Emperor Frederick Barbaro≈ø≈øa, to be him≈øelf inve≈øted in that Burgraviate. Conrade was followed by Frederick the Fir≈øt, who died 1218. having for his Succe≈ø≈øor, his Elde≈øt Son Conrade the Second, who was ≈øucceeded by his Brother Frederick the Second. This Frederick had Two Sons; Conrade the Third, who gave all his Sub≈øtance to Pious U≈øes, cau≈øing his Three Sons, Frederick, Conrade, and Godfrey, to take the Church Habit: And Frederick the Third, who left Four Sons; John and Frederick, murdered by the Black≈ømiths of Nuremberg's Men; another John, who ≈øucceeded his Father, but did not long outlive him, and Frederick the Fourth to whom the Government
≈øell, upon his Brother John's decea≈øe. Frederick the Fourth had likewi≈øe Four Sons; John, who ≈øucceeded him; Frederick, Bi≈øhop of Ratasbonne and Aich≈øtadt; Berthold, who ≈øucceeded his Brother in the Bi≈øhoprick of Aich≈øtadt; and Albert the Fir≈øt, Partner in the Government with his Brother, John the Second, and Father of Frederick the Fifth, who begot John the Third, Burgrave of Nurenberg, and Frederick the Sixth, the fir≈øt Elector of Brandenburg of the Family of Zollern.

¬ß. II. This Frederick was born 1372. and ≈øerved the Emperor Sigi≈ømund in his Wars; by whom, in regard of his great Merit, he was con≈øtituted Vicar or Warden of the Marck, An. 1411. Afterwards, at a Dyet held at Con≈øtance, An. 1415. He obtained the Electoral Dignity of the ≈øaid Emperor, by the general con≈øent of the other Electors, together with the Marqui≈øate of Brandenburg, paying down, in con≈øideration thereof, 400000 Hungarian Shillings. The Inve≈øtiture was afterwards ≈øolemnly performed in April 1417. In 1427. he built the Ca≈øtle of Coln on the Sprew; being in that part of the City Berlin, which lies on the We≈øt ≈øide of that River. In 1420. he had War with the Pomeranians: With the Hu≈ø≈øites in 1424. And after that with Bernhard, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg. He ≈øold the be≈øt part of the Burgraviate of Nurenburg to the City of that Name; and at length ended his days in the Year 1440. being a Prince highly e≈øteemed for his Power, Prudence, and Courage. His Prince≈øs was Elizabeth, Daughter of Frederick Duke of Bavaria-Land≈øhut, by whom he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. John the Fir≈øt, ≈øurnamed The Alchymi≈øt, born 1401. who loving a quiet retired Life, was content (his Father ordering it ≈øhould be ≈øo) to make over his Preten≈øions to the Government to his Brother Frederick; being ≈øatisfied him≈øelf with ≈øome Cha≈øtellanies or Governments in in Franconia, and in that which is called the Land of Advocates. He departed this Life 1464. having had to Wife Barbara, Daughter of Rudolph, Duke and Elector of Saxony, of the Family of Anhalt, and by her I≈ø≈øue, as followeth,
1. Dorothy, born 1422. and married (after the decea≈øe of Chri≈øtopher, Count Palatine of the Rhine, afterwards King of Denmark, her fir≈øt Husband) to Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, likewi≈øe King of that Country; ≈øhe died 1496.
2. Barbara, born 1423. married to Lewis Gonzaga, Duke of Mantua, 1433. decea≈øed 1481.
3. Rudolph, not long liv'd, born 1424. And,
4. Magdalen, married to Urati≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania; decea≈øed 1451.
2. Frederick the Second, ≈øurnamed Ferreus (or Iron-≈øide) born Nov. 19. 1413. who ≈øucceeded his Father, and founded the Cathedral at Coln, on the Sprew. He refu≈øed the Offer of the Crown of Poland, in 1446. and that of Bohemia, An. 1468. In 1434. the was Protector of the Council of Ba≈øle. In 1455. he redeemed the new Marqui≈øate which was Mortgag'd, paying down 300000 Crowns. In 1451. he
entred into an Hereditary League with William, Duke of Saxony, into which the Family of He≈ø≈øe was al≈øo taken, An. 1457. In 1461. he had War with the Bohemians for Lu≈øatia; as al≈øo with the Duke of Pomerania, about the Succe≈ø≈øion. In 1470. transferring the Electoral Dignity to his Brother Albert, he undertook a Pilgrimage to the Holy Land, but died the Year following, viz. 1471. His Wife was Catharine, Daughter of Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, by whom he had only Two Daughters that out-liv'd him, namely, Margaret, married to Bogi≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania; decea≈øed 1489. and Dorothy to John the Fifth, Duke of Sax Lawenburg, who died 1507.
3. Albert, born Nov. 24. 1414. of whom more, as Pre≈øerver of the Family, in the next Section.
4. Frederick the Third, who had his u≈øual Re≈øidence at Tangermund, but died at Arembourg, 1463. I≈ø≈øuele≈øs as to Males, notwith≈øtanding he had to Wife Agnes, Daughter of Barnim the Eighth, Duke of Pomerania, of whom Two Daughters ≈øurviv'd, Magdalen, born 145‚Äî, and married to Eitelfrederick the Fourth, of Hoben Zollern, and Agnes, to George the Younger of Anhalt.
5. Elizabeth, born 1402. ≈øhe was married to Lewis, Duke of Lignitz, 1418. and died 1450.
6. Cecily, married to William the Viciortous, Duke of Brun≈øwick, 1423. decea≈øed 1449.
7. Margaret, married to Lewis the Crooked, Duke of Bavaria, An. 1438. decea≈øed 1465
8. Magdalen, affianced to Frederick the Pious, Duke of Lunenburg, An. 1430. decea≈øed 1480.
9. Dorothy, born Feb. 9. 1420. married to Henry the Gro≈øs, Duke of Meckleburg; decea≈øed 1477. And,
10. Sophia, who died in her Infancy, and is by ≈øome omitted.

¬ß. III. Thus came the Government into the hands of Albert the Fir≈øt, who, by rea≈øon of the many Battels he had been in, was ≈øtiled the German Achilles. He was of ≈øuch Authority in the Empire, as the Emperor would undertake nothing without him; ≈øo that it became a common ≈øaying, That Albert Governed the Empire by Frederick the Emperor. He confirm'd the Act of mutual Succe≈ø≈øion with the Families of Saxony and He≈ø≈øe; and had a very ≈øharp War with Lewis the Rich, Elector of Bavaria; as al≈øo afterwards with the City of Nuremberg. He departed this Life, An. 1486. during the Se≈ø≈øion of that Dyet, wherein Maximilian the Fir≈øt was elected King of the Romans; having ≈øome Ten Years before given up the Admini≈øtration of Affairs to his Son John, and ≈øeated him≈øelf in Franconia, from whence, as from an advanced Ground, he might the better ob≈øerve his Actions. In 1446 he took to Wife, Margaret, Daughter of James, Marque≈øs of Baden, who dying in 1457. He the next Year married Anne, Daughter of Frederick
the Second, Elector of Saxony, who died 1512. By the≈øe Ladies he had a numerous I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Frederick, decea≈øed in their Infancy.
2. Wolfgang, decea≈øed in their Infancy.
3. Ur≈øula, born Sept. 24. 1450. married to Henry, Duke of Mun≈øterberg, Feb. 10. 1467. decea≈øed 1503.
4. Elizabeth, born Nov. 29. 1451. married to Eberhard the Second, Duke of Wurtenburg, June 3. 1465. decea≈øed Ap. 15. 1524.
5. Margaret, Lady Abbe≈øs of St. Clare, in the City Hoff, born Ap. 18. 1453. decea≈øed 1509.
6. John the Second, born Aug. 2. 1455. of whom in the next Section.
7. Frederick the Fourth, born May 2. 1460. of whom below, as Author of the Franconian Line.
8. Aemilia, born Oct. 1. 1461. and married (after the decea≈øe of her fir≈øt Husband, Lewis, Elector Palatine, who died 1478.) to Ga≈øpar Palatine of Deux-Ponts, ≈øhe died 1481.
9. Anne, decea≈øed an Infant, 1462.
10. Barbara, born May 30. 1464. married in the 9th. Year of her Age (July 30. 1473.) to Henry the la≈øt, Duke of Glogaw and Cro≈ø≈øen; decea≈øed a Widow 1510.
11. Albert, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1464.
12. Sibil, born May 31. 1467. married to William, Duke of Juliers and Mons,' July 8. 1480. decea≈øed 1510. (as others 1511.)
13. Sigi≈ømund the Fir≈øt, born Sept. 28. 1468. he ≈øerv'd the Emperor, Maximilian the Fir≈øt, in his Wars, and came to an untimely death, Feb. 26. 1495.
14. Albert, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1470.
15. Dorothy, Lady Abbe≈øs of St. Clare in Bamberg, born 1471. decea≈øed 1529.
16. George, born 1473. decea≈øed in his Infancy.
17. Elizabeth, born 1474. married to Herman Count Henneberg; decea≈øed Ap. 25. 1507.
18. Magdalen, born 1476. decea≈øed an Infant. And,
19. Ana≈øta≈øia, born 1478. married to William Count Henneberg, of the Line of Sleu≈øing, 1500. decea≈øed July 4. 1534.

div.head: Of the Line Electoral.
div.p:
¬ß. IV. MAtters thus far cleared, return we now to John, ≈øurnam'd Cicero, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Electorate; and was very fortunate in reconciling Princes, when at difference; yet had Wars him≈øelf with John, Duke of Sagan. He departed this Life, Jan. 9. 1499, having had to Wife Margaret, Daughter of William, Duke of Saxony, and by her this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Wolfgang, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1480.
2. Joachim the Fir≈øt, born Feb. 21. 1484 of whom more a little below.
3. Elizabeth, born and decea≈øed 1486.
4. Anne, born 1487. married to Frederick Duke of Hol≈øtein, afterwards King of Denmark; decea≈øed 1521.
5. Ur≈øela, born 1488. given in Marriage to Henry the Fourth, Duke of Meckleburg, 1506. decea≈øed 1511. And,
6. Albert the Second, Arch-Bi≈øhop and Elector of Mentz; as al≈øo Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg; born June 28. 1490. decea≈øed 1545.

Joachim the Fir≈øt ≈øucceeded his Father at the Age of Fifteen, and was a Prince well read in ≈øeveral ≈øorts of Learning. He opened an Univer≈øity at Francfort upon the Oder, Ap. 27. 1506. In 1509. the Hamburghers put them≈øelves under his Protection. In 1500. he cau≈øed Thirty Eight Jews, and a Chri≈øtian, to be Executed: The Chri≈øtian for ≈øelling the Ho≈øt; The Jews for Sacrificing it. His death bears date 1535. and his Wife was Elizabeth, Daughter of John, King of Denmark, who ≈øuffered much for her Religion, which was the Prote≈øtant; and died a Widow, 1555. His I≈ø≈øue by her were,
1. Joachim the Second, born Jan. 9. 1505. of whom in the next Section.
2. Anne, born 1507. married to Albert the Seventh, Duke of Meckleburg, 1524. decea≈øed 1567.
3. Elizabeth, born 1510. and married to Erick the Elder, Duke of Brun≈øwick; and after his decea≈øe, to Poppo, Count de Henneberg. She died 1558.
4. Margaret, born 1511. and married to George, Duke of Pomerania, Jan. 8. 1530.
after who≈øe decea≈øe, ≈øhe was affianced to John the Fourth, Prince of Anhalt, An. 1533. And,
5. John, ≈øurnamed The Prudent, born Aug. 3. 1513. who had the new Marck, with the Dutchy of Cro≈ø≈øen a≈ø≈øigned him by his Father; and was ≈øtiled the Eye and Coun≈øeller of the Empire. He was very well skill'd in the Oeconomicks: Always Loyal to the Emperor; yet would not admit of the Interimi≈øtick Form, in his Juri≈ødiction. He built the Ca≈øtle and Fortification of Cu≈øtrin; and at length ended his days, An. 1571. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Catharine, Daughter of Henry the Tenth, Duke of Brun≈øwick, whom he Married, An. 1537. only Two Daughters, who≈øe Names were,
1. Elizabeth, who was married to her Kin≈øman George Frederick, of the Line of Franconia; and died 1578. And,
2. Catharine, given in Marriage to another Kin≈øman, namely, Joachim Frederick the Elector. She died 1602.

¬ß. V. We now return to Joachim the Second, who ≈øucceeded his Father; and performed many notable Services for the Emperor, more e≈øpecially in repelling the Forces of the Turks. He made publick profe≈ø≈øion of the Reformed Religion, and began to ≈øettle the ≈øame in his Provinces; cau≈øing, in order thereunto, the Eccle≈øia≈øtick Ordination, written by George Bucholtzer, to be publi≈øhed An. 1545. In 1542. he was declared General of the Imperial Army, again≈øt the Turks. Moreover, he rai≈øed the
Fortifications at Spandaw; and obtain'd of the Emperor Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, the ab≈øolute and independant Soveraignty of the Dutchy of Cro≈ø≈øen: And of Sigi≈ømund Augu≈øtus, King of Poland, a grant of Succe≈ø≈øion to the Dutchy of Pru≈ø≈øia; provided his Kin≈ømen, then in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of it, died without Heirs. He departed this Life in the Ca≈øtle of Kopen, An. 1571. being Poy≈øoned by a Jew. His fir≈øt Prince≈øs was Magdalen, Daughter of George Duke of Saxony of the Albertine Line; who dying in 1534. he the next Year married Hedewig, Daughter of Sigi≈ømund, King of Poland, decea≈øed 1573. By the≈øe Ladies he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. John George, born Sept. 11. 1525. of whom in the next Section.
2. Barbara, born 1527. given in Marriage to George Duke of Lignitz, 1545. decea≈øed 1595.
3. Elizabeth, born 1528. decea≈øed the Year following.
4. Frederick the Fifth, born Dec. 12. 1530. elected Bi≈øhop of Havelberg, 1548. Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, 1551. and Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt, 1552. yet, after all, died an untimely death in the ≈øame Year.
5. Albert, and Twins; both which decea≈øed in their Infancy.
6. George, Twins; both which decea≈øed in their Infancy.
7. Paul, born 1534. decea≈øed immediately after.
8. Elizabeth Magdalen, the Wife of Francis Otho, Duke of Lunenburg, born 1537. decea≈øed a Widow, 1595.
9. Sigi≈ømund the Second, born 1538. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, 1554. and a
little afterwards Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt al≈øo. He died Sept. 13. 1566.
10. Hedewig, born 1540. married to Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, 1560. decea≈øed Oct. 22. 1602.
11. Sophia, born 1541. married to William de Ro≈øenberg, Burgrave of the Crown of Bohemia, An. 1561. decea≈øed 1564.

¬ß. VI. 'Tis now time to ≈øpeak of John George the Fir≈øt, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Electoral Dignity, and revenged his death by the Execution of the afore≈øaid Leopold the Jew, and the Expul≈øion of his Nation out of the Marqui≈øate, An. 1572. He maintained a ≈øtrict Friend≈øhip with Augu≈øtus, Elector of Saxony, thro' the whole cour≈øe of his Life, and renewed the Act of mutual Succe≈ø≈øion with that Hou≈øe and He≈ø≈øe, An. 1587. He procured the form of Concord to be drawn up, and ≈øub≈øcrib'd the ≈øame him≈øelf. His death bears date 1598. and his fir≈øt Wife was Sophia, Daughter of Frederick the Second, Duke of Lignitz; who dying of her fir≈øt Child, a Year after her Marriage, viz. 1546. he, the next Year, e≈øpou≈øed Sabina, Daughter of George the Confe≈ø≈øor, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg: But ≈øhe likewi≈øe decea≈øing in 1575. he, in 1577. took Elizabeth, Daughter of Joachim Erne≈øte, Prince of Anhalt, to his third and la≈øt Wife; which Lady, departed this Life a Widow, 1607. His Children were as follow,
1. Joachim Frederick, born Jan. 27. 1546.
2. George Albert, born 1555. decea≈øed 1557.
Twins.
3. John,
4. Albert,
5. Magdalen Sabina.
6. Magdalen.
7. Hedewig.
8. Margaret. And,
9. Mary; all died Infants.
10. Erdmuth, 1561. married 1577. to John Frederick, Duke of Pomerania, decea≈øed 1628.
11. Anne Mary, born 1567. e≈øpou≈øed by Barnim, Duke of Pomerania, 1582. decea≈øed Nov. 4. 1618.
12. Sophia, born June 6. 1568. married to Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, 1582. decea≈øed Dec. 7. 1622.
13. Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, born June 30. 1581. of whom ≈øee more in the Franconian Line.
14. Magdalen, born Jan. 7. 1582. married to Lewis, Prince of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, 1597. decea≈øed May 4. 1616.
15. Joachim Erne≈øtus, born 1583. of whom likewi≈øe more in the Franconian Line.
16. Agnes, born 1584. married to Philip Julius, Duke of Pomerania, 1604. and after his decea≈øe to Francis Charles of Sax-Lawenburg, An. 1628. and died the Year following.
17. Frederick the Seventh, born March 22. 1588. con≈øtituted Great Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John of Jeru≈øalem, in Sonnenburg, An. 1610. decea≈øed May 19. 1611.
18. Elizabeth Sophia, born July 4. 1589. and married after the decea≈øe of Janowitz de
Ratzeville in Lithuania, her fir≈øt Husband, to Julius Henry, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg: She died 1629.
19. Dorethy Sibil, born 1690. given in Marriage to John Chri≈øtian of Lignitz, 16‚Äî decea≈øed 1625.
20. George Albert the Fir≈øt, born 1591. who, after his Brother Frederick's decea≈øe, was made Grand Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John in Sonnenberg, An. 1614. which Honour he enjoy'd not long; for he died the Year following.
21. Sigi≈ømund, Governour of the Dutchy of Cleves, born 1592. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, 1640.
22. John the Fifth, born 1597. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, 1627. having highly approved his Courage on all Occa≈øions. And,
23. John George the Second, born after his Father's decea≈øe, Aug. 4. 1598. who had the ≈øame Fate with his Brother John, decea≈øing without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1637.

¬ß. VII. We now return to Joachim Frederick, who ≈øucceeded his Father John George. He was elected Bi≈øhop of Havelberg, in 1553. of Lebu≈øs, in 1555. and Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, 1566. In 1598. he took upon him the Electoral Dignity, upon his Father's decea≈øe. In 1606. he commanded a Jubilee to be Celebrated at Francfort, in commemoration of the fir≈øt opening the Univer≈øity there; and Founded the great School or College, called Jochimsthal, the Year after. In 1608. he
died ≈øuddenly, in his way to Kopne. He had to his fir≈øt Wife, Catharine, Daughter of John, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg Cu≈øtrin; and after her decea≈øe, Eleanor, Daughter of Albert Frederick, Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia to his Second. By both Ladies he had Ten Children, whom we ≈øhall ≈øet down in the following Order, viz.

list.item: 1. John Sigi≈ømund, born Nov. 8. 1572. of whom more in the next Section.
2. Anne Catharine, born 1575. married to Chri≈øtian the Fourth, King of Denmark, 1597. decea≈øed March 29. 1612.

3. John George the Third, born Dec. 16. 1577. elected Bi≈øhop of Strasburg, An. 1592. which Election was neverthele≈øs the occa≈øion of many Commotions. In 1606. his Father gave him the Dutchy of Carnovia (or Jaggerndorff.) Ten Years after, he was elected Grand Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John, in Sonnenburg. In 1621. he was pro≈øcribed by the Emperor Ferdinand the Second, for taking part with Frederick the Fifth, Elector Palatine, and King of Bohemia, and died two Years after in Hungary; having had to Wife Eve Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Frederick the Sixth, Duke of Wurtenburg; and by her this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Catharine Sibil, born 1611. decea≈øed the Year following.
2. George, born 1613. decea≈øed 1614.
3. Albert, 1614. decea≈øed 1620.
4. Catharine Sibil, born and decea≈øed 1615. And,
5. Erne≈øtus the Second, born Jan. 18. 1617. who liv'd to be a Man, and was made Governour of the Marck; but died without I≈ø≈øue, 1642.
4. Augu≈øtus, born 1580. decea≈øed 1601.
5. Albert Frederick, born 1582. decea≈øed 1600.
6. Joachim the Third, Twins, born 1583. And,
7. Erne≈øt the Fir≈øt, Twins, born 1583.

div.p: Joachim died 1600. but Erne≈øt liv'd to be made Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John in Sonnenburg, An. 1611. where he died ≈øoon after.

list.item: 8. Barbara Sophia, born Nov. 16. 1584. married to John Frederick, Duke of Wurtenburg, 1609. decea≈øed 1636.

9. Chri≈øtian William, born 1587. made Admini≈øtrator of the Arch-Bi≈øhoprick of Magdeburg, 1608. pro≈øcribed by the Emperor 1628. and made Pri≈øoner at the taking of Magdeburg, May 10. 1631. afterwards he turned Catholick, and died at Cinna, 1665. In 1615. he e≈øpou≈øed Dorothy, Daughter of Henry Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, decea≈øed 1649. After which he took Barbara Elizabeth, (Daughter of Jaro≈ølaus de Martinitz. Burgrave of Cro≈ø≈øen in Bohemia) decea≈øed 1656. to his Second Wife; and then Maximiliana of Solms, Maximilian Count Walle≈øtein's Widow, to his la≈øt and third. By the fir≈øt Venture he had I≈ø≈øue,

div.p: 1. Sophia Elizabeth, born Jan. 2. 1616. married to Frederick William the Second, Duke of Sax-Aldenburg, 1638. decea≈øed March 6. 1650.
10. Mary Eleanor, born 1607. married to Lewis Philip, Count Palatine of the Rhine in Simmeren, An. 1630. decea≈øed 1675.

¬ß. VIII. Of the≈øe John Sigi≈ømund ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dignity of Elector, An. 1608. He had ≈øeveral Di≈øputes, which at length ended in a War, for the Dutchies of Cleves and Mens. He obtained Pru≈ø≈øia of the Poles, but with a great Incumbrance. He made publick Profe≈ø≈øion of the Reformed Religion 1614. and departed this Life Dec. 13. 1619. His Prince≈øs was Anne, Daughter of Albert Frederick, Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia, who bore him I≈ø≈øue as followeth,
1. George William, born Nov. 3. 1595. of whom ≈øee more a little below.
2. Anne Sophia, born March 17. 1598. married to Frederick Ulrick, Duke of Brun≈øwick, 1614. decea≈øed 1650.
3. Mary Eleanor, born Nov. 11. 1599. affianced to Gu≈øtavus Adolphus, King of Sweden, 1620. decea≈øed 1655.
4. Catharine, born 1602. and given in Marriage to Bethlem Gabor, Prince of Tran≈øilvania, An. 1626. and after his decea≈øe to Francis Charles, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg.
5. Joachim Sigi≈ømund, Great Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John in Sonnenburg, born 1607. decea≈øed Feb. 23. 1625.
6. Agnes, born 1606. decea≈øed 1607.
7. John Frederick, born 1607. decea≈øed 1608. And,
8. Albert, born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year, viz. 1609.

George William ≈øucceeded his Father, An. 1619. and, in the beginning of the Triennial War, took part with Gu≈øtavus Adolphus; But afterwards made an Expedition again≈øt the Swedes, An. 1639. partly for Pomerania; and partly becau≈øe they yet held many places in Pru≈ø≈øia; in which Country he died the Year following, viz. 1640. His Wife was Elizabeth Charlotte, Daughter of Frederick the Fourth, Elector Palatine; which Match gave Birth to this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Lovi≈øe Charlotte, born Sept. 3. 1617. married to James Duke of Curland, 1645. decea≈øed Aug. 18. 1676.
2. Frederick William the Great, born Feb. 6. 1620. of whom more in the next Section.
3. Hedewig Sophia, born at Six in the Evening, July 4. 1623. married to Lewis the Sixth, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, 1649. decea≈øed June 26. 1683. And,
4. John, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1624.

¬ß. IX. We now return to Frederick William the Great, who ≈øucceeded his Father, in 1640. a Prince of as many Heroick Virtues as Humane Nature is capable of. Who, by rea≈øon of his great Authority in the Empire, and va≈øt Knowledge in Publick Affairs, was look'd upon whil≈øt he liv'd, as common Father of the German Nation. In him center'd all that might be ≈øaid of any of his Ance≈øtors. In relation to Religion, Devout; to his Publick Actions, Great; to the many Battels he Fought, Victorious; to the extent of his Dominions, Augu≈øt;
to his more peculiar Virtues, Valiant, Ju≈øt, Merciful. By whom was he not e≈øteemed the German Achilles? By whom not regarded as the Pillar, on which the ≈øafety of the whole Empire (in a manner) was ≈øu≈øtain'd? 'Tis not for me to give a ju≈øt Character of the greate≈øt Hero of our Age: Nor indeed, were I able, had I an hundred Tongues. 'Tis ≈øufficient that his Heroick Actions are fre≈øh in the Memory of all Men; and that the Injury of time can never deface them. This be≈øt of Princes departed this Life at Nine in the Morning, on the 29th. of April, 1688. O. S. having Pre≈øided over his Provinces near Fifty Years.
