We ≈øtill ki≈øs his A≈øhes, and Con≈øecrate his Sacred Memory to Eternity. On the 7th. of Dec. 1646. this Great Prince e≈øpou≈øed the Prince≈øs Lovi≈øe Henrietta (Daughter of Henry Frederick, Prince of Orange) his fir≈øt Wife; who dying June 6. 1667. he, the Year following married his Second, which was Dorothy, Daughter of Philip, Duke of Hol≈øtein Glucksburg, Chri≈øtian Lewis, Duke of Brun≈øwick's Widow, who departed this Life in the Caroline-Bath, Aug. 6. 1689. By the fir≈øt Venture he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. William Henry, born at Cleves, May 11. 1648. decea≈øed at We≈øel, Oct. 20. 1649.
2. Charles Emilius, born at Nine in the Morning, on Feb. 6. 1655. the hopes of his Parents, and all the Brandenburg-Provinces, which neverthele≈øs were bla≈øted by his untimely death at Strasburg, Nov. 27. 1674. but reviv'd by the Birth of
3. Frederick the Third, born at Nine in the Morning, July 1. 1657. of whom in the next Section.
Twins, born 1664.
4. Henry, died the ≈øame Year, And,
5. Amalia. Jan. 22. 1665.
6. Lewis, born June 28. 1666. at Four in the Afternoon. A Prince of the noble≈øt Character, and worthy ≈øo great a Father. On Dec. 28. 1680. he took to Wife Lovi≈øe Charlotte de Ratzeville; yet died this excellent Prince without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1687. being much lamented by all good Men.

div.head: Children of Frederick William the Great, by his ≈øecond Wife.

list.item: 1. Philip William, born in May 1669. who gave ≈øignal proofs of his Courage in the Compagn again≈øt the French 1689.

2. Mary Amalia, born Nov. 16. 1670. and married in 1687. to Charles, Elde≈øt Son, and Heir Apparent of the pre≈øent Duke of Meckleburg-Gu≈øtrow; and after his decea≈øe, (which happened March 15. 1688.) to Maurice William, Duke of Saxony, and Admini≈øtrator of Naumburg, June 26. 1689.
3. Albert Frederick, born Jan. 14. 1672.
4. Charles Philip, Dec. 26. 1672.
5. Elizabeth Sophia, March 26. 1674.
6. Dorothy, 1675. decea≈øed the Year following. And,
7. Charles Lewis, at Four in the Afternoon, on May 17. 1677.

div.p: ¬ß. X. 'Tis now time that Frederick the Third appear, the no le≈øs happy Son and Succe≈ø≈øor of a mo≈øt Fortunate Father; to whom we may ju≈øtly apply this of the Poet.

q.l:
Egregia, In≈øigni≈ø
que nota e≈øt, de Sanguine na≈øci

Fortibus eduntur Fortes, Patrium
que jubatis
Robur Equis, & Bebus ine≈øt, nec Dama Leonem,
Eenic. Meimbom. in Vit√¢ Henrici Leonis.

div.p:
For he doth not content him≈øelf with the only Glory of being de≈øcended from ≈øo great a Hero; but has already made it ≈øufficiently appear him≈øelf by the greatne≈øs of his Actions, what the Chri≈øtian World, and True Church of God are ≈øtill to expect from him. May God protect this Mighty Prince! May he cheri≈øh him in his Bo≈øom, and ≈øet him as a Bracelet on his Arm! that he may eternally be ble≈ø≈øed before him; that he may live, take root, and flouri≈øh, with all his Illu≈øtrious Family; and there be never wanting One therein, who may happily ≈øway the Scepter of Brandenburg. On the 23d. of Aug. 1679. he married Elizabeth Henrica, Daughter of William, late Landt-grave of Fie≈ø≈øe; after who≈øe decea≈øe (which happened on June 27. 1683.) he mo≈øt happily made choice of the Prince≈øs Sophia Charlotte, Daughter of Erne≈øtus Augu≈øtus, the pre≈øent Bi≈øhop of O≈øenburg, and Duke of Brun≈øwick, for his Second Wife, on Oct. 6. in the following Year. By the fir≈øt Venture he has only a Daughter; namely,
1. Lovi≈øe Dorothy Sophia, born Sept. 19. 1680. but by the pre≈øent Dutche≈øs Two Sons, viz.
2. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born Oct. 6. 1685. decea≈øed Feb. 6. 1686. And,
3. Frederick William, born at Two in the Afternoon, Aug. 4. 1688. God grant he may one day equal Frederick William the Great.

div.head: Of the Franconian Line.
div.p:
¬ß. XI. MAtters thus far cleared, we are now to remind our Promi≈øe. Among≈øt the Sons of Albert Achilles, Elector of Brandenburg, above-mentioned, we took notice of Frederick the Fourth, born at One a Clock, May 2. 1460. He had the Burgraviate of Nuremberg, a≈ø≈øigned him by his Father; and took to Wife the Prince≈øs Sophia, Daughter of Ca≈øimire, King of Poland, whom he ≈øolemnly e≈øpou≈øed at Francfort, An. 1479. He departed this Life, Ap. 4. 1536. having had Seventeen Children by the Prince≈øs Sophia afore≈øaid, whereof Five died Young: The other Twelve were,
1. Ca≈øimire, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor in the Burgraviate of Nuremberg, born Sept. 27. 1481. decea≈øed Sept. 21. 1527. having had to Wife Su≈øan, Daughter of Albert the Fourth, Duke of Bavaria; and by her this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Mary, born 1519. married to Frederick the Third, Elector Palatine, 1537. decea≈øed Oct. 21. 1567.
2. Albert the Fourth, ≈øurnamed The German Alcibiades, born March 28. 1522. a Prince of eminent Qualities; but decea≈øed a Batchellor, An. 1557. And,
3. Cunigund, born 1524. married to Charles the Third, Marque≈øs of Baden-Durlach, An. 1551. decea≈øed 1557. (or 1558.)
2. George, ≈øurnamed The Confe≈ø≈øor, born at One in the Morning, March 4. 1484. He was thrice married; his fir≈øt Wife being Beatrix, Daughter of Huniades, Viceroy of Hungary, decea≈øed 1524. His ≈øecond was Hedewig, Daughter of Charles Duke of Mun≈øterberg, who likewi≈øe died 1531. and his third Emilia, Daughter of Henry, Duke of Saxony, of the Albertine Line, decea≈øed 1591. His Children were as follow,
1. Anne Mary, born Dec. 28. 1526. married to Chri≈øtopher, Duke of Wurtenburg; decea≈øed May 22. 1589.
2. Sabina, born May 12. 1529. e≈øpou≈øed by John George, Elector of Brandenburg, An. 1547. decea≈øed Nov. 2. 1575.
3. Sophia, born 1535. married to Henry, Duke of Lignitz, 1560. decea≈øed Feb. 12. 1587.
4. Barbara, born 1536. who, by rea≈øon of her being ≈øomewhat craz'd, died unmarried, An. 1591.
5. Catharine Dorothy, born 1538. given in Marriage to Henry of Ruchin, of the Line of Plaven; decea≈øed Jan. 19. 1604. And,
6. George Frederick, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor, born Ap. 5. 1539. In 1577. he was con≈øtituted Admini≈øtrator of Pru≈ø≈øia. In 1582. he founded the School or College at Heilbron. He was a great Lover of Peace; and kept a very Splendid and noble Court. This Great Prince died without I≈ø≈øue, Ap. 25. 1603. notwith≈øtanding he were twice married; Elizabeth, Daughter of John, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, being his fir≈øt Wife; And Sophia, Daughter of William, Duke of Brun≈øwick, his Second; which Lady ≈øurviv'd him many Years, and died at length at Nuremberg, An. 1639.
3. Sophia, born March 10. 1485. married to Frederick Duke of Lignitz, 1519. decea≈øed 1537.
4. Anne, born May 5. 1487. married to Wence≈ølaus, Duke of Glogow; decea≈øed 1517.
5. Albert the Third, born May 17. 1490. of whom more in the next.
6. John the Third, born Jan 9. 1493. and created Vice-Roy of the Kingdom of Valentia in Spain, by the Emperor Charles the Fifth; where he died without I≈ø≈øue.
7. Elizabeth, born March 24. 1494 married to Erne≈øt, Marque≈øs of Baden-Durlach, An. 1510. decea≈øed May 31.
8. Barbara, born Sept. 24. 1495. married to George, Landtgrave of Leuchtenburg, An. 1526. decea≈øed 1552.
9. Frederick the Fifth, Canon of Mentz, and Provo≈øt of Wurtzburg, born June 17. 1497. decea≈øed 1536.
10. William, born June 3. 1498. elected Arch-Bi≈øhop of Rigen, 1534. decea≈øed Feb. 4. 1563.
11. John Albert, Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt, and afterwards Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, born Sept. 20. 1499. decea≈øed May 17. 1580. And,
12. Gumbert, Lord High Chamberlain to Pope Leo the Tenth, born June 16. 1503. decea≈øed June 24. 1528.

¬ß. XI. We now return to Albert the Third, elected Grand Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order in Pru≈ø≈øia, An. 1512. and had a ≈øharp War with the Poles. Peace being afterwards made, he was Inve≈øted in the Dutchy of Pru≈ø≈øia, by the then King of Poland, Ap. 10. 1525. ≈øince which that Dutchy has been Hereditary to this Family. In 1532. he was Pro≈øcribed by the Imperial Ban. In 1544. he opened an Univer≈øity at Koningsberg in Pru≈ø≈øia; and at length ended his days on the 20th. of March, 1568. Aged 78. In 1525. he married Dorothy, Daughter of Frederick the Fir≈øt, King of Denmark. After who≈øe decea≈øe (which hapned in 1547.) he took to Wife Anne Mary, Daughter of Erick the Elder, Duke of Brun≈øwick, who departed this Life, March 20. 1568. fifteen Hours after her Husband. Of his Children, only Two ≈øurviv'd him; namely,
1. Anne Sophia, born June 11. 1527. married to John Albert, Duke of Meckleburg, 1555. decea≈øed Feb. 6. 1591. And,
2. Albert Frederick, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor in the Dutchy of Pru≈ø≈øia, born Ap. 29. 1553. and married in 1573. to Mary Eleanor, Daughter of William, Duke of Juliers, who bore him I≈ø≈øue as followeth,
1. Anne, born July 3. 1576. married to John Sigi≈ømund, Elector of Brandenburg 1594. decea≈øed 1625.
2. Mary, born Jan. 23. 1579. e≈øpou≈øed by Chri≈øtian, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg. Bareith, 1604. decea≈øed Feb. 11. 1649.
3. Albert, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1680.
4. Sophia, born March 31. married to William, Duke of Curland, 1609. decea≈øed the Year following.
5. Eleanor, born Aug. 12. 1583. given in Marriage to Joachim Frederick, Elector of Brandenburg, 1603. decea≈øed 1607. And,
6. Magdalen Sibil, born Dec. 30. e≈øpou≈øed by John George the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, 1607. decea≈øed 1659.
As for Albert Frederick, their Father, he departed this Life 1603. being ≈øomewhat di≈øtracted in his Mind; but his Wife liv'd till 1608.

¬ß. XII. The ancient Line of Franconia becoming thus extinct, the≈øe Provinces fell to Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, and Joachim Erne≈øtus, two younger Sons of John George, Elector of Brandenburg, as we ob≈øerv'd above in the Sixth
Section. Chri≈øtian, who died 1645. had the Upper part of the Principality a≈ø≈øigned him for his Lot, and ≈øo propagated the Branch of Culembach, by leaving I≈ø≈øue by Mary, Daughter of Albert Frederick, Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia, as followeth,
1. Elizabeth Eleanor, born and dead the ≈øame Year, 1606.
2. George Frederick, born and dead 1608.
3. Anne Mary, born Dec. 20. 1609. married to John Anthony, Prince of Eggeberg, 1639. decea≈øed Ap. 28. 1680. O. S.
4. Agnes, born and decea≈øed July 9. 1611.
5. Magdalen Sibil, born Nov. 1. 1612. married to John George the Second, Elector of Saxony, Nov. 13. 1638. decea≈øed 1687.
6. Chri≈øtian Erne≈øtus, born 1613. decea≈øed the Year following.
7. Erdman Augu≈øtus, born Oct. 29. 1615. of whom immediately. And,
8. George Albert, born March 10. 1619. of whom al≈øo ≈øee more below.
As for Erdman Augu≈øtus, he had Bareith a≈ø≈øigned him for his Appennage; married Sophia, Daughter of his Uncle Joachim Erne≈øtus of An≈øpach, An. 1641. and died 1651. His only Son being,

1. Chri≈øtian Erne≈øtus, the pre≈øent Prince, born July 24. 1644. and brought up for the mo≈øt part, during his Minority, under the Tuition of Frederick William the Great; Joachim Frederick de Bluhmenthal, having in the mean time the Government of his Provinces. In 1661. he took on him the Government him≈øelf; ≈øince which he has
given Singular Proofs both of his Courage and great Prudence on all Occa≈øions. In 1663. he was pre≈øent at the Diet then held at Ratisbone, and Cho≈øen General for the Circle of Franconia in the ≈øame Year. Al≈øo in the ≈øame Year he founded a famous School or College in the City Bareith, called from his Name the Chri≈øtian-Erne≈øtine School. See more of the Life of this Prince in Rent≈øch in Brandenburg Ceder≈øchein, pag. 722. and Seqq. His fir≈øt Wife was Erdmuth Sophia, Daughter of John George the Second, Elector of Saxony, whom he married, An. 1662. but ≈øhe dying June 12. 1670. he, the next Year took to Wife Sophia Lovi≈øe, Daughter of Eberhard the Third, Duke of Wurtenburg; which la≈øt Match has given Birth to this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item: 1. Chri≈øtiana Eberhardina, born at ≈øix in the Evening, Dec. 19. 1671.
2. Eleanor Magdalen, born at ≈øeven in the Morning, Jan. 14. 1673.
3. Claudia Eleanora Sophia, born 1675. decea≈øed Feb. 1. 1676.
4. Charlotte Emilia, born 1677. decea≈øed Feb. 5. 1678.
5. George William, Prince Hereditary of Bareith, born at nine in the Morning, Nov. 16. 1678.
6. Charles Lewis, born Nov. 11. 1679. decea≈øed March 28. 1680.

div.p:
¬ß. XIII. We now return to George Albert, younger Brother of Erdman Augu≈øtus, and his Po≈øterity,
who had his Seat at Culembach; and took to Wife Mary Elizabeth, Daughter of Philip, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Glucksburg, An. 1651. After who≈øe decea≈øe he married Sophia Mary of Solms, An. 1665. and departed this Life on Sept. 17. in the following Year, viz. 1666. having had Seven Children, whereof Three died young: The other Four were,
1. Erdman Philip, born May 1. 1659. who came to a violent and untimely death, by an accidental Wound on his Head, Aug. 26. 1678.
2. Chri≈øtian Henry, born July 17. 1661. at five in the Afternoon; and now Lieutenant-General of the Militia Light Hor≈øe, belonging to the Circle of Franconia.
3. Charles Augu≈øtus, Canon of Magdeburg, born at three in the Afternoon, on the 18th. of March, 1663. And,
4. George Albert, born of the ≈øecond Venture, Nov. 27. 1666.

¬ß. XIV. Having now done with Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, mentioned by us both in the ≈øixth and thirteenth Section, and his Po≈øterity; 'tis time we ≈øay ≈øomewhat of his Brother Joachim Erne≈øtus, and his I≈ø≈øue.

This Prince had the Lower part of the Principality in Franconia; and ≈øo became Author of the Branch of An≈øpach. In 1595. he was elected Ma≈øter of the Order of St. John in Sonnenburg; and departed this Life Feb. 25. 1625. having had to Wife Sophia of Solms; of the Line of Labach; and by her this following I≈ø≈øue,
1. Sophia, born May 31. 1614. married to Erdman Augu≈øtus, Marque≈øs of Bareith, 1641. decea≈øed Nov. 23. 1646.
2. Frederick the Eighth, born Ap. 20. 1616. and Slain at the Battle of Nordlingen, 1634.
3. Albert, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1617.
4. Albert the Fifth, born Sept. 18. 1620. of whom more immediately. And,
5. Chri≈øtian, born 1623. decea≈øed 1633.

Wherefore Albert ≈øucceeded his Father, and thro' the whole cour≈øe of his Life and Government, was a Fortunate Prince. He departed this Life Oct. 22. 1667. having had Henrietta Lovi≈øe, Daughter of Lewis Frederick, Duke of Wurtenburg, of the Line of Monpelgart, decea≈øed 1650. to his fir≈øt Wife; Sophia Margaret, of Octingen, who died 1664. to his Second: And then Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Frederick the Third, Marque≈øs of Baden, of the Line of Durlach, to his Third, which la≈øt Lady out-lived him, and was afterwards married to Frederick, Duke of Sax-Gotha. By the ≈øecond Venture he had I≈ø≈øue, that ≈øurviv'd him; namely,
1. John Frederick, born Oct. 8. 1654.
2. Albert Erne≈øtus, born Oct. 10. 1659. decea≈øed Oct. 20. 1674.
3. Dorothy Charlotte, born Nov. 19. 1661. and married to Erne≈øtus Lewis, the pre≈øent Prince Regent of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, Dec. 10. 1687. And,
4. Eleanora Juliana, born Oct. 12. 1663. and given in Marriage to Frederick Charles, Duke of Wurtenburg, and Admini≈øtrator
of that Dutchy, during the Minority of his Nephew, Eberhard Lewis, An. 1682.

John Frederick, ≈øucceeded his Father, and was ≈øtiled the Delight of his Subjects; and indeed of all others, who had the happine≈øs to know him. On Jan. 26. 1673. he took to Wife Joan Elizabeth of Durlach, his Motherin-law, Chri≈øtina's Si≈øter; who departing this Life, 1680. he the next Year married Eleanor Erdmuth, Daughter of John George, Duke of Sax-Ey≈øenach; and died 1686. By the fir≈øt Lady he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Leopold Frederick, born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year.
2. Chri≈øtian Albert, born Sept. 8. 1675.
3. Dorothy Frederica, Aug. 12. 1676.
4. George Frederick, Ap. 25. 1678. And,
5. Charlotte, born 1679. decea≈øed 1680.

By the other,
1. Wilhelmina Charlotte, born March 1. 1683.
2. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born 1684. decea≈øed 1685. And,
3. William Frederick, born Dec. 29. 1685.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of the Family of Brandenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. XVI. 'TWas ob≈øerv'd above, how Conrade, Count Zollern, obtained the Burgraviate of Norimberg; to which Frederick the Third added Bareith in Right of his Wife, together with the Ca≈øtle of Cadolkburg, being part of the Dutchy of Mera‚Äî. The fame Frederick had the City of Creu≈ø≈øen ≈øettled on him,
An. 1251. by the Emperor Conrade the Fourth. In 1258. he bought Birnsherg and Eginhau≈øen of the Barons of Vaenheim. In 1261. he obtained the Government or Cha≈øtellany of Aurach: That of Munch≈øteinach, An. 1265. Tho≈øe of Ekel≈ødorf, Wendel≈øtein, Dchnep≈øenreuth, and Sniklingen, An. 1273. Tho≈øe of Burckburnheim and Dachsbach, An. 1280. Reu≈øtadt on the Culm, An. 1282. Lencker≈øhetm, Eilbach, and Bruck in the ≈øame Year; and Reu≈øtadt on the Ai≈øch, An. 1285. In 1290. the Ca≈øtle of Swermtz was bought by this Family, which, till then, belonged to the Counts of Orlamund: And the Right of Heilbran Mona≈øtry ≈øeems al≈øo to have fallen to it much about the ≈øame time. In 1292. the Burgraves Conrade and Frederick bought Roth, Roth≈øtal, and Winshath. Burgrave John, about the Year 1317. became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of Pegnik, Erlougen, Blcck, Lindenhart, Brich≈øen≈øtadt, and ≈øome other Places; which, till then, were under the Juri≈ødiction of the King of Bohemia. The ≈øame John had Ihir≈øheim, Thir≈øtein, Markleuthen, Berneck, Golderonach, Mirsherg, and Trebga≈øt, with ≈øome other Places, made over to him by the Marque≈ø≈øes of Mi≈ønia. In 1321. Frederick the Fourth added Mohn≈øtedel, to his other Territories. In 1326. he bought Grundlach, Bruck, and Hoch≈øtedt; Stau≈øt and Ensfelden Two Years after: And Ansbach with all its dependencies, An. 1331. The ≈øame Frederick ≈øiding with Lewis of Bavaria the Emperor, again≈øt the Anti Cae≈øar, Frederick the Fair, took many of the Au≈øtrian Nobility Pri≈øoners in the War, whom indeed he di≈ømi≈ø≈øed without Ran≈øom,
yet conditionally, that for the future they and their Heirs ≈øhould hold their Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions in Fee of him and his for ever, which Agreement is very well known to be ≈øtill ob≈øerv'd. In 1336. John the Second added Culembach to this Family, together with the Ca≈øtle of Pla≈ø≈øenburg, and Mona≈øtry of Himmete-Cron. In 1347. he became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of Bei≈ø≈øen≈øtadt and Rudolfftein, and many other places; more e≈øpecially the City of Creilsheim. In 1364. Frederick the Fifth added Swabach, Feuchtwangen, Emsfirchen, and Gunkenhau≈øen, as al≈øo Hoff, in the Land of Advocates, which la≈øt place was bought by him in the Year 1375. In 1390. John the Third obtained as a Fief of the Empire Rikingen, Vffenheim, Libenau, Aurenhofen and Laterdorf, with ≈øome other Places, to be held by him as Fiefs of the Empire. In 1417. Frederick the Sixth was Inve≈øted in the Electorate of Brandenburg, by the Emperor Sigi≈ømund, to be held of him, and the Emperors his Succe≈ø≈øors: Which Electorate contained at that time the old and middle Marqui≈øates; as al≈øo Prignitz, to which he ≈øoon after annexed the Uckermarch, by right of War, having won the ≈øame from the Pomeranians. In 1455. the Elector Frederick the Second became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of many Places in Lu≈øatia, viz. Cothus, the Fort of Peike, Sommerfeldt, Be≈øckan, Storcan, with all their Appurtenances; having taken the ≈øame from George, King of Bohemia. In 1472. the Dutchy of Cro≈ø≈øen was Mortgaged to this Family, of which it became afterwards fully po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed, by rea≈øon of its being never redeemed. In 1525. Marque≈øs Albert, of the Franconian
Line, Grand Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order, was created the fir≈øt Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia, which was to hold as a Fief of the Crown of Poland, that Country being then changed into a Dutchy. Somewhat before this, his Brother George the Confe≈ø≈øor had Jagerndorff given him, in con≈øideration of his good Services, by Ladi≈ølaus King of Bohemia. The ≈øame George, in 1532. became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the Dutchies of Oppelen and Ratibor in Sile≈øia, by Right of Confraternity (or Articles of Agreement to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion) 'twixt him and the Duke of tho≈øe Dutchies. Joachim the Fir≈øt (in 1524) reduced the new Marck, which had been for many Years held in Mortgage by the Knights of the Teutonick Order. The ≈øame Prince Incorporated the County of Rupin with the Electorate, as a Fief vacant by the death of Wichman, la≈øt Count thereof. In 1609. the Dutchies of Juliers, Cleves, and Mons, as al≈øo the Counties of Marck and Ravensberg, ought to have fallen to John Sigi≈ømund the then Elector; but the Duke of Newburg oppo≈øing it, it was at length agreed on in 1666. after many Conte≈øts, which at length ended in a War, that only the Dutchy of Cleves and County of Marck, ≈øhould remain in the Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of this Family; neverthele≈øs without prejudicing its Right to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion, to the other Provinces of the ≈øaid Dutchies, in ca≈øe of deficiency of Heirs Male. In 1637. all Pomerania ≈øhould have fallen to his then Electoral Highne≈øs of Brandenburg, upon the decea≈øe of Bogi≈ølaus, la≈øt Duke thereof, by right of Confraternity; but the Swedes being got in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, he could
only obtain the further Pomerania: Wherefore afterwards, by the Peace of O≈øenburg, the Dutchy of Magdeburg, the Principalities of Halber≈øtadt, Minden, and Camin (together with ≈øome other Places) were made over as an equivalent to His mo≈øt Potent and Serene Highne≈øs Frederick William the Great. The ≈øame Prince, in 1657. obtained of the Crown of Poland, an Independant Right to Pru≈ø≈øia, where he had Lavenburg and Buton likewi≈øe put into his hands. In 1679. by the Treaty of Nimeguen, that part of Pomerania, which lies on the other ≈øide the Vecht, and was hitherto in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Swede, was likewi≈øe given up to him, except the City Dam. In 1681. there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of the County of Regen≈øtein. In 1684. upon the death of Erne≈øtus Bugi≈ølaus, Prince of Croy, all that Prince's Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions fell to this Family. And la≈øt of all, in 1686. by an Agreement then made with the Emperour, the Dutchy of Swibu≈øe was ≈øettled on it.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øe.
div.p: ¬ß. XVII. AS to what concerns the Decrea≈øe of this Family; Frederick the Sixth ≈øold great part of the Burgraviate of Norimberg to the City, for 137000 Florins. In 1535. George the Confe≈ø≈øor parted with the Dutchies of Oppelen and Ratibor, to Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, afterwards Emperor, for 13000 Hungarian Shillings. And in 1625. it lo≈øt Carnovia (or Jagerndorff) upon the Pro≈øcription of John George, then in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of that City and Di≈øtrict.

div.head: Of its Preten≈øions.
div.p: ¬ß. XVIII. THis Family had formerly a Preten≈øion to the Dutchies of Juliers, Cleves, and Mons; but it was taken off in 1666. as we ob≈øerved in the 16th. Section. It likewi≈øe laid Claim to Carnovia; but quitted that al≈øo, in 1686. upon its having the Dutchy of Swibus in Compen≈øation for it. We ≈øhall add no more at pre≈øent of its other Preten≈øions, being not well acquainted what they may be. Only you mu≈øt note, That it hath entered into Articles of Agreement to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion, with the Elector of Saxony and Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe. Moreover, by the Grant of the Emperor Frederick the Third, it has ≈øome Expectance of having the Dutchies of Hol≈øtein and Meckleburg fall to it; as al≈øo the Principality of Anbalt, provided tho≈øe in po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion fail in I≈ø≈øue Male.

div.head: CHAP. X. Of the Family of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THo' the Family of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, for its great Antiquity, may ≈øeem to bear the Bell (in a manner) from all the re≈øt; yet it will ≈øuffice us to know at pre≈øent, That it owes its Original to the Ancient Welffs: And from whence they are de≈øcended is ob≈øerved at large by the Learned Spener, in his Sylloge Genealogic√¢, pag. 476. Now Cunigund, Si≈øter of Welff the Third, Earl of Altorff (whom ≈øome likewi≈øe call Duke of Bavaria) was married to Azon of E≈øte, a Prince of an Italian Extraction; which Match gave Birth to Welff the Fourth (or as others the fir≈øt) ≈øurnamed The Strong, his Uncle's Heir; Earl of Altorff, and afterwards (in 1071.) Duke of Bavaria, by the Grant of the Emperor Henry the Fourth. He was ≈øucceeded by his Elde≈øt Son Welff the Second, who a≈ø≈øi≈øted the Young Emperor Henry the Fifth, again≈øt his Father, Henry the Fourth, and departed this Life 1119. having never had I≈ø≈øue by Maud his Wife, an Italian Prince≈øs of High Blood: Wherefore he left Bavaria to his Brother, Henry the Black, who died in the Year 1125. having had to Wi≈øe Walfild, Daughter of Magnus Duke of Saxony, of the Line of Billingen, and by her a numerous
Off-≈øpring; whereof Henry the Proud need only be here mentioned, as ≈øufficient to our pre≈øent De≈øign, He was Succe≈ø≈øor to his Father in the Dutchy of Bavaria; and in 1137. was Inve≈øted in that of Saxony al≈øo, by his Father-in-Law Lotharius, the Emperor. This Prince built Munchen, and after variety of Fortunes, ended his days, An. 1139. His Son was Henry the Lyon, Duke of Bavaria and Saxony, who≈øe Power was ≈øo great, as he was wont to ≈øay, in an old Dutch Rhime,
Bon der Elve bet an den Rhin
Dat th alles min. i.e.
'Twixt Elve and Rhine
Is all mine.

Neverthele≈øs falling into Di≈øgrace with the Emperor Frederick Barbaro≈ø≈øa, he was Pro≈øcribed by him, and ≈øo lo≈øt all his Dominions, except the Di≈øtricts of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg; and departed this Life, An. 1195. This Prince therefore may be properly looked on as common Father of all the Dukes of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, which have flouri≈øhed from that down to the pre≈øent Times. He had to Wife Maud, Daughter of Henry the Second, King of England; and by her Three Sons and Two Daughters, viz.

list.item:
1. Henry the Younger, who, in his Father's Life-time became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the Palatinate of the Rhine, in Right of his Wife Agnes, Daughter and ≈øole Heire≈øs of Conrade, la≈øt Count of that Palatinate; neverthele≈øs,
for want of Heirs Male, he was ≈øucceeded therein by Otho, Count Witelsbach, Duke of Bavaria, who married his only Daughter Agnes, as we ob≈øerved above in the Palatine-Bavarian Family.
2. Otho, cho≈øen Emperor, 1208. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue 1218.
3. Ingeburg, married to Woldemar the Second, King of Denmark.
4. Maud, to Geoffrey, Count de Perch. And,
5. William, Propagator of the Family, by being Father of Otho the Fir≈øt, born 1204.

div.p: ¬ß. II. This Otho was created the fir≈øt Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, by the Emperor, Frederick the Second, An. 1235. and had I≈ø≈øue by Maud, Daughter of Albert, Elector of Brandenburg, as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Albert, of whom below in the next Section.

2. John the Fir≈øt, who had the Principality of Lunenburg a≈ø≈øigned him for his Patrimony, and departed this Life 1276. (or as others 1277.) leaving I≈ø≈øue, Otho the Fourth, ≈øurnamed The Strong, who≈øe Wife was Maud, Daughter of Lewis, Elector Palatine, who bore him,
1. Otho the Sixth, Dake of Lunenburg, ≈øucceeded for want of I≈ø≈øue Male, by his Brother.
2. William the Third, who likewi≈øe died An. 1368. leaving I≈ø≈øue only Daughters.
3. Conrade the Fir≈øt, Bi≈øhop of Ferden, decea≈øed Oct. 15. 1303.
4. Otho the Second, Bi≈øhop of Hilde≈øheim, decea≈øed July 4. 1279.
5. Helena, married to Albert the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony; decea≈øed 1272.
6. Adelheid, given in Marriage to Henry the fir≈øt, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, 1239. decea≈øed 1255.
7. Agnes, the Wife of Wence≈ølaus, Prince of Rugen.
8. Maud, e≈øpou≈øed by Henry the Fir≈øt, Prince of Anbalt. And,
9. Elizabeth, by William, Earl of Holland, 1251. decea≈øed 1266.

div.p:
¬ß. III. We now return to Albert, ≈øurnamed The Great, who, upon his Father's decea≈øe, ≈øucceeded to the Principality of Brun≈øwick; and died him≈øelf in 1279. having performed many Noble Actions, and obtained ≈øeveral remarkable Victories. His Children were,
1. Henry, ≈øurnamed Mirabilis, or, The Wonderful, who had Grubenhagen a≈ø≈øigned him by his Father's Will; and departed this Life 1322. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Agnes, Daughter of Albert, Landtgrave of Thuringia, as followeth, viz.
1. Henry, who, in the divi≈øion of his Father's Inheritance, 'twixt him and his Brethren, had Eisfeld and Duder≈øtadt for his Patrimony, in which he was ≈øucceeded by his Son.
1. Otho the Seventh, who Mortgaged the ≈øaid Provinces to the Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz, and was created Duke of Tarento, and afterwards
King of both the Sicilies, but died without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1387.
2. John, Provo≈øt of Eimbeck. And,
3. Erne≈øtus, who, by Agnes of Eber≈øtein, had,
1. Frederick the Fir≈øt, who died 1404. leaving I≈ø≈øue only a Son, named, Otho the Ninth, decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1411.
2. Albert. And,
3. Erne≈øtus, Provo≈øt of Eimbeck, who died 1422. But Albert begot, Erick the Fir≈øt, who died 1449. and had I≈ø≈øue Two Sons.
1. Henry the Fifth, who died 1469. leaving only a Son, named Henry the Seventh, decea≈øed I≈ø≈øuele≈øs, An. 1526. And,
2. Albert the Sixth, who departed this Life 1486. and was ≈øucceeded by his Son. Philip; who≈øe Brother Erick was Elected Bi≈øhop of O≈øenburg and Mun≈øter, and died 1532. but Philip lived till 1555. ≈øettled the Reformed Religion in his Provinces; and left I≈ø≈øue,
1. Erne≈øte the Sixth, born Ap. 2. 1518. decea≈øed 1567.
2. Albert the Seventh.
3. John the Sixth.
4. Wolfgang. And,
5. Philip the Second. All which died without I≈ø≈øue Male; ≈øo that Philip, who departed this Life 1596. was the la≈øt of this Line.
2. Albert the Second, ≈øurnamed The Gro≈øs; of whom in the next Section.
3. William, who had the Di≈øtrict of Wolfembuttel for his Appennage; and died an untimely Death, An. 1292.
Knights of the Order of St. John.
4. Luder. And,
5. Conrade.
And, 6. Otho the Third, a Knight Templar.

¬ß. IV. We now return to Albert the Gro≈øs, who at fir≈øt had only the Principality of Calenberg and Barony of Gottingen; but upon his Brother William's Decea≈øe laid claim to his Country, and beat out his Brother Henry, who had ≈øeiz'd it, An. 1292. He departed this Life 1318. leaving I≈ø≈øue as followeth, viz.

list.item:
1. Otho the Fifth, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy of Brun≈øwick; and died 1334. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Agnes, Daughter of Conrade, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, only Two Daughters; who≈øe Names were,
1. Agnes, married to Barnim the Third, Duke of Pomerania; decea≈øed 1371. And,
2. Judith, the Wife of Henry, ≈øurnamed Ferreus (or Iron≈øide) Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe.

2. Erne≈øtus, who≈øe Patrimony was the Lord≈øhip of Gottingen, and Principality of Calenberg, where he had I≈ø≈øue by Elizabeth,
Daughter of Henry the Fourth, Duke of Glogaw, a Son and a Daughter; namely,
1. Elizabeth (or as others, Anne) married to William the Fir≈øt, Count de Henneberg, An. 1414.
2. Otho the Eighth, who ≈øucceeded him; and died 1394. having had to Wife Margaret, Counte≈øs of Bergen; and by her an only Son, Otho the Tenth, ≈øurnamed Monoculus, from his having but one Eye; in whom the Branch of Gottingen became extinct, An. 1463.
3. Magnus, of whom more in the next Section, as Pre≈øerver of the Line.
4. Albert the Third, Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt, decea≈øed 1358.
5. Henry the Third, Bi≈øhop of Hilde≈øheim, decea≈øed Feb. 6. 1363.
6. Maud, elected Lady Abbe≈øs of Gander≈øheim, An. 1305. And,
7. Ludger, Grand Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order in Pru≈ø≈øia.

div.p: ¬ß. V. We now return to Magnus, Son of Albert the Gro≈øs, who at fir≈øt kept his Court at Sangerhu≈øe; but after his Brother Otho's Decea≈øe, obtained the Principality of Brun≈øwick, An. 1334. and died him≈øelf, 1368. having had I≈ø≈øue, by Sophia, Daughter of Henry, Marque≈øs of Landsberg; as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Lewis the Second, decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue 1358. notwith≈øtanding he had married Maud, Daughter of William Duke of Lunenburg; of whom we made mention in the ≈øecond Section, Numb. 2.
2. Otho, decea≈øed in Italy.
3. Magnus Torquatus, of whom below.
4. John the Fifth, whom ≈øome make Arch-Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg; yet omitted by others.
5. Albert the Fifth, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Bremen; decea≈øed 1395.
6. Sophia, who died a Maid.
7. Maud, the Wife of Bernhard the Third, Prince of Anhalt.
8. Helena, married to Otho. And,
9. Agnes to Erick, Count de Hoye.

div.p:
Wherefore Magnus was the only Pre≈øerver of this Family, and ≈øucceeded his Cou≈øin William in the Principality of Lunenburg, An. 1368. his Father being yet living; after who≈øe decea≈øe he obtained that of Brun≈øwick al≈øo, in the ≈øame Year. His Wife was Catharine, Daughter of Woldemar, Elector of Brandenburg, by whom he had Eight Children. Him≈øelf was Slain in a ≈øingle Combat with Otho, Count Schaumburg, wherein he had thrown and di≈øarmed the Count; and was ju≈øt a going to kill him, as he lay on the ground, had he not been prevented, by being run through him≈øelf by a common Soldier. The Names of his Children were,
1. Frederick the Second, who, by an Agreement with his Brethren, had, at fir≈øt, the ≈øole Admini≈øtration of the Dutchy of Brun≈øwick. He beat Otho, ≈øurnamed Malus, or The Bad, out of Wolfembuttel; and overthrew the Barons that detained his Brother Bernhard in Pri≈øon. After this, being in high Repute for his Courage, he
was cho≈øen Emperor by ≈øome of the Electors, in room of Wence≈ølaus, whom they had depo≈øed; but Slain in his way home, not far from Fri≈ølar, as he was returning from Frankfort. His Wife was Anne, Daughter of Wence≈ølaus, Elector of Saxony, who bore him Two Daughters, viz. Anne married to Frederick the Third, of Au≈øtria; decea≈øed 1432. and Elizabeth, the Wife of Henry, (or as Cu≈øpinian will have it) Gunther, Count Swartzburg.
2. Bernhard the Fir≈øt, of whom more in the Line of Lunenburg.
3. Henry the Fourth, of whom in the next.
4. Otho the Eleventh, Bi≈øhop of Verden, and Arch-Bi≈øhop of Bremen, decea≈øed 1416.
5. Helena, the Wife of Albert, Duke of Meckleburg, and King of Sweden.
6. Agnes, married fir≈øt to Bu≈ø≈øon, Count Mansfeldt, and, after his decea≈øe to Bogi≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania ≈øtetin.
7. Sophia, e≈øpou≈øed by Henry, Duke of Meckleburg. And,
8. Catharine, married in 1391. to Gerhard, Duke of Sle≈øwick; and after he was Slain, to Erick the Third, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg.

div.head: Of the old Line of Brun≈øwick or Wolfembuttel.
div.p:
¬ß. VI. WE now return to Henry the Fourth, Author and Propagator of the old Line of Brun≈øwick; properly ≈øo called. In 1395. he reduced the Lunenburgers. In 1404. he undertook an Expedition 'gain≈øt Otho Count Schcumburg; but being taken by Henry of Eber≈øtein, and Simon and Bernhard, Counts de Lippe, could not obtain his Liberty but on Promi≈øe by Oath, to pay them 2000 Florins Ran≈øom; from which Oath he was afterwards freed by his Holine≈øs the Pope. He could never agree with his Brother the Bi≈øhop of Ferden. His Death bears date 1416. and his fir≈øt Wife was Sophia, Daughter of Urati≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania, whom he married, An. 1386. after who≈øe Decea≈øe he took Margaret, Daughter of Herman of He≈ø≈øe, to his Second. By the fir≈øt Lady he had I≈ø≈øue a Son and a Daughter; namely,
1. William, of whom a little below. And,
2. Catharine, married to Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony; decea≈øed Dec. 28. 1442.

But by the Second, only a Son, named, Henry, ≈øurnamed Lappen-Krieg; born 1411. decea≈øed 1473. having had to Wife, Helen, Daughter of Adolph, Duke of Cleves, and, by her, an only Daughter, named Margaret, and married to William Prince of Henneberg, An. 1469.

William ≈øucceeded his Father, and was ≈øurnam'd The Victorious, from Seven Famous Victories he obtained, The fir≈øt over the Hu≈ø≈øites, An. 1421. The ≈øecond, over tho≈øe of Hilde≈øheim in the ≈øame Year: The third, over the Turks, for Sigi≈ømund the Emperor, An. 1424. The fourth, over Erick, King of Denmark, in behalf of the Hans. Towns, and tho≈øe of Sle≈øwick, An. 1427. The fifth, over Theodorick, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mun≈øter, An. 1446. The ≈øixth, over Maurice, Earl of Oldenburg, An. 1462. And the la≈øt, over the Inhabitants of Eimbeck. He departed this Life, An. 1482. aged Ninety, having had Cecily, Daughter of Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg, to his fir≈øt Wife; and Maud, Daughter of Otho, Count Schaumburg, Bernhard the Second, of Lunenburg's Widow, decea≈øed 1468. to his Second. By the≈øe Ladies he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. William, ≈øurnamed The Younger, of whom in the next Section.
2. Frederick the Fourth, who had Calenberg a≈ø≈øigned him for his Patrimony; but died in Confinement, where he was kept, by rea≈øon of his being Crazed, An. 1499. And,
3. Otho, decea≈øed in his Infancy, 1468.

¬ß. VII. Return we now to William the Younger, who loved Retirement and a quiet Life. In 1490. he bought Helm≈øtadt of the Abbot of Verden; and departed this Life 1503. having ≈øome time before given up the Governmen to his Sons, and divided his Dominions among them. He had to Wife, Elizabeth,
Daughter of Budo, Count Stolberg, who bore him I≈ø≈øue as followeth;
1. Henry the Eighth, born June 24. 1463. of whom more below.
2. Anne, born 1470. and married to William, Son of Henry the Fifth, Prince of He≈ø≈øe. And,
3. Erick the Third, born the ≈øame Year with his Si≈øter Anne, who had the Principality of Calenberg, and Barony of Gottingen ≈øettled on him by his Father; and was a Prince ju≈øtly to be numbred among≈øt the greate≈øt Hero's of his Age; being ≈øaid to have overcome in no le≈øs than twelve ≈øeveral Battels. He departed this Life July 26. 1540. leaving I≈ø≈øue by his ≈øecond Wife, Erick the Younger, who ≈øucceeded him; but yet died without I≈ø≈øue at Pavia in Italy, An. 1584.

Return we now to Henry the Eighth, ≈øurnamed der Duadc, who being a Prince of an unquiet Temper, that ≈øought all occa≈øions of falling out with his Neighbours, involv'd both him≈øelf and Subjects in many difficulties. He was at la≈øt Slain by a Canon Ball, at the Siege of Orth a Ca≈øtle in Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland, June 23. 1514. His Wife was Catharine, Si≈øter of Bug ‚Ä¢ ≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania, decea≈øed 1526. which March gave birth to the following I≈ø≈øue;
1. Chri≈øtopher, Bi≈øhop of Verden, and Arch-Bi≈øhop of Bremen, born 1487. decea≈øed Jan. 22. 1558.
2. Henry the Tenth, born Nov. 10. 1489. of whom in the next Section.
3. Erick the Fourth, Commendator of the Teutonick Order, taken Pri≈øoner at the Battel of Lunenburg, but Ran≈øom'd afterwards. He died at Coblentz, An. 1525.
4. Francis the Second, born 1492. Elected Bi≈øhop of Minden, 1504. decea≈øed Nov. 29. 1529.
5. George the Fir≈øt, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Bromen, born 1494. decea≈øed Dec. 4. 1562.
6. William the Sixth, Commendator of the Order of St. John in Mirow, decea≈øed 1558.
7. Catharine, the Wife of Magnus the Second, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg, decea≈øed 1563. And,
8. Elizabeth, married to William, Count Henneberg.

¬ß. VIII. We now return to Henry the Tenth, a Prince impatient of Ea≈øe, and a quiet Life. In his Youth he ≈øerved George, Duke of Saxony, again≈øt the Frie≈ølanders: He likewi≈øe a≈ø≈øi≈øted his Uncle Erick again≈øt the Bi≈øhop of Hilde
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ m; but above all, ≈øignaliz'd his Courage and Conduct under the Emperor Charles the Fifth, in his Wars again≈øt the French. In 1525. he ≈øuppre≈ø≈øed the In≈øurrection of the Boors, by giving 'em a total Defeat. He fir≈øt e≈øtabli≈øhed the Right to Succe≈ø≈øion by Birthright in this Line. He was a Mortal Enemy of Luther's; nor wou'd he permit any of his Subjects to embrace his Doctrine. Moreover, he was accu≈øed of many high Mi≈ødemeanors by the Principal States of the Empire; whereupon he was beat out of his Dominions by the
Princes of the Smalcaldick League, An. 1543. and afterwards taken Pri≈øoner by Maurice, Elector of Saxony; but again ≈øet at liberty, An. 1547. and at la≈øt died of old Age, after many turns of Fortune, in the Year 1568. His fir≈øt Wife was Mary, Daughter of Henry Duke of Wurtenburg, decea≈øed 1541. after who≈øe Death he married Sophia, Daughter of Sigi≈ømund, King of Poland, decea≈øed 1575. By the fir≈øt Venture he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Charles Victor, born 1521. ≈ølain at the Battel of Siver≈øhu≈øe, July 19. 1553.
2. Philip Magnus, born 1522. and ≈ølain in the ≈øame Fight.
3. Julius, born 1528. of whom in the next Section.
4. John. all ≈øhort liv'd.
5. Henry. all ≈øhort liv'd.
6. Joachim. And, all ≈øhort liv'd.
7. Andrew. all ≈øhort liv'd.
8. Catharine, married to John, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, An. 1537. decea≈øed 1574.
9. Margaret, given in Marriage to John Duke of Mon≈øterberg, 1561. decea≈øed 1565.
10. Clara, who quitting the Cloy≈øter, married Philip, Duke of Brun≈øwick Grubenhagen, mentioned by us towards the latter end of the third Section, and died 1595. And,
11. Mary, Lady Abbe≈øs of Gander≈øheim, decea≈øed 1595.

¬ß IX. Julius ≈øucceeding his Father, was of a different Opinion to him in matters of Religion, and therefore aboli≈øhed the Popi≈øh Super≈øtition; commanding the Julian Body of
Divinity to be followed throughout his Dominions. He likewi≈øe opened an Univer≈øity at Helm≈øtadt, Oct. 14. 1576. and departed this Life 1589. In 1560. he took to Wife Hedewig, Daughter of Joachim the Second, Elector of Brandenburg, by whom he had I≈ø≈øue, Male and Female, as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Sophia Hedewig, born 1561. married to Erne≈øt Lewis, Duke of Pomerania, 1577. decea≈øed 1631.
2. Henry Julius, born Oct. 15. 1564. of whom we ≈øhall ≈øoon ≈øpeak again.
3. Mary, born 1566. ≈øhe was married to Francis, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg, and died 1626.
4. Elizabeth, born 1567. and married (after the decea≈øe of her fir≈øt Husband Adolph, Count Schaumburg, An. 1604.) to Chri≈øtopher, Duke of Brun≈øwick-Zell. She died 1618.
5. Philip Sigi≈ømund, Bi≈øhop of Ferden and O≈ønabrug, born July 1. 1568. decea≈øed 1623.
6. Margaret, born 1571. and decea≈øed in her Infancy.
7. Joachim Charles, Provo≈øt of Strasburg, born Ap. 23. 1573. decea≈øed Oct. 9. 1615.
8. Sabina Catharine, born 1674. decea≈øed 1590.
9. Dorothy Augu≈øta, Lady Abbe≈øs of Gander≈øheim, born 1577. decea≈øed 1611.
10. Julius Augu≈øtus, Abbot of St. Michael in the City of Lunenburg, born Feb. 4. 1578. decea≈øed 1617. And,
11. Hedewig, born 1580. married to Otho the Sixteenth, Duke of Brun≈øwick-Zell; decea≈øed 1641.

div.p:
We now return to Henry Julius, who ≈øucceeded his Father Julius in the Dutchy; and upon the death of Philip of Grubenhagen, pretended to the ≈øole right of ≈øucceeding to him al≈øo: but that being oppo≈øed by the other Relations of the ≈øaid Philip, and an unhappy Divi≈øion like to ari≈øe among 'em thereupon, it was agreed by all Parties to refer the matter to the deci≈øion of the Law; and ≈øo Henry at la≈øt let his Claim fall. He departed this Life at Prague, An. 1613. In 1585. he took Dorothy, Daughter of Augu≈øtus, Elector of Saxony to his fir≈øt Wife; but ≈øhe dying two Years after, he (in 1590.) married Elizabeth, Daughter of Frederick the Second, King of Denmark. By the≈øe he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Dorothy Hedewig, born Feb. 4. 1587. married to Rudolph, Prince of Anhalt, 1605. decea≈øed 1608.
2. Frederick Ulrick, born Ap. 5. 1591. This Prince ≈øucceeded his Father, and had much ado with the City of Brun≈øwick, but in the end brought it to ≈øuch terms as forced it to ≈øubmit, and do him Homage, An. 1616. He departed this Life 1634. and that without I≈ø≈øue by his Wife, who was Anne Sophia, Daughter of John Sigi≈ømund, Elector of Brandenburg; and ≈øo put an end to this Line.
3. Sophia Hedewig, the Wife of Erne≈øt Ca≈øimire, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, of the Line of Dillenburg, born Feb. 20. 1592. decea≈øed 1642.
4. Elizabeth, born 1593. married fir≈øt to Augu≈øtus, An. 1612. and after his decea≈øe
to John Philip, Dukes of Saxony; the One of the now Electoral, the Other of the Erne≈øtine Line. She died 1650.
5. Hedewig, born Feb. 19. 1595. married to Ulrick, Duke of Pomerania, 1619. decea≈øed 1622.
6. Dorothy, born June 8. 1596. married to Chri≈øtian William, Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, and Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, 1615. decea≈øed 1649.
7. Chri≈øtian the Second, born Sept. 10. 1599. elected Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt, 1616. decea≈øed 1626. This Prince took part with Frederick the Fifth, Elector Palatine, and King of Bohemia, but was put to Flight by the Imperiali≈øts, in a Battel fought not far from Hoch≈øt: Neverthele≈øs, he had afterwards better Succe≈øs again≈øt the Spaniard, who≈øe Forces he defeated under their Leader, Don Franci≈øco Gon≈øalvo de Corduba.
8. Rudolph, born 1602. and de≈øigned for Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt, but prevented by Death, 1616.
9. Henry Charles, born 1609. decea≈øed at Helm≈øtadi, 1615. And,
10. Anne Augu≈øta, born May 19. 1612. and married to George Lewis, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, of the Line of Dillenburg.

div.head: Of the Line of Lunenburg or Zell.
div.p:
¬ß. X. MAtters thus far cleared, we now return to Bernhard, mentioned by us above in the fifth Section, Numb. 2. who, in the divi≈øion of his Father's Inheritance 'twixt
him and his Brother Henry had the Principality of Lunenburg a≈ø≈øigned him for his Patrimony; and died 1434. having had to Wife Margaret, Daughter of Wence≈ølaus, Elector of Saxony, and by her Two Sons and a Daughter, viz.

list.item: 1. Otho the Twelfth, ≈øurnamed Von der Heyde, who ≈øucceeded him, and married Elizabeth of Eber≈øtein; yet died without I≈ø≈øue, 1445.
2. Frederick the Third, ≈øurnamed The Religious, of whom immediately. And,
3. Catharine, married to Ca≈øimire, Duke of Pomerland-≈øtetin.

div.p: Frederick ≈øucceeded Otho his Brother, and built the Franci≈øcan Mona≈øtery at Zell, whereunto he retired, having given up the Government to his Sons; by who≈øe untimely Deaths he was once more forced from thence to return to the Admini≈øtration of the Publick, over which he afterwards pre≈øided Seven Years, and died 1478. His Wife was Magdalen, Daughter of Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg; and his Children by her, as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Bernhard the Second, Admini≈øtrator of the Arch Bi≈øhoprick of Hilde≈øheim, which Dignity he re≈øigned after ≈øix Years enjoying it, and had the Government of Lunenburg put into his hands by his Father, upon his retiring from ≈øecular Affairs; yet died before him; and that without I≈ø≈øue, notwith≈øtanding he had married Maud, Daughter of Otho, Count Schaumberg.

2. Otho the Thirteenth, ≈øurnamed The Victorious, a Valiant and Ju≈øt Prince, who ≈øucceeded his Brother, but yet died before his Father, An. 1471. leaving Anne of Na≈ø≈øau, a Widow; and by her an only Son, named Henry the Ninth, born 1468. of whom more in the next Section. And,
3. Margaret, married to Henry the Third, Duke of Meckleburg.

div.p:
¬ß. XI. Henry the Ninth, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy, was brought up under the Tuition of his Mother and Grandfather; and after he came to the Management of Affairs him≈øelf, had many Wars. He departed this Life at Paris, An. 1532. having had to Wife, Margaret, Daughter of Erne≈øtus the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, and by her I≈ø≈øue, as followeth; namely,
1. Elizabeth, married to Charles, Duke of Guelderland, 1518. decea≈øed 1572.
2. Otho the Fourteenth, born Aug. 24. 1495. who had his Seat at Harburg; where he had I≈ø≈øue, by the Lady Metta de Rampen, Otho the Fifteenth, born Sept. 25. 1528. which Otho had Two Wives; namely, Margaret of Swartzburg; and Hedewig, Daughter of Emico, Earl of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland; and by them a numerous Off≈øpring, who≈øe Names were,
1. Elizabeth, born 1553. and married to Erick de Brabe, Earl of Wi≈øenburg in Sweden, 1582.
2. Otho Henry, born 1555. decea≈øed 1591.
3. John Frederick, born 1557. decea≈øed 1619.
4. William the Eighth, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Di≈øtrict of Marburg; but died without I≈ø≈øue, An. 1642.
5. Enno, born 1565. decea≈øed in his Infancy.
6. Anne Margaret, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedelinburg, born 1567. decea≈øed 1643.
7. Henry, born and dead 1568.
8. Hedewig, born 1569. decea≈øed an Infant 1620.
9. Chri≈øtopher the Second, born Aug. 21. 1570. decea≈øed July 7. 1606. having had to Wife, Elizabeth, Daughter of Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, but by her no I≈ø≈øue.
10. Otho the Sixteenth, born March 20. 1572. decea≈øed al≈øo without I≈ø≈øue, 1641. notwith≈øtanding he had married Hedewig, another Daughter of the ≈øaid Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick.
11. John the Seventh, born 1573. decea≈øed 1625.
12. Elizabeth, born 1574. decea≈øed in her Infancy.
13. Catharine Sophia, born 1577. and married to Herman, Count Schaumberg, 1619.
14. Frederick the Sixth, born Dec. 6. 1578. who ≈øerved Charles, King of Sweden, in his Liffland Wars and died Sept. 17. 1605. And,
15. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1580.
3. Erne≈øte the Seventh, Pre≈øerver of the Family, born June 26. 1497. of whom in the next Section.
4. Apollonia, born 1499. decea≈øed 1571. who≈øe Epitaph is ≈øtill to be ≈øeen in the Cathedral Church at Ultzen.
5. Anne, born 1502. married to Bernim, Duke of Pomerania, 1523. decea≈øed 1568. And,
6. Francis the Fir≈øt, born Nov. 23. 1508. who kept his Court in Giffhorn-Ca≈øtle, where he likewi≈øe died, An. 1540. having had to Wife Clara, Daughter of Magnus, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg; and by her Two Daughters that out-liv'd her; namely,
1. Catharine, born 1534. married to Henry of Ruthen, Burgrave of Mei≈ø≈øen; decea≈øed 1565. And,
2. Clara to Bernhard of Anhalt; and after his decea≈øe in 1572. to Bugi≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerania: She died 1578.
The above-named Henry is likewi≈øe ≈øaid to have had Two other Sons and a Daughter; but being their Names are no where to be found, 'tis not to be doubted, but that they died Infants.

¬ß. XII. We are now come to ≈øpeak of Erne≈øte the Seventh, which Prince ≈øettled the Reformed
formed Religion in his Provinces; and ≈øub≈øcribed the Augu≈øtane Confe≈ø≈øion. Moreover, he defeated the Tumultuous Boors with their Adherents: As al≈øo the Anabapti≈øts, by the A≈ø≈øi≈øtance of the Bi≈øhop of Mun≈øter; and departed this Life in the Year 1546. and 49th. of his Age. He had to Wife, Sophia, Daughter of Henry, ≈øurnamed The Peace-Maker, Duke of Meckleburg, (whom he married An. 1520.) and by her a numerous I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Francis Otho, born June 20. 1530. decea≈øed Ap. 25. 1559. ju≈øt after his Marriage with Elizabeth Magdalen, Daughter of Joachim the Second, Elector of Brandenburg.
2. Frederick the Fifth, born 1532. and Slain at the Battle of Siver≈øhu≈øe, July 9. 1553.

3. Henry the Eleventh, born June 4. 1533. who de≈øigning to live a Batchellor, was content with the Counties of Danneberg, and Wittenburg, and re≈øigned the Principality of Lunenburg to his younger Brother William; yet afterwards altering his Mind, married Ur≈øula, Daughter of Francis, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg, An. 1569. and died Jan. 17. leaving I≈ø≈øue by her, as followeth, viz.
1. Julius Erne≈øtus, born March 11. 1571. who ≈øucceeded him in his Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions, and took to Wife, Mary, Daughter of Emico, Earl of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland, after who≈øe death, An. 1616. he married Sibil, Daughter of William, Duke of Brun≈øwick-Hanouer, who ≈øurvived him,
and liv'd till 1652. whereas him≈øelf died 1636. leaving I≈ø≈øue only a Daughter, and that by his fir≈øt Wife; namely, Mary Catharine, born 1616. married to Adolph Frederick, Duke of Meckleburg Swerin, 1635. decea≈øed 1665.
2. Francis the Third, Canon of Strasburg and Cologne, born June 6. 1572. and lo≈øt in the River ‚Äî not far from Strasburg.
3. Sibil Elizabeth, born 1576. and married in 1601. to Anthony, Count Oldenburg.
4. Sidonia, born 1577. decea≈øed a Maid 1645.
5. Augu≈øtus, of whom more in the next Section, as Author of the new Line of Brun≈øwick.
4. Margaret, born June 10. 1534. and married to John, Count Mansfeldt.
5. William the Seventh, born July 4. 1535. of whom more in the fourteenth Section, as Propagator of the Line of Lunenburg.
6. Ur≈øula, born 1536. decea≈øed 1538.
7. Catharine, born 1537. decea≈øed in her Infancy.
8. Elizabeth Ur≈øula, born 1539. married to Otho, Count Schaumburg, 1558. decea≈øed 1586.
9. Magdalen, born 1540. married to Arnold, Count Benthem, 1561. decea≈øed 1586. And,
10. Sophia, born 1541. given in marriage to Poppo, Count Henneberg, 1562.

div.head: Of the New Line of Brun≈øwick or Wolfembuttel.
div.p: ¬ß. XIII. WE now return to Augu≈øtus the Second, born Ap. 10. 1579. who at fir≈øt kept his Court at Hitzgar; but, upon the decea≈øe of Frederick Ulrick in 1634. the la≈øt of the Old Line of Brun≈øwick; and his own Brother Julius Erne≈øtus, dying likewi≈øe ≈øoon after, he ≈øucceeded 'em both in their Dominions; yet ≈øo, as that the Principality of Calenberg, and Barony of Gottingen, were to return to the Line of Zell. He was a Ju≈øt, Religious, Merciful Prince; well read in all ≈øorts of Learning. He was elected Head of the Fruitful Society. The whole cour≈øe of his Government was exceeding happy to the very day of his Death, which was Sept. 17. 1666. and the Eighty Eighth of his Age. His fir≈øt Wife was Clara Maria, Daughter of Bugi≈ølaus, Duke of Pomerland ≈øtetin, Sigi≈ømund Augu≈øtus, Duke of Meckleburg's Widow, decea≈øed 1623. His ≈øecond, Dorothy of Rudolph, Prince of Anhalt Serve≈øtan, who died Sept. 26. 1634. And his third, Sophia Elizabeth, Daughter of John Albert, Duke of Meckleburg-Gu≈øtrow; married to him in 1635. whom he left a Widow. By the ≈øecond and third Ladies he had a fair I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names were and are as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Henry Augu≈øtus, born Ap. 28. 1625. decea≈øed Sept. 30. 1627.

2. Rudolph Augu≈øtus, born May 16. 1628. who ≈øucceeded his Father, and by the
A≈ø≈øi≈øtance of the other Princes of his Family ≈øubdued the City Brun≈øwick, which, for ≈øome Ages had withdrawn its Allegiance from its lawful Prince, where he cau≈øed a Hou≈øe of Correction to be built, and re≈øtored the great Fair call'd Die Me≈ø≈øe. In 1650. he married the Lady Chri≈øtina Elizabeth, Daughter of Adolph Frederick, the la≈øt Count de Barbien, decea≈øed 1681. having born him I≈ø≈øue as followeth, viz.
1. Dorothy Sophia, born Jan. 28. 1653. and married to John Adolph, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Plonen, 1673.
2. Chri≈øtina Sophia, born Ap. 3. 1654. and affianced to her Cou≈øin-Germain, Prince Augu≈øtus William, 1681. And,
3. Eleanor Sophia, born 1655. decea≈øed the Year following.
3. Sibilla Ur≈øula, born 1629. married to Chri≈øtian, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Glucksburg; decea≈øed 1671.
4. Anonyma, decea≈øed as ≈øoon as born, 1631.
5. Clara Augu≈øta, born June 25. 1632. and married to Frederick, Duke of Wurtenburg, of the Line of Stugart, 1653. who≈øe Widow ≈øhe now is.

6. Anthony Ulrick, born Oct. 4. 1633. who now lives with his Brother Rudolph, in joynt Authority of the Government; ≈øetting a ≈øingular Example to the World of Brotherly Affection. On the 17th. of Aug. 1656. he took to Wife Elizabeth Julian, Daughter of Frederick, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Nordburg, by whom he has had I≈ø≈øue as followeth, viz.
1. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born 1657. and Slain at the Taking of Philipsburg, 1676.
2. Elizabeth Eleanor, born 1658. married to John George, Duke of Meckleburg-Swerin, 1675. and after his Death in the ≈øame Year, to Bernhard, Duke of Sax-Meinungen, of the Branch of Gotha.
3. Anne Sophia, born Oct. 28. 1659. and affianced in 1677. to Charles Gu≈øtavus, Marque≈øs of Baden-Durlach.
4. Leopold Augu≈øtus, born 1661. decea≈øed the Year following.
5. Augu≈øtus William, Prince Hereditary of Brun≈øwick, born March 8. 1662. who, on the 24th. of June, 1681. took to Wife Chri≈øtina Sophia, his Uncle Rudolph's Daughter, but as yet has no I≈ø≈øue by her.
6. Augu≈øtus Henry, born Aug. 14. 1663. decea≈øed Feb. 24. 1664.
7. Augu≈øtus Charles, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1664.
8. Augu≈øtus Francis, born 1665. decea≈øed the Year following.
9. Augu≈øta Dorothy, born Dec. 16. 1666. and married to Anthony Gunther, Count Swartzburg, 1684.
10. Amalia Antonia, born and decea≈øed 1668.
11. Henrietta Chri≈øtina, born Sept. 19. 1669.
12. Lewis Rudolph, born July 22. 1671. and ≈øolemnly In≈øtalled Knight of the Order of St. John of Jeru≈øalem at Sonnenberg,
in December 1689. And,
13. Sibil Ur≈øula, born 1672. decea≈øed 1673.

7. Ferdinand Albert, Elde≈øt Son by the third Venture, born May 22. 1636. who lived in Bevern-Ca≈øtle, where he al≈øo died, An. 1687. having had to Wife the Lady Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Frederick, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe in E≈øchwegen, and by her, I≈ø≈øue, as followeth, viz.
1. Leopold Charles, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1670.
2. Frederick Albert, born 1672. decea≈øed 1673.
3. Sophia Eleanor, born 1674.
4. Claudia Eleanora, born 1675. decea≈øed the Year following.
5. Augu≈øtus Ferdinand, born 1677.
6. Ferdinand Albert, born 1680.
7. Ferdinand Chri≈øtian. And, Twins, born Mar. 4. 1682.
8. Erne≈øtus Ferdinand. Twins, born Mar. 4. 1682.
8. Mary Elizabeth, born Jan. 6. 1638. married to Adolph William, Duke of Saxon-Ey≈øenach, 1663. and after his Decea≈øe to Albert, Duke of Sax Coburg.
9. Chri≈øtian Francis, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1639.

div.head: Of the Line of Zell and Hanouer.
div.p:
¬ß. XIV. MAtters thus far cleared, 'tis now time that William the Seventh, Son of Erne≈øte the Seventh appear: This Prince ≈øucceeded his Father in the Principality of Lunenburg, and died Aug. 20. 1592. having
had to Wife, Dorothy, Daughter of Chri≈øtian the Third, King of Denmark, and by her a noble I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Sophia, born Oct. 3. 1563. married to George Frederick, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, 1579. decea≈øed Jan. 14. 1639.
2. Erne≈øtus the Eighth, born Nov. 19. 1564. who ≈øucceeded his Father; but died a Batchellor, An. 1611.
3. Elizabeth, born Nov. 19. 1565. married to Frederick Count Hohenloe, 1585. decea≈øed 1621.
4. Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, Bi≈øhop of Minden, born Nov. 19. 1566. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, Nov. 8. 1633.

5. Augu≈øtus the Fir≈øt, Admini≈øtrator of the Bi≈øhoprick of Ratzeburg, born Nov. 19. 1568. who ≈øucceeded his Brother in the Principality of Lunenburg, and died Oct. 10. 1636. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Il≈øa Smidichin, Daughter of the Governour of Ebsdorf, a natural Son, named Erne≈øte de Lunenburg, who≈øe Po≈øterity flouri≈øheth to this day.
6. Dorothy, born Jan. 1. 1570. married to Charles, Count Palatine of the Rhine in Birckenfeld, 1586. decea≈øed Aug. 15. 1649.
7. Clara, born June 16. 1571. married to William, Count Swartzburg, 1593. decea≈øed 1658.
8. Anne Ur≈øula, born 1572. decea≈øed Feb. 3. 1601.
9. Margaret, born Ap. 5. 1573. married to John Ca≈øimire, Duke of Saxony, 1599. decea≈øed Aug. 7. 1643.
10. Frederick the Seventh, Pre≈øident of the Chapter of Bremen, born Aug. 24. 1574. who ≈øucceeded his Brother Augu≈øtus; and died without I≈ø≈øue, Dec. 10. 1648.
11. Mary, born Oct. 21. 1575. decea≈øed Oct. 21. 1610.
12. Magnus the Third, born 1577. decea≈øed 1632.
13. George the Second, born Feb. 17. 1582. of whom more in the next Section, as only Propagator of this Line.
14. John the Eighth, Canon of Minden, born June 23. 1583. decea≈øed Nov. 21. 1628. And,
15. Sibil, born June 3. 1584. married to her Cou≈øin-Germain Julius Erne≈øtus, of Danneberg, 1617. decea≈øed 1652.

div.p: ¬ß. XV. Now of the≈øe Seven Sons, George alone was married; for ≈øo it had been agreed among≈øt 'em, that only One ≈øhould Marry; the other Six continue Batchellors, and that they ≈øhould ca≈øt Lots who the married Man ≈øhould be. The Lot fell to George, who thereupon took to Wife the Lady Anne Eleanor, Daughter of Lewis, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt. He was a Prince for true Piety, Courage, Wi≈ødom, and Sincerity, worthy the Admiration of all Po≈øterity. In the Year 1633. he ≈øubdued the whole Bi≈øhoprick of Hildi≈øheim, together with the City of the ≈øame Name. In 1636. he became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the Principality of Calenberg, and departed this Life, Ap. 11. 1641. leaving I≈ø≈øue, by the Lady Anne Eleanor afore≈øaid, as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Chri≈øtian Lewis, born Feb. 25. 1622. who at fir≈øt had his Re≈øidence at Hanouer; but upon his Uncle Frederick's Decea≈øe, ≈øucceeded to the Principalities of Lunenburg and Grubenhagen; as al≈øo to the Counties of Hoye and Diepholt. This excellent Prince died without I≈ø≈øue, March 15. 1665. leaving the Lady Dorothy, Daughter of Philip, Duke of Hol≈øtein Glucksburg, a di≈øcon≈øolate Widow.

2. George William, born Feb. 16. 1624. a Prince ju≈øtly to be numbred among≈øt the Heroes of the Age, who, at fir≈øt ≈øucceeded his Brother Lewis in the Principality of Calenberg only; but upon his Decea≈øe without I≈ø≈øue, in that of Lunenburg al≈øo; as al≈øo in the Counties of Diepholt and Hoye; yet not without ≈øeveral hot Di≈øputes with his younger Brother John Frederick on that occa≈øion. He has taken to Wife the Lady Eleanor De≈ømiers, a French Lady, Daughter of Alexander, Baron of Olbreuze in France, by whom he has only a Daughter now living, who≈øe Name is, Sophia Dorothy, born Sept. 15. 1666. and married to George Lewis, her Uncle Erne≈øt Augu≈øtus's Elde≈øt Son, Nov. 21. 1682.

3. John Frederick, born Ap. 25. 1625. who, by an Agreement with his Brother George William, had the Principality of Calenberg made over to him; and in 1668. married the Lady Benedicta Henrietta Philippina, Edward, Count Palatine of the Rhine, and Duke of Never's Daughter. He was given to Popery; and died at Ausburg, in
his way to Rome, Dec. 28. 1679. having had I≈ø≈øue only Daughters, viz.
1. Anne Sophia, born 1670. decea≈øed 1671.
2. Charlotte Felicitas, born March 8. 1671.
3. Henrietta Maria Jo≈øepha, born March 9. 1672. decea≈øed in France. 1687. And,
4. Wilhelmina Amalia, born Ap. 26. 1673.
4. Sophia Amalia, born March 24. 1628. married to Frederick the Third, King of Denmark, 1643. decea≈øed Feb. 20. 1685.

5. Erne≈øtus Augu≈øtus, Bi≈øhop of O≈øenburg, born Nov. 10. 1629. a Prince no le≈øs renowned in the Camp than Church. He ≈øucceeded his Brother John Frederick in Calenberg, and cau≈øed the States of that Principality, as well as Subjects, ≈øolemnly to do him Homage, Oct. 22. and 23. 1680. In 1658. he took to Wife the Lady Sophia, Daughter of Frederick the Fifth, Elector Palatine, and King of Bohemia, which mo≈øt happy Match has given Birth to a noble I≈ø≈øue, who≈øe Names are as follow, viz.
1. George Lewis, Prince Hereditary, born May 28. 1660. who has given ≈øignal Proofs of his Courage, both in the French and Turki≈øh Wars. On Nov. 21. 1682. he ≈øolemnly married his Cou≈øin-Germain Sophia Dorothy afore≈øaid, who was brought to Bed, Oct. 30. in the following Year, of
1. George Augu≈øtus; as al≈øo of
2. William Erne≈øte, in 1685.
2. Frederick Augu≈øt, Captain of the Guards in the Imperial Army, again≈øt the
Turks; born Octob. 3. 1661.
3. Maximilian William, Captain General of the Guards in the Venetian Army, again≈øt the afore≈øaid Infidels, born Dec. 14. 1666.
4 Sophia Charlotte, born Oct. 20. 1668. and married to his mo≈øt Potent and Serene Highne≈øs Frederick the Third, the now Elector of Bavaria. „Äà‚óä„Äâ .
5. Charles Philip, born Oct. 13. 1669.
6. Chri≈øtian, Sept. 29. 1671. And,
7. Erne≈øt Augu≈øt, Sept. 17. 1674.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of This Family.
div.p:
¬ß. XVI. IT has been already ob≈øerved, how Otho, Henry Leo's Grand≈øon, after the decea≈øe of his Ance≈øtors, prevailed with the Emperor, Frederick the Second, to create him Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, An. 1235. See at large Henrici Meimbomii Hi≈øt. Erectionis Ducat√ªs Brun≈øvicen≈øis, which is to be found in his Rerum Germanarum, tom. 3. pag. 203. Now there belonged to this Family at that time (be≈øides the Dutchy) the Counties of Nordheim, Lawenroden, and Lutterberg, with almo≈øt all Hercinia, vulgarly called der Hark; as al≈øo the Barony of Gottingen; whereunto the City of Munde was added, An. 1246. In 1255. Albert the Great made him≈øelf Ma≈øter of A≈ø≈øeburg-Ca≈øtle with all its Dependencies, having beaten out the Barons then in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion thereof; as al≈øo of the Ca≈øtle of Wolfembuttel, by the ≈øame Methods, having vanqui≈øhed the ancient Lords of that Place. To him
likewi≈øe did the City Hamelen ≈øubmit, An. 1259. which, till that time had belonged to the Abby of Fuld. In 1305. there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of the Ca≈øtle and Di≈øtrict of Grubenhagen, with all its Appurtenances; and in 1311. upon putting down the Knights Templars, it lay claim to the Town of Gittel. In 1376. the County of Danneberg was bought by Otho the Fifth, Duke of Brun≈øwick, of Nicholas la≈øt Count thereof. The ≈øame Prince bought the Earldom of Wittenburg al≈øo, An. 1320. Another Otho of this Family purcha≈øed the Town of Waller≈øleben, An. 1337. and the Government of Bodenleich, Ten Years after. The ≈øame Prince po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed him≈øelf of the Town of Wittengen, An. 1350. and of the Town and Ca≈øtle of Hardey≈øen, in 1380. In 1388. Bernhard the Fir≈øt took the Chatellany or Government of Klotze from the Barons of Quitzou. He likewi≈øe ≈øubdued the Town and Ca≈øtle of Snackenburg on the Elbe. The ≈øame Prince, by a Treaty with the Bi≈øhop of Hilde≈øheim, was put in Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Praefecture and Ca≈øtle of Burgdorff, about the Year 1433. In 1435. William the Elder, ≈øurnamed The Victorious, annexed the County of Hallermund to his Family, as a Fief, void by the Death of the la≈øt Earl thereof. Otho the Twelfth, of Lunenburg, had the County of Eber≈øtein, and Barony of Homburg, in Dowry with his Wife. William the Victorious purcha≈øed the County of Wun≈øtorp for a certain Summ of Money, An. 1646. The ≈øame Prince made him≈øelf Ma≈øter of the Ca≈øtle and Government of Hitzgar or Hitzacker, An. Dom. 1468. William the Younger, Duke of
Brun≈øwick Wolfembuttel, bought Helm≈øtadt of its Abbot, in the Year 1490. In 1519. the County of Da≈ø≈øelen, and many other Pieces of the Bi≈øhoprick of Hilde≈øheim, were annexed to this Family, by right of Conque≈øt. In 1571. the Praefecture of Radolffshau≈øen fell to Wolfgang, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, upon the decea≈øe of Diderick, the la≈øt Noble Baron de Ple≈ø≈øe. In 1582. the County of Hoye returned to this Family, as held in Fee; as did that of Diepholt, with all its Dependancies in 1585. In 1592. the Ca≈øtle and Government of Gumb≈øe were made over to it by the Barons of that Name. In 1593. upon the death of the la≈øt Earl of Hohen≈øtein, that County fell in; as al≈øo what remained of the County of Lutterberg; particularly St. Andres, with the Government and Ca≈øtle of Schartzfeldt. In 1599. there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of the County of Blanckenburg. Duke George, of the Line of Hanouer, ≈øeized on the whole Bi≈øhoprick of Hilde≈øheim, as well as City of that Name. Moreover, by the Treaty of O≈øenburg, An. 1648. this Family obtained a Right of Alternate Succe≈ø≈øion to that Bi≈øhoprick. By the ≈øame Treaty the Mona≈øtry of Walckenried, with its Dependencies, were yielded to it. In 1671. their mo≈øt Serene Highne≈ø≈øes, the Dukes of Brun≈øwick, totally reduced that City to their Obedience. La≈øtly, by the Treaty of Nimeguen with the Swedes, An. 1678. the Governments of Tedinghu≈øen and Doweren were given up to this Hou≈øe.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øe.
div.p: ¬ß XVII. AS to what relates to the Decrea≈øe of this Family; Otho the Seventh Mortgaged Eisfeld and Duder≈øtadt, to Adolph, Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz. By the Treaty of O≈øenburg, the Dukes of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, were obliged to re≈øtore the Bi≈øhoprick of Hilde≈øheim to its ancient State and Government. By the ≈øame Pacification, the Lord≈øhips of Klettenberg and Lohr, which heretofore belonged to the County of Hohen≈øtein, were al≈øo ≈øurrendred to the Elector of Brandenburg, as Fiefs of the Principality of Halber≈øtadt.

div.head: Of its Preten≈øions.
div.p: ¬ß XVIII. THis Family lays Claim to Eisfeld and Duder≈øtadt, as only Mortgaged to the Bi≈øhoprick of Mentz; which it likewi≈øe extends to the County of Rein≈øtein, as a Dependant of the County of Blanckenburg. Moreover, the mo≈øt Serene Dukes of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg have lately taken Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, viz. An. 1689. of the Dutchy of Sax-Lawenburg, having a ju≈øt Preten≈øion thereunto.

div.head: CHAP. XI. Of the Family of He≈ø≈øe.
div.p: ¬ß. I. THat the Landtgraves of He≈ø≈øe owe their Original to the Ancient Kings of the Francks, and more e≈øpecially to Charlemaigne, is generally agreed on by mo≈øt Writers; yet are they often at a lo≈øs in making out the Series of Succe≈ø≈øion. This is certain, that about the Year 1255. Sophia, the la≈øt Heire≈øs of He≈ø≈øe and Thuringe, was married to Henry the Second, Duke of Brabant; and that upon the Death of her Brother, Herman the Second (after ≈øeveral Conte≈øts and ≈øharp Wars with the Marque≈ø≈øes of Mi≈ønia, about the Succe≈ø≈øion) ≈øhe obtain'd He≈ø≈øe for her young Son Henry the Fir≈øt; whom therefore we ≈øhall here ≈øet down, as common Father of the pre≈øent Landtgraves. He was ≈øurnamed The He≈ø≈øian, and died Ap. 8. 1308. being ≈øucceeded by his Son, Otho the Fir≈øt, who ≈øettled the Right of Succe≈ø≈øion by Primogeniture in this Family, and departed this Life about the Year 1326. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Adelheid, Counte≈øs of Ravensberg, as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Anne, married to Albert, Count Palatine of Saxony.
2. Henry the Third, ≈øurnamed Ferreus (or Iron≈øide) who had only one Son that outliv'd him, named Otho, and ≈øaid to have died by Poi≈øon, An. 1366.
3. Lewis, of whom in the next Section.
4. Herman, who had Homburg a≈ø≈øigned him, and liv'd a Batchellor. And,
5. Otho, Arch Bi≈øhop of Magdeburg, decea≈øed 1361.

div.p: ¬ß. II. Lewis, after his Brother Henry's decea≈øe, came to be Landtgrave, and took to Wife the Lady Elizabeth of Sponheim, who bore him,

1. Herman the Learned, decea≈øed May 24. 1413. (or as others 1414.) having begot Lewis the Peace-maker, who married Anne, Daughter of Frederick the Warlike, Marque≈øs of Mi≈ønia, and Elector of Saxony, and departed this Life, Jan. 17. 1457/8. leaving I≈ø≈øue,
1. Lewis the Fourth, born Sept. 7. 1438. of whom ≈øoon again.
2. Henry the Fifth, who begot William the Third, ≈øurnamed The Younger, who died without I≈ø≈øue, 1522.
3. Frederick the Fir≈øt, decea≈øed a Youth, 1464. And,
4. Herman the Third, Arch Bi≈øhop of Cologne, decea≈øed Nov. 28. 1508.

Lewis the Fourth, who ≈øucceeded his Father in the Government, departed this Life, Nov. 6. 1471. his Male I≈ø≈øue that out-liv'd him, being,
1. William the Fir≈øt, who having had a ≈øort of Love-Potion given him in Italy, became ever after weak in his Under≈øtanding, and unfit for the Government: He died without Male I≈ø≈øue, An. Dom. 1515. And,
2. William the Second, or The Midling, who, by rea≈øon of his Brother's incapacity, took upon him the Government, and died June 11. 1509. His Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was

Philip the Fir≈øt, ≈øurnamed The Magnanimous, a Prince worthy the noble≈øt Character. He was born An. 1504. and at fourteen Years old, or thereabout, entred on the Government, being declared of Age by the Emperor Maximilian the Fir≈øt. In 1527. he brought the Reformed Religion into He≈ø≈øe, and Founded an Univer≈øity at Marpurg, about ≈øome four Years after. He took part with John Frederick, Elector of Saxony, again≈øt the Emperor Charles the Fifth: Whereupon he was Pro≈øcribed; and notwith≈øtanding he was again reconciled to the Emperor, by the Interce≈ø≈øion of Duke Maurice, the new Elector of Saxony; yet was he, after that, clapt up in Pri≈øon, contrary to the Emperor's Promi≈øe, and kept there Five Years. He departed this Life May 31. 1567. having had to Wife the Lady Chri≈øtina, Daughter of George Barbatus, Duke of Saxony, of the Albertine Line, and by her a numerous Off-≈øpring, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.

list.item: 1. Anne, born Oct. 26. 1526. married to Wolfgang, Prince Palatine of Deux Ponts, An. 1544. decea≈øed July 16. 1591.
2. Agnes, born May 31. 1529. and married, after the decea≈øe of Maurice. Elector of Saxony, her fir≈øt Husband, to John Frederick the Second, Dake of Saxony, of the Albertine Line; ≈øhe died 1555.
3. William the Fourth, born June 24. 1532/3; of whom in the next Section, as Author of the Line of Ca≈ø≈øel.
4. Philip Lewis, decea≈øed an Infant, 1534.
5. Barbara, born Ap. 8. 1536. married in 1555. to George, Count of Wurtenburg, Mompelgart, and after his decea≈øe to Daniel, Count Waldeck. She died 1568.
6. Lewis the Fifth, born May 27. 1537. who≈øe Re≈øidence was at Marpurg, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, An. Dom. 1604.
7. Elizabeth, born Feb. 13. 1539. married to Lewis the Sixth, Elector Palatine, 1560. decea≈øed March 14. 1582.
8. Philip the Second, born Ap. 22. 1541. who kept his Court at Rheinfeld, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, Nov. 20. 1583.
9. Chri≈øtina, born June 29. 1543. affianced to Adolph, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Getterp, Dec. 17. 1564. decea≈øed 1604. And,
10. George the Fir≈øt, born Sept. 10. 1547. of whom beneath in the Line of Darm≈øtadt.

div.head: Of the Line of Ca≈ø≈øel.
div.p:
¬ß III. WE now return to William the Fourth, in whom the Line of Ca≈ø≈øel began. He was very well skilled in the Tongues, and a great admirer of A≈øtronomy. He left no Stone unturned for his Father's Relea≈øement, who≈øe Succe≈ø≈øor he afterwards was. His Death bears Date Aug. 25. 1592. His Wife was Sabina, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher Duke of Wurtenberg: Decea≈øed Augu≈øt 17. 1581. And
his Children that lived to be Men and Women were as follow; viz.

list.item: 1. Anne Mary, born January 27. 1566. married to Lewis Count Na≈ø≈øau in Saarbrucken 1589. decea≈øed, 1626.
2. Hedewig, born June 30. 1569. and married to Erne≈øt Duke of Hol≈øtein, of Schaumburg Family, An. 1596.
3. Maurice the fir≈øt, born May 25. 1572. Of whom immediately. And,
4. Chri≈øtina, born Oct. 29. 1578. Affianced to John Erne≈øt, Duke of Sax-Ey≈ønach, 1598. decea≈øed June 19. 1658.

div.p: Maurice ≈øucceeded his Father, and was a Prince of excellent Parts; well acquainted with the Greek, Latin, Spani≈øh, Italian, and French Tongues. Wholly addicted to the Reformed Religion. He had a Di≈øpute with the Line of Darm≈øtadt concerning the Succe≈ø≈øion to their Uncle Lewis of Marpurg's Inheritance. In ≈øhort, he was of great Authority in the Empire; and departed this life March 15. 1632. having given up the Government ≈øome five Years before to his Son William the Fifth. His fir≈øt Prince≈øs was Agnes of Solms, decea≈øed 1593. His other, Juliana of Na≈ø≈øau of the Line of Dillenburg; by which la≈øt Lady he had eighteen Children, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.

list.item:
1. Otho the fourth, born Decem. 25. 1594. Con≈øtituted Admini≈øtrator of Hirsfeld, An 1605. In 1612 he was pre≈øent at the Emperor Matthias's Coronation; and three Years after ≈øent in his Father's Name to Complement the French King Lewis
the thirteenth. In 1617. he came to a violent and untimely end, by being ca≈øually Shot Dead by a Musket, Aug. 7 Nor left he any I≈ø2ue by either of his Wives; the fir≈øt being Catharine ∆≤r≈øula, Daughter of George Frederick, Marqui≈øs of Baden-Durlach, decea≈øed Decem. 21. 1616. The other, Agnes Magdalen, Daughter of John George the fir≈øt Prince of Anhault, who died 1626.
2. Elizabeth, born March 24. 1596. married to John Albert Duke of Meckleburg-Gu≈øtrow, Anno 1618. decea≈øed Decem. 16. 1625.
3. Maurice the ≈øecond, born 1600. decea≈øed Aug. 11. 1612.
4. William the fifth, born Feb. 14. 1602. of whom more in the next Section, as Propagator of this Line.
5. Philip the third, born Nov. 26. 1604. who ≈øerv'd in the Dani≈øh Forces, and fell at the Battle of Lutter in Barenburg, Aug. 27. 1626.
6. Agnes, born March 13. 1606. married to John Ca≈øimire Prince of Anhault-Di≈ø≈øaw, Anno 1623. decea≈øed May 28. 1650.
7. Herman the fourth, born Aug. 15. 1607. who kept his Re≈øidence at Rottenburg on the Fuld, where he died without I≈ø≈øue, Anno 1658.
8. Juliana, born Oct. 7. 1608. decea≈øed Dec. 15. 1628.
9. Sabina, born 1610. decea≈øed 1620.
10. Magdalen, born Aug. 25. 1611. and married to Erick Adolph Count Solms, 1646.
11. Maurice the third, born 1614. decea≈øed 1633.
12. Sophia, 1615. and affianced to Philip Count de Lippe, Oct. 18. 1644.

13. Frederick the ≈øecond, born May 9. 1617. who had his Seat at E≈øchwegen Ca≈øtle on the River Werra; but ≈øerv'd the King of Sweden again≈øt the Poles, by whom he was ≈ølain at Co≈ølin a City in Pomerania, Sept. 24. 1655. His Wife was Eleanor Catharine, Daughter of John Ca≈øimire Prince Palatine of Deux-Ponts, whom he married, An. 1646. which Match gave birth to three Daughters now living, who≈øe Names are,
1. Chri≈øtina, born Oct. 30. 1649. married to Ferdinand Albert Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg of the Line of Wolfembuttel 1667. who≈øe Relict ≈øhe now is.
2. Juliana, born 1652. and e≈øpou≈øed by the Free Baron of Zilienburg. And,
3 Charlotte, born Oct. 30. 1653. married to Augu≈øtus Duke of Sax-Quernfurt 1673, and after his decea≈øe, which happened the Year following, to John Adolph Count Tecklenburg.
14. Chri≈øtian, born 1622. decea≈øed Dec. 14. 1641.

15. Erne≈øt, born Dec. 9. 1523. who≈øe Re≈øidence was in Rheinfeld Ca≈øtle. In 1652 he turn'd Catholick; and died Feb. 19. 1682 leaving I≈ø≈øue by the Lady Mary Eleanor o ‚Ä¢
Solms, two Sons, viz.
1. William, born 1648. and married in 1669. to the Lady Mary Anne of Wertheim, by whom he has had I≈ø≈øue only a Daughter, named Mary Eleanor, and decea≈øed almo≈øt as ≈øoon as born. And
2. Charles the ≈øecond, born 1650. In 1667. he married Sophia Magdalen of Solms; who dying at Venice in 75. he the ≈øame Year took to Wife Alexandrina Juliana of Leiningen; by the fir≈øt Venture he has I≈ø≈øue now living; (1) William Canon of Cologne, born 1671. Frederick, born 1673. who likewi≈øe enjoys the ≈øame Dignity. And Philip, born 1674.
16. Chri≈øtina, born July 9. 1625. decea≈øed July 25. 1626.
17. Philip, born 1627. decea≈øed July 8. 1629. And,
18. Elizabeth, born 1628. decea≈øed Feb. 11. 1636.

div.p:
¬ß. IV. William mentioned by us in the foregoing Section, Number 5. ≈øucceeded his Father a the Government, and in 1628. came to an Agreement with the Line of Darm≈øtadt about the ≈øucce≈ø≈øion to their Uncle Lewis's Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion, and other matters hitherto controverted. He took part with the King of Sweden; and departed this life Sept. 21. 1637. His Prince≈øs was Amalia Elizabeth of Hanaw, married to him Nov. 21. 1619. who bore him twelve Children (whereof only four liv'd to be of Age) and died her≈øelf Aug. 8. 1651. having bred up her Children excellently well; and managed the Government, during her Son's minority with wonderful Prudence and Succe≈øs. The Names of the Surviving I≈ø≈øue were,
1. Aemilia, born Feb. 12. 1626. married to Henry Charles de Tremoville Prince of Taranto 1648. decea≈øed 1686.
2. Charlotte, born Nov. 20. 1627. married to Charles Lewis Elector Palatine 1650. decea≈øed a Widow March 16. 1686.
3. William the Sixth, born May, 29. 1629. of whom ≈øoon again.
4. Elizabeth, Lady Abbe≈øs of Herverden, born June 23. 1634.

William the Sixth ≈øucceeded his Father, and in 1649. took to Wife the Lady Hedewig Sophia, Daughter of George William Elector of Brandenburg. He twice Defeated the Imperiali≈øts; and died July 15. 1663. having had I≈ø≈øue as followeth; viz.

list.item: 1. Charlotte Amalia, born Ap. 27. 1650. and married in 1668. to the pre≈øent King of Denmark.
2. William the Seventh, born June 21. 1651. decea≈øed in his way to Paris, Nov. 21. 1670.
3. Lovi≈øe, born 1652. decea≈øed the Year following.

4. Charles the pre≈øent Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe Ca≈ø≈øel, born Aug. 3. 1654. who on May 21. 1673. took to Wife the Lady Mary Amalia, Daughter of James Duke of Curland, who has born him I≈ø≈øue as followeth; viz.
1. William, born March 29. 1674. decea≈øed 16‚Äî
2. Charles, born 1675. decea≈øed Dec. 7. 1677.
3. Frederick, the pre≈øent Prince Hereditary, born Ap. 28. 1676.
4. Chri≈øtian, born 1677. and ≈øince dead.
5. Sophia Charlotte, born July 16. 1678.
6. Charles, June 12. 1680.
7. William, born 1682. ≈øince decea≈øed. And,
8. Leopold, born Dec. 30. 1684.

5. Philip the fifth, born Dec. 14. 1655. who Re≈øides at Hir≈øchfeld; and in 1680. married the Lady Amalia Catharine of Solms, by whom he has I≈ø≈øue,
1. Wilhelmina Hedewig, born Oct. 9. 1681. And,
2. Charles, Sept. 23. 1682.
6. George the fourth, born March 20. 1657. decea≈øed, 1674. And,
7. Elizabeth Henrietta, born 1661. married to Frederick the Third, the pre≈øent Elector of Brandenburg, Aug. 23 167‚Äîdecea≈øed June 27. 1683.

div.head: Of the Line of Darm≈øtadt.
div.p:
