¬ß. V. AMong≈øt the Sons of Philip the Magnanimous above named, there was mention made of George the Fir≈øt, as Author of the Line of Darm≈øtadt, Section 2. Number 10. This prince founded Thirteen Country Schools, and died Feb. 7. 1596. having had the Lady Magdalen of Lappe, decea≈øed 1587. to his fir≈øt Wife; and Eleanor, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher of Wurtenburg, Joachim Erne≈øtus Prince of Anhault's Widow, who died 1618. to his Second. By the≈øe Ladies he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Philip Lewis, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1576.
2. Lewis the Sixth, born Sep. 24. 1577. of whom in the next Section.
3. Chri≈øtina, born Nov. 28. 1578. affianced to Frederick Magnus Count d'Erpach; decea≈øed 1596.
4. Elizabeth, born Nov. 26. 1579. given in marriage to John Ca≈øimire, Count Palatine in Saarbrucken; decea≈øed 1625.
5. Mary Hedewig, born 1580. decea≈øed 1581.
6. Philip the Fourth, who had his Seat at Butzbach, and mi≈øerably peri≈øhed in a Bath, Ap. 28. 1643. leaving no I≈ø≈øue.
7. Anne, born March 3. 1583. married to Erne≈øt Count Solms; decea≈øed 1601.
8. Frederick the Third, born May the 5th, of whom more beneath, in the Branch of Homburg.
9. Magdalen, born 1586. all ≈øhort liv'd.
10. Joan, 1587. And, all ≈øhort liv'd.
11. Henry, 1590. all ≈øhort liv'd.

¬ß. VI. We now return to Lewis the Sixth, who Founded the Univer≈øity at Gie≈ø≈øen, Oct. 10. 1605. In 1622. he was taken Pri≈øoner by Frederick the Fifth, Elector Palatine; but ≈øoon after ≈øet at liberty by him. He fir≈øt cau≈øed the Right of Primogeniture to obtain in his Line; and died July 27. 1626. His Wife was Magdalen, of John George, Elector of Brandenburg, who died 1616. having born him Twelve Children, who≈øe Names were, as follow;
1. Elizabeth Magdalen, born Apr. 25. 1600. married to Lewis Frederick of Wurtenburg, July 13. 1617. decea≈øed 1624.
2. Anne Eleanor, born July 30. 1601. married to George, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg,
of the Line of Hanouer, Dec. 14. 1617. decea≈øed 1640.
3. Mary, born 1602. decea≈øed 1610.
4. Sophia Agnes, born Jan. 12. 1604. and married to John Frederick, Count Palatine of the Line of Newburg, Nov. 7. 1614.
5. George the Second, born March 17. 1605. of whom in the next Section.
6. Juliana, born Apr. 14. 1606. married to Ulrick, Earl of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland, March 5. 1631. decea≈øed Jan. 15. 1659.
7. Amalia, born 1607 decea≈øed Sept. 11. 1627.
8. John the Second, born June 17. 1609. a Prince of great Courage and Prudence in the Government of his Family: He had his Seat at Braubach; where he died I≈ø≈øuele≈øs, Apr. 1. 1641.
9. Henry the Seventh, born Apr. 1. 1612. Con≈øul for the German Nation at Siena; where he died, An. 16‚Äî.
10. Hedewig, born 1613. decea≈øed 1616.
11. Lewis, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1614.
12. Frederick the Fifth, born Feb. 28. 1616. who turning Catholick, was Con≈øtituted Grand Prior of the Order of St. John of Jeru≈øalem, throughout all Germany, An. 1651. promoted to be Cardinal and Protector of the German Nation at the Court of Rome, 1652. Elected and Con≈øecrated Bi≈øhop of Bre≈ølaw, 1673. decea≈øed 1682.

¬ß. VII. George the Second, who had been a great Traveller, ≈øucceeded his Father; and came to an Agreement with the Landtgrave of
„Äà1 page duplicate„Äâ
„Äà1 page duplicate„Äâ
Ca≈ø≈øel, concerning ≈øeveral matters hitherto in Di≈øpute betwixt the two Lines of Ca≈ø≈øel and Darm≈øtadt on May 27. 1628. He departed this Life June 2. 1671. having had to Wife the Lady Sophia Eleanor, Daughter of John George the Fir≈øt, Elector of Saxony, decea≈øed the ≈øame day with her Husband: Which happy Marriage gave Birth to the following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item: 1. Lewis the Seventh, born Jan. 25. 1630. of whom ≈øoon again.
2. Magdalen Sibil, born Sept. 3. 1631. decea≈øed 1651.

3. George the Third, born Sept. 29. 1632. who ≈øerv'd the King of Sweden in his Wars: After which he had the Seigniory of Ittern a≈ø≈øigned him; and had his u≈øual Re≈øidence in Lauterbach Ca≈øtle. His death bears date July 19. 1676. And his fir≈øt Wife was Dorothy Augu≈øta, Daughter of John Chri≈øtian, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Sunderburg; after who≈øe decea≈øe, An. 1667. he married the Lady Alexandrina Juliana of Leiningen, and had I≈ø≈øue by her Three Daughters, viz. Sophia Juliana, decea≈øed in her Infancy; Eleanor Dorothy, born Aug. 15. 1669. and Magdalen Sibil, born Oct. 14. 1671.
4. Sephia Eleanor, born Jan. 4. 1634. married to her Cou≈øin William Chri≈øtopher of Bingenheim, of the Branch of Homburg, 1650. decea≈øed Oct. 10. 1663.
5. Elizabeth Amalia, born the 19th. (or 20th.) of March 1635. and happily married to Philip William, Elector Palatine, Aug. 24. 1653.
6. Lovi≈øe Chri≈øtina, born Feb. 5. 1636. and e≈øpou≈øed in 1665. by Lewis Chri≈øtopher, Count Stolberg.
7. Anne Mary, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1637.
8. Anne Sophia, Lady Abbe≈øs of Quedlingburg, born Dec. 17. 1638. decea≈øed 1683.
9. Amalia Juliana, born and decea≈øed 1639.
10. Anonyma, decea≈øed 1640.
11. Henrietta Dorothy, born Oct. 14. 1641. married to John, Count Waldeck, 1667. decea≈øed Dec. 22. 1672.
12. John, born Nov. 24. 1642. decea≈øed the Year following.
13. Augu≈øta Philippina, born 1643. decea≈øed 1672.
14. Agnes, decea≈øed almo≈øt as ≈øoon as born 1645. And,
15. Mary Hedewig, born Nov. 26. 1647. married to Bernhard, Duke of Sax Meinungen, Nov. 20. 1671. decea≈øed Apr. 19. 1680.

div.p:
¬ß. VIII. We mu≈øt now return to Lewis the Seventh, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor, born 1630. decea≈øed Apr. 24. 1678. who≈øe fir≈øt Wife was the Lady Mary Elizabeth, Daughter of Frederick, Duke of Hol≈øtein-Gottorp, decea≈øed An. Dom. 1665. And after her death. Elizabeth Dorothy, Daughter of Erne≈øtus, Duke of Sax-Getha; which la≈øt is now living, and a Widows His I≈ø≈øue by the≈øe were and are as follow:
1. Magdalen Sibil, born Apr. 28. 1652. and married to William Lewis of Wurtenburg, Nov. 6. 1673. who≈øe Relict ≈øhe now is
2. Sophia Eleanor, born and dead the ≈øame Year, 1653.
3. George, born 1654. decea≈øed the Year after.
4. Mary Elizabeth, born March 11. 1656. and married to Henry Duke of Sax Romhild, of the Branch of Gotha, An. Dom. 1676.
5. Augu≈øta Magdalen, born 1657. decea≈øed 1674.
6. Lewis the Eighth, born June 22. 1658. decea≈øed Aug. 31. 1678.
7. Frederick the Sixth 1659. decea≈øed 1676.
8. Sophia Mary, born March 6. 1661. married to Chri≈øtian, Duke of Sax-Ei≈øenberg, of the Branch of Gotha, An. 1681. decea≈øed 1688.
9. Erne≈øtus Louis, born Dec. 15. 1667. the now Prince Regent of this Line: Who has taken to Wife the Lady Charlotte, Daughter of Albert, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg An≈øpach, An. 1687.
10. George, born Apr. 25. 1669.
11. Sophia Lovi≈øe, July 6. 1670.
12. Philip, July 20 (or 21.) 1671.
13. John, born 1672. decea≈øed the Year following.
14. Henry, born Sept. 29. 1674.
15. Elizabeth Dorothy, Apr. 2. 1676. And,
16. Frederick, Sept. 18. 1677.

div.head: Of the Branch of Homburg.
div.p: ¬ß. IX. IT remains, we now treat of the Branch of Homburg, which began in Frederick the Third, mentioned by us in the Fifth Section, Numb. 8. This Prince departed this Life May 9. 1638. having had to Wife, Mary Elizabeth of Leiningen; and by her I≈ø≈øue, as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Lewis Philip, born Aug. 20. 1623. decea≈øed March 16. 1643.
2. George, born 1624. decea≈øed the Year after.

3. William Chri≈øtopher, born Nov. 13. 1625. who had his Seat at Bingenheim, and took to Wife the Lady Sophia Eleanor, Daughter of George the Second, of Darm≈øtadt, on Aug. 21. 1650. After who≈øe decea≈øe, An. 1663. he married Anne Elizabeth, Daughter of Augu≈øtus, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg, in the Year 1665. From whom he was neverthele≈øs afterwards Divorced; and died Aug. 27. 1681. leaving I≈ø≈øue by the fir≈øt Venture,
1. Chri≈øtina Wilhelmina, the now Relict of Frederick, Duke of Meckleburg, born Jan. 3. 1653. And,
2. Magdalen Sophia, born Ap. 24. 1660 the Wife of William Maurice, Count Solms, to whom ≈øhe was married 1679.

4. George Chri≈øtian, born Dec. 10. 1626. who went over to the Church of Rome. In 1666. he married the Lady Anne Catharine, Daughter of ‚Äî Pogwi≈øch, of the
Hou≈øe of Farbe, Frederick Count Ablefeld's Widow; yet died without I≈ø≈øue, Aug. 11. 1677.
5. Anne Margaret, born Aug. 31. 1629. and married to Philip Lewis, Duke of Hol≈øtem, of the Line of Sunderburg, An. 1650.

6. Frederick the Fourth, born May 30. 1633. who being bred to Arms, took pay at fir≈øt under the Swedes, in who≈øe Service he lo≈øt a Leg at the Siege of Copenhagen; but afterwards under his Highne≈øs the Elector of Brandenburg, who in regard of his Merit, made him a Lieutenant-General. His u≈øual Re≈øidence was at Weferlingen. Ca≈øtle, in the old Marqui≈øate; but upon his Brethren's Decea≈øe, he ≈øucceeded to their E≈øtates; and ≈øo removed it to Bingenheim. His fir≈øt Wife was the Lady Margaret Brahe, Daughter of Count John Oxen≈øtern, Lord High Mare≈øchal to his Swedi≈øh Maje≈øty, who died 1669. Whereupon he made choice of the Lady Lovi≈øe Elizabeth, Daughter of James, Duke of Curland for his Second, An. 1671. By the latter he has I≈ø≈øue,
1. Frederick, born 1673.
2. Charles Chri≈øtian, 1674. And,
3. Philip, 1676.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of This Family.
div.p:
¬ß. X. WE have already ≈øaid, how Sophia de≈øcended of the mo≈øt Ancient He≈ø≈øen Thuringian Family, acquired the Landtgraviate of He≈ø≈øe for her Son Henry of Brabant.
This Henry annexed the City of Immenhau≈øen thereunto, An. 1280. as al≈øo the Ca≈øtle of Gudensberg, the Year following. In 1290. there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of E≈øchwegen, of Stauffenberg, 1293. and of Treffurt, on the River Werra, An. 1329. Henry Ferreus (or Iron≈øide) bought the Ca≈øtle of Konigs, An. 1350. for two thou≈øand Florins. Three Years after this, the Seigniory of Ittern, was adjoyned to this Family. The ≈øame Henry bought the City of Smalcald, An. 1360. In 1386. upon the Decea≈øe of Gerla
‚Ä¢ bius, the la≈øt Earl of Dietzen, the greate≈øt part of that County was claimed by this Family. In 1453. upon the death of the la≈øt Count of Zeigenheim, that County al≈øo, and Nidda fell ‚Ä¢ o it. In 1464. Henry the Fifth had the County of Battenberg ≈øettled on him by the Arch-Bi≈øhop of Mentz. In 1478. there was an Acce≈ø≈øion of Butzbach by Right of Marriage. The ≈øaid Henry bought Fridenwalde-Ca≈øtle, An. 1480. In 1492. William added the Lord≈øhip of Ep≈øtein, to his other Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øions. In 1557. ‚Ä¢ his Family, after ≈øeveral Di≈øputes about the matter, became po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the whole County of Catzen Elnbogen. In 1504. the Seigni
‚Ä¢ ory of Bickenbach fell to it, the Ancient Barons thereof becoming at that time extinct. In 1571. the Lord≈øhip of Ple≈ø≈øe was annex'd to it, and part of the County of Hoye; as was al≈øo the Barony of Francken≈øtein, ≈øome Two Years after. In 1600. Lewis of Darm≈øtadt, bought Kel≈øterbach on the River. La≈øt of all, by the Peace of O≈øenburg, An. 1648. the Juri≈ødiction of Hir≈øchfeld-Abby, but with the Title of a Principality, was yielded up to the Landtgrave;
as was al≈øo good part of the County of Schaumburg.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øe and Preten≈øions.
div.p:
¬ß. XI. THe Encroachments ≈øuffered by th ‚Ä¢ Family and Preten≈øions, which may thence ari≈øe, are ≈øo very incon≈øiderable that they are ≈øcarce worth taking notice of, unle≈øs we ≈øhall here alledge the great Ravages and Deva≈øtations made in the Principality „Äà‚óä„Äâ
Darm≈øtadt by the French: And it has been already ob≈øerved, how this Family has entre into Articles of Agreement to a mutual Succe≈ø≈øion, with the Family of Saxony and Brandenburg.

div.head: CHAP. XII. Of the Family of Meckleburg.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THat this Family is de≈øcended from the Ancient Kings of the Herah and Ob ‚Ä¢ tr ‚Ä¢ ti, is the Opinion of almo≈øt all Writers, yet are they often wanting in the Line of Succe≈ø≈øion. This is certain, That Pr ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ lans the Second, was reduced to ≈øuch Extremities by Henry the Lyon, Duke of Saxony, that he was forc'd with all Submi≈ø≈øion to demand a Peace of him; which indeed he did obtain, together with a con≈øiderable Tract of Land betwixt the Elbe and Baltick Shore; but ‚Ä¢ et. to content him≈øelf for the future with the Stile of Duke: In which Stile he made publick Profe≈ø≈øion of the Chri≈øtian Faith, and was Baptized at Lunenburg by the Abbot of St. Michael, with great Solemnity. He was alterwards Slain by a Tragical accident in a Tournament at Lunenburg; An. 1215. His fir≈øt Wi≈øe was Maud, Daughter of Bole≈øtans Cri≈øpns, Duke of Poland; and his ≈øecond Voisboda, Daughter of Burewin, King of Norway; by which la≈øt he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Henry Burewin, decea≈øed 1218. having had to Wife the Lady Maud, Daughter of Henry the Lyon, Duke of Saxony, and by her Two Sons, namely,
1. Nichol ‚Ä¢ t, mi≈øerably buried in the Ruins of an old Hou≈øe. And,
2. Henry, Founder of the Cathedral at Gu≈øtrow, decea≈øed 1228. who≈øe Dutche≈øs was the Prince≈øs Sophia, Daughter of Charles the Fir≈øt, King of Sweden, by whom he had Four Sons, who≈øe Names were as follow, viz.
1. John the Divine, of whom in the next Section.
2. Pribi≈ølaus the Third, Lord in Parchim, the only Per≈øon of all his Family, who continued a Pagan: He begat Pribi≈ølaus the Fourth, who died Childle≈øs.
3. Burewin the Third, who≈øe Patrimony was the City Ro≈øtock, where he Founded the Mona≈øtry of St. John; and had I≈ø≈øue by Margaret of Denmark, Three Sons,
1. Henry, both which died without I≈ø≈øue. And,
2. Erick, both which died without I≈ø≈øue. And,
3. Woldemar, decea≈øed 1287. leaving one Son; Nicholot the Sixth, ≈øurnamed the Boy of Ro≈øtock, who likewi≈øe had no I≈ø≈øue.
4. Nicholot the Fifth, decea≈øed 1277. leaving I≈ø≈øue (be≈øides Bernhard and Henry the Fourth) a Third Son, named,
John the Second, who died 1316 and was Father of
Nicholot the Seventh, which Nicholot was ≈øucceeded in the Di≈øtrict of Ro≈øtock by his Son,

John the Third, who, by Maud, Daughter of Barnim the Second, Duke of Pomerania, had I≈ø≈øue,
1. John the Fourth. And,
2. Nicholot the Eighth, who had no Male I≈ø≈øue; but John begot,
1. Nicholot the Ninth. And,
2. Bernhard.
Nicholot the Ninth was Father of
Laurence, who departed this Life 1393. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Maud, Daughter of Nicholot the Eighth, a Son named Baltha≈øar; decea≈øed 1400. (or as others 1401.)
As for Benhard, he begat,

John the Fifth, who was Father of Three Sons; namely,
1. Chri≈øtopher, decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue.
2. Nicholot the Tenth, a Prince highly e≈øteemed for his Piety and Prudence in the Government of his Family, who died An. 1406. And,
3. William, who departed this Life 1430. leaving only a Daughter, named Katharine, and married to the la≈øt Prince of Stargart.

¬ß. II. We now return to John the Divine; who Studied 20 Years at the Univer≈øity of Paris, where he commenced Doctor of Divinity: He departed this Life 1260. leaving by his Wi≈øe Luitgarde, Daughter of Pepp ‚Ä¢ , Count de Henneberg (be≈øides other I≈ø≈øue) a Son named,

Henry the Fourth, and ≈øurnamed of Jeru≈øalem, for his good Services in the Holy War; in which he was taken Pri≈øoner by the Saracens, and not ≈øet at liberty till above Twenty ≈øix Years after. He died, An. 1302. having begot,
Henry the Lyon (or Seventh) on his Wife, the Prince≈øs Ana≈øta≈øia, Daughter of Barnim, Duke of Pomerania-Stetin. This Leo (or the Lyon) who died 1329. his Elde≈øt Son's Name was,

Albert the Fir≈øt, Matriculated and declared Prince of the Empire by the Emperor Charles the Fourth. He departed this Life 1380. having married Euphemia, Daughter of Magnus, King of Sweden; by whom he had Two Sons, viz.

list.item:
1. Albert the Second, who was elected King of Sweden; but being overcome, and made Pri≈øoner by Margaret, Queen of Denmark, An. 1388. was kept ≈øo by her for ≈øeven Years, and then ≈øet at liberty; which yet he enjoyed not long; for he died the Year following, viz. 1396. His Two Wives were, fir≈øt, F ‚Ä¢ ch≈øa, Daughter of Otho, the la≈øt
Earl of Swerin; And, ≈øecondly, Helena, Daughter of Magnus Torquatus, Duke of Brun≈øwick; by which la≈øt he had I≈ø≈øue Two Sons,
1. Erick the Fir≈øt. And but both died without I≈ø≈øue.
2. Albert the ‚Äî but both died without I≈ø≈øue.
2 Magnus the Fir≈øt, who died at Aix la Chapelle, An. 1384. and was ≈øucceeded in his Dutchy by his Son,

div.p: John the Third, who Founded the Unvier≈øity at Ro≈øtock, in 1415. and had the ≈øame opened and confirmed four Years after. He departed this Life, An. 1423. leaving the Government of his Provinces to his Son, Henry the Fourth.
¬ß. III. This Henry the Fourth, ≈øurnamed The Gro≈øs, died 1477. having had to Wife, Dorothy, Daughter of Frederick the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg, and by her this following I≈ø≈øue, viz.

list.item: 1. Anne, decea≈øed a Maid, 1464.
2. Elizabeth, Lady Abbe≈øs of Reibnitz.
3. Albert the Sixth, decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, 1491.
4. John the Sixth, who died of the Plague, 1475.
5. Baltha≈øar, decea≈øed al≈øo without I≈ø≈øue, March 7. 1507.

6. Magnus the Second (in who≈øe I≈ø≈øue this Family was pre≈øerved) who Founded the Cathedral; and died Nov. 22. 1503. having had to Wife the Lady Sophia, Daughter
of Erick the Second, Duke of Pomerania, decea≈øed 1504. Which Match gave Birth to
1. Henry the Fifth, ≈øurnamed Pacificus (or The Peace-Maker) who brought the true Doctrine of Chri≈øt into his Dominions, according to the Lutheran Profe≈ø≈øion: But whereas his Two Sons, Magnus the Third, and Philip, died both without I≈ø≈øue; the Government fell to his Brother Albert's Elde≈øt Son; as we ≈øhall ≈øhow immediately.
2. Erick the Second, decea≈øed 1508.
3. Sophia, married to John, Elector of Saxony, An. 1500. decea≈øed July 12. 1503.
4. Anne, to William, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, An. 1500. and after his decea≈øe to Otho, Count Solms. She died 1525.
5. Catharine, the Wife of Henry, Duke of Saxony, of the Line of Albert, decea≈øed June 6. 1561.
6. Dorothy, Lady Abbe≈øs of Reibnitz. And,
7. Albert the Seventh, ≈øurnamed The Fair, born May 3. 1487. decea≈øed Jan. 10. 1547. His Wife was Anne, Daughter of Joachim the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg; and his Elde≈øt Son, John Albert the Fir≈øt.

div.p: This John Albert was a very Learned Prince, Governed his Provinces excellently well, and departed this Life Feb. 2. 1576. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Anne Sophia, Daughter of Albert, Duke of Pru≈ø≈øia, and Marque≈øs of Brandenburg.

list.item:
1. John the Seventh, who being grievou≈øly oppre≈øt with Melancholy, laid violent hands on him≈øelf at Stargart, March 22. 1592. His Sons by Sophia, Daughter of Adolph, Duke of Hol≈øtein, were,
1. Adolph Frederick, born Dec. 4. 1589. of whom in the next Section. And,
2. John Albert the Second, born May 5. 1590. of whom more below in the Line of Gu≈øtrow.

div.head: Of the Line of Swerin.
div.p:
¬ß. IV. JOhn Frederick was Author and Propagator of the pre≈øent Line of Swerin. This Prince was Pro≈øcribed with his Brother, upon his ≈øiding with Chri≈øtian the Fourth, King of Denmark; and had his Dutchy given to Wallen≈øtein, Duke of Friedland; but was again re≈øtored to it by the Victorious Arms of Gu≈øtavus Adolphus, King of Sweden, An. 1631. He departed this Life Feb. 24. 1658. being merely worn out by Age. His Wives were, fir≈øt, Anne Mary, Daughter of Enno, Earl of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland, who died 1634. And, ≈øecondly, Mary Catharine, Daughter of Julius Erne≈øtus, Duke of Lunenburg and Brun≈øwick, decea≈øed July 1. 1665. By the≈øe he had I≈ø≈øue,
1. Chri≈øtian Lewis, the pre≈øent Prince Regent, born Dec. 1. 1623. who turned Catholick, Oct. 29. 1663. and had the Order of the Holy Gho≈øt conferr'd on him by the French King. In the ≈øame Year he got him≈øelf divorc'd from Chri≈øtina Margaret of Gu≈øtrow, his Cou≈øin-Germain
and fir≈øt Wife, and married I≈øabel Angelia de Montmoreney, the Duke de Cha≈øtillon's Widow; but is like to have no I≈ø≈øue by her.
2. S ‚Ä¢ phia Agnes, born Jan. 12. 1625. who leads a ≈øingle Life, and lately liv'd in Ruen Ca≈øtle.
3. Charles the born March 8. 1626. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue, Aug. 20. 1670.
4. Anne Mary, born July 1. 1627. married to Augu≈øtus, Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, 164 decea≈øed 1669.
5. John George the Fir≈øt, born May 5. 1629. who liv'd in Mirau Ca≈øtle, and married Elizabeth Eleanor, Daughter of Anthony Ulrick, Dake of Brun≈øwick, yet had no I≈ø≈øue ≈øurviving at his death, which happened in the Year 1675.
6. Hedewig, born 1630. decea≈øed the Year after.
7. Gu≈øtavus Rudolph, born 1631. decea≈øed May 14. 1670. having never had I≈ø≈øue by his Wife the Lady Erdmuth Sophia, Daughter of Francis Henry, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg.
8. Juliana, born 1633. decea≈øed 1634.
9. Julian Sibil, born 1636. as yet unmarried.
10. Frederick, born Feb. 13. 1638. who lived at Krabow with his Wife, the Lady Chri≈øtina Wilhelmina, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher, Prince of He≈ø≈øe Bingenheim, by whom he left Two Sons ≈øurviving at his death, which happened in April, la≈øt Year, viz. 1688. who≈øe Names are, Frederick William, born March 13. 1675. And Charles, born 1679.
11. Chri≈øtina, Lady Abbe≈øs of Gender≈øheim, born 1639.
12. Bernhard Sigi≈ømand, born and dead the ≈øame Year, 1641.
13. Augu≈øta, born 1643. decea≈øed 1644.
14. Mary Elizabeth, born 1646. not yet married.
15. Anne Sophia, born Nov. 24. 1647. and married to Julius Sigi≈ømund, Duke of Wurtenburg, of the Sile≈øian Line, March 25. 1677.
16. Adolph Erne≈øt, born 1650. decea≈øed the Year after.
17. Philip Lewis, born 1652. decea≈øed 1655.
18. Henry William, born and dead the ≈øame Year, viz. 1653. And,
19. Adolph Augu≈øt, born 1650. who lives at pre≈øent in the Ca≈øtle of Strelitz; and has taken to Wife his Cou≈øin Mary, Daughter of Gu≈øtavus Adolphus, the pre≈øent Prince Regent of Meckleburg-Gu≈øtrow; by whom he hath a Son, and (as I think) of his own Name.

div.head: Of the Line of Gu≈øtrow.
div.p:
¬ß. V. THis Line began in John Albert the Second, whom we mentioned in the end of the la≈øt Section. He was of the Reformed Religion, and ended his days in the Year 1636. His Wives were, fir≈øt, Margaret Elizabeth, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher, Duke of ‚Äî Secondly, Elizabeth, Daughter of Maurice, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe. And Thirdly, Eleanor Mary, Daughter of Chri≈øtian, Prince of Anhalt.
By the fir≈øt and ≈øecond Ventures he had Nine Children; whereof Five were ≈øhort liv'd; the other Four were,
1. Sophia Elizabeth, born 1613. married to Augu≈øtus, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, 1635. decea≈øed 1676.
2. Chri≈øtina Margaret, born March 9. 1615. remarried (after the decea≈øe of Francis Albert, Duke of Sax Lawenburg, her fir≈øt Hu≈øband) to Chri≈øtian Lewis, the pre≈øent Duke of Meckleburg-Swerin; decea≈øed Aug. 16. 1666.
3. Anne Sophia, born Sept. 29. ‚Äî married to Lewis, Duke of Lignitz, 1649. decea≈øed Feb. 19. 1666. And,
4. Gu≈øtavus Adolphus, the pre≈øent Prince Regent of the Line of Gu≈øtrow, born Feb. 26. 1633. who hath taken to Wife Magdalen Sibil, Daughter of Frederick, Duke of Sle≈øwick, whom he married Nov. 28. 1654. and hath had I≈ø≈øue by her, as followeth, viz.
1. John, born 1655. decea≈øed 1660.
2. Eleanor, born 1657. decea≈øed 1672.
3. Mary, born 1659. and married to her Cou≈øin Adolph Gu≈øtavus of Swerin.
4. Magdalen, born July 4. 1660.
5. Sophia, June 21. 1662.
6. Chri≈øtina, born Aug. 14. 1663. and married to Chri≈øtian Lewis, Count Stolberg, An. 1683.
7. Charles the Second, born Nov. 18. 1664. who, in 1687. took to Wife the Prince≈øs Mary Amalia, Daughter of Frederick William the Great, Elector of Brandenburg,
yet died this excellent Prince on the 15th. of March in the following Year; and that without I≈ø≈øue.
8. Hedewig Eleanor, born Jan. 12. 1666.
9. Lovi≈øe, Aug. 28. 1667.
10. Elizabeth, Sept. 13. 1668. And,
11. Augu≈øta, Dec. 27. 1674.

div.head: Of the Augmentation of This Family.
div.p: ¬ß. VI. WHat Lands Pribi≈ølaus the Second, Duke of Meckleburg, had granted him by Henry the Lyon, Duke of Saxony, has been already ob≈øerv'd: Afterwards the Lord≈øhip of Stargart was added to this Dutchy, An. 1290. In 1301. Henry of Jeru≈øalem, ≈øubdued the City Wei≈ømar by force of Arms. In 1317. this Family had the Province of Ro≈øtock ≈øettled on it by the then King of Denmnrk. Albert the Second, having married the Daughter and Heire≈øs of Otho Ro≈øa, the la≈øt Earl of Swerin, of the Family of Barlenleb, did in her right become po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of the ≈øaid County with the City Domitz, An. 1355. In 1431. upon the death of the la≈øt Prince of the ‚Äî that Principality fell to our Family as next of Blood. In 1648. it had likewi≈øe the Bi≈øhoprick of Swerin (but with the Title of a Principality) the Bi≈øhoprick of Ratzburg, a Canonry of Magdeburg; a Canonry of Halber≈øtadt, and two Commendum's belonging to the Order of St. John; namely Mirau and Numerau, ≈øettled upon it, by way of Compen≈øation, for the lo≈øs of Wei≈ømar.

div.head: CHAP. XIII. Of the Family of Wirtenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THis Family, tho' it may be reckon'd among the mo≈øt ancient, and took its ri≈øe from the Counts of Beutelsbach of old-time; yet it got no higher than Counts, till Eberhard, ≈øurnamed The Great, born 1445. who, in the Year 1495. was declared Prince of the Empire, and Duke of Wirtenburg, after he had Founded an Univer≈øity at Tubingen, 1477. This excellent Prince dy'd without I≈ø≈øue, and was ≈øucceeded by his Father's Brother Ulrick, the Fourteenth Earl, but Fir≈øt Duke of that Name: And had I≈ø≈øue, Eberhard the Second, who ≈øucceeded his Father, but dy'd without I≈ø≈øue, Feb. 17. 1504. And Henry the Third, who dy'd Apr. 16. 1519. and left,
1. Ulrick the Second, born Feb. 8. 1487. he ≈øucceeded his Father, ≈øuffer'd much upon the account of Religion, and was, in a manner hated by his Subjects for exacting on them: He was thrown out of his Dutchy by the League of Schwaben; and Bani≈øh'd, by the Diet at Worms. At length he was re≈øtor'd in the Year 1534. by Philip, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe; the King of France furni≈øhing the Money: But ≈øo, That the Dutchy ≈øhould, for the future, become a Fee of the Hou≈øe of Au≈øtria.
In 1547. he was remov'd again, and re≈øtor'd upon very hard Terms. He dyed 1550. and left Chri≈øtopher his Succe≈ø≈øor, who had many Daughters, and but one Son, Lewis the Third, born 1568. who Founded a famous College at Tubingen, 1592. and dy'd Aug. 8. 1593. but left no I≈ø≈øue.
2. George, born 1498. he took Mompelgart, 1553. where was born to him Frederick the Magnanimous.

¬ß. II. This Frederick the Sixth, born Oct. 25. 1557. upon the death of the before-mentioned Lewis the Third, recover'd the Dutchy of Wirtenburg, and ≈øtruck off the Dominion of the Hou≈øe of Au≈øtria, but not without a round Summ of Money. He dy'd Jan. 29. 1608. and had to Wife Sibilla, Daughter of Joachim Erne≈øtus of Anbalt, whom he married May 22. 1581. and had by her,
1. John Frederick, born May 5. 1582. of whom in the next Section.
2. George Frederick, born 1583. dy'd 1591.
3. Sibilla Elizabeth, born 1584. married to John George, fir≈øt Elector of Saxony, dy'd Jan. 20. 1606.
4. Elizabeth, born 1585. dy'd the ≈øame Year.
5. Lewis Frederick, born Jan. 29. 1586, of whom in the Line of Mompelgart.
6. John Frederick, born and dead 1587.
7. Julius Frederick, born June 3. 1588. He was Pen≈øin'd, and dwelt in the Ca≈øtle of Weildingen; where he became Father of
Silvius Nimrod, of whom hereafter in the Sile≈øian Oel≈øen Line: And of Manfred, who, after the death of his Father, liv'd in Weilden; and there dy'd May 15. 1662. And by Julia, the Daughter of Anthony, Earl of Oldenburg, yet living, left,
1. Frederick Ferdinand, born Oct. 6. 1654.
2. Augu≈øtus, born Nov. 5. 1656.
3. Manfred the Second, born Sept. 15. 1658.
8. Philip Frederick, born, and dead 1589.
9. Eva Chri≈øtiana, born May 6. 1590. married to John George, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, and Duke of Carnovia, 1610. dy'd 1657.
10. Frederick Achilles, born Apr. 25. 1591. dy'd without I≈ø≈øue, Dec. 20. 1631.
11. Agnes, born May 7. 1592. married May 14. 1620. to Frances Julius, Duke of Sax-Lawenburg, dy'd Nov. 25. 1629.
12. Barbara, born Dec. 4. 1593. married Dec. 20. 1616. to Frederick, Marque≈øs of Baden Durlach, dy'd 1627.
13. Magnus, born Dec. 2. 1594. a Valiant Prince, Slain in Battel near Wimp≈øen, Apr. 26. 1622.
14. Augu≈øtus, born Jan. 24. 1596. dy'd Apr. 21. ‚Äî
15. Anne, born March 15. 1597. dy'd unmarried, 1650.

div.head: Of the Line Regent of Stutgard.
div.p:
¬ß. III. WE return to John Frederick, elde≈øt Son and Succe≈ø≈øor of Frederick the Magnanimous, who dy'd July 18. 1628. and by Barbara Sophia, Daughter of Joachim Frederick, Elector of Brandenburg had,
1. Henrica, born 1610. dy'd Feb. 18. 1623.
2. Frederick, born and dy'd 1612.
3. Antonia, born March 24. 1613. dy'd unmarried Oct. 1. 1679.
4. Eberhard the Third, born Dec. 16. 1614. of whom ≈øhortly.
5. Frederick the Seventh (or as ≈øome, the Second) born Dec. 19. 1615. who, after ≈øeveral Travels, and ≈øingular Proofs of Courage, ≈øate down at la≈øt at New≈øtadt, and there dy'd March 24. 1682. His Wife was Clara Augu≈øta, Daughter of Augu≈øtus, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, by whom he had a numerous I≈ø≈øue, Eight of which dy'd Infants: The re≈øt are,
1. Frederick Augu≈øtus, born March 12. 1654. now living at New≈øtadt.
2. Albertus, born 1657. a hopeful Prince, but dy'd Nov 21. 1670.
3. Sophia Dorethea, born 1658. married to Lewis Chri≈øtian, Count Stolberg, 1680. dy'd July 23. 1681.
4. Ferdinand William, born Sept. 12. 1659. a Prudent Prince, and well experienc'd Soldier, Lieutenant-General to the King of Denmark: He ≈øail'd for
Scotland with the Dani≈øh Auxiliaries, from the Port of Hull, 1689.
5. Charles Rodolphus, born 1667. now in the Emperor's Service.
6. Ulrick the Third, born May 15: 1617. a Prince that deferves as much as Vertue and Courage may be capable of. He dy'd Dec. 4. 1671. and left one Daughter, Anna Ignatia, born Dec. 27. 1652. but unmarried.
7. Anna Johanna, born March 13. 1619 who al≈øo dy'd unmarried, March 5 1679.
8. Sibilla, born Dec. 4. 1620. married Nov. 22. 1647. to Leopold Frederick, a Kin≈øman of the Hou≈øe of Mompelgard; now a Widow.
9. Ebethal, born Sept. 4. 1623. dy'd Jan 9. 1624.

¬ß. IV. Of all the≈øe, Eberhard the Third ≈øucceeded his Father John Frederick, an extraordinary Prince, but one that ≈øuffer'd much by the Imperiali≈øts in that Thirty Years German War, till at la≈øt all was quieted, 1648. He dy'd July 2. 1674. He married Anne Catharine, Daughter of John Ca≈øimire, the Rhinegrave, 1637. And after her Death, Mary Dorothy Sophia, Daughter of Erne≈øtus Oetingen, 1656.

He had by his fir≈øt Wife,
1. John Frederick II born Sept. 9. 1637. died at London in England, 1669. aged 22 Years.
2. Lewis Frederick, born 1638. died 1639.
3 Chri≈øtina Eberhard, born 1639. died 1640.
4. Eberhard, born 1640. died Feb. 24. 1641.
5. Sophia Loui≈øa, born Feb. 18. 1642. married Jan. 19. 1671. to Chri≈øtian Erne≈øtus, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg Bareith.
6. Dorothea Amalia, born 1643. died 1650.
7. Chri≈øtina Frederica, born Feb. 28. 1644. match'd May 25. 1655. to Albert Erne≈øtus of Oetingen; died Octob. 30. 1674.
8. Chri≈øtina Charlotta, born Octob. 21. 1645. married May 4. 1662. to George Chri≈øtian, Prince of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland; now a Widow.
9. William Lewis, born Jan. 7. 1647. he ≈øucceeded his Father, and died three Years after, in 1677. leaving by Magdalen, Daughter of Lewis, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe-Darm≈øtadt, now a Widow,
1. Eberhardine Loui≈øa, born Octob. 11. 1675.
2. Eberhard Lewis, born Sept. 18. 1676 the now Prince Regent, under the Guardian≈øhip of his Mother and his Uncle.
3 Magdalena Wilhelmina, born after the death of her Father, Nov. 7. 1677.
10 Anna Catharina, born Nov. 27. 1648. as yet unmarried.
11. Charles Chri≈øtopher, born and died Jan. 28. 1650.
12. Eberhardine Catharine, born April 12. 1651. married into the Hou≈øe of Octingen, 1652. died Aug. 19. 1683.
13. Frederick Charles, born Sept. 12. 1652. Governour of the Dutchy of Wirtenberg: He married Eleanora Juliana, Daughter of
Albert, Marqui≈øs of Brandenburg-Ansbach, 1682. by whom he had,
1. Charles Alexander born Jan. 24. 1684.
2. Dorothea Charlotta, born Sept. 1. 1685.
3. Frederick Charles, born Octob. 28. 1686.
14. Charles Maximilian, born Septemb. 28. 1654.

By his Second Wife,
15. George Frederick, born Sept. 24. 1657. Captain-General of the Emperour's Guards; ≈ølain with a Great-≈øhot at the Siege of Ca≈ø≈øaw, Oct. 8. 1685.
16. One other without Name, died as ≈øoon as born, 1659.
17. Albertus Chri≈øtianus, born June 13. 1660. died 16 ‚Ä¢ 3.
18. Lodewick (or Lewis) born Aug. 13. 1661. Colonel of a Regiment of Hor≈øe in the Circle of Schwaben.
19. Joachim Erne≈øtus, born 1662. died 1663.
20. Philip Sigi≈ømund, born 1663. died 1669.
21. Charles Ferdinand, born 1667. died 1668.
22. John Frederick, born June 10. 1669. and now ≈øerves in the Imperial War.
23. Sophia Charlotta, born Feb. 22. 1671.
24. Eberhard born and died 1672.
25. Emanuel Eberhard, born after the death of his Father, 1674. died July 1. 1675.

div.head: Of the Line of Mompelgard.
div.p:
¬ß. V. THe Founder and Enlarger of this Line, was the before ‚Äî mention'd Lewis Frederick, Sect. 2. Numb. 5. who died 1631. and was ≈øucceeded by Leopold Frederick, to whom, dying without I≈ø≈øe. 1662. ≈øucceeded his Brother George II. born Oct. 5. 1626. but being beaten out by the French, 1684. now lives in exile. His Wife was Anne, Daughter of Ja≈øper de Coligny, Mare≈øchal of France; married to him 1648. and died 1680. by whom he had,
1. Otto Frederick, born 1650. died 1653.
2. Henrietta, born Jan. 8. 1654. died 1680.
3. Eleanora Charlotta, born Nov. 20. 1656. married to Sylvius Frederick, a Cadet of the Hou≈øe of Oel≈øen.
4. Conrade Lodovick, born and died 1658.
5. Anne, born Dec. 30. 1660.
6. Elizabeth, born March 17. 16 ‚Ä¢ 5.
7. Hedewig, born March 22. 1664.
8. Leopold Eberhardus, born March 21. 1670.

div.head: Of the Sile≈øian, or Oel≈øen Line.
div.p:
¬ß. VI. WE ≈øpoke before Sect. 2. Numb. 7. of Sylvius Nimrod, the Son of Julius Frederick: He was born 1622. and married Mary, the la≈øt Heir of the Principality of Oel≈øen; the Inve≈øtiture of which, he receiv'd from the Emperour, as King of Bohemia: He died April 16. 1664. and left by the ≈øaid Mary,
1. Anna Sophia, born 1648. died 1661.
2. Ferdinand Charles, born 1650. died 1668.
3. Sylvius Fredericus, born Feb. 21. 1651. He kept his Re≈øidence in the City of Oels, and married Eleanora Charlotta of Mompelgard, May 23. 1672.
4. Chri≈øtianus Ulricus, born April 9. 1652. His Seat was the Ca≈øtle of Bern≈øtadt. He married Anne Elizabeth of Anbalt, March 13. 1672. who died 1680. and after that, Sybilla Maria, Daughter of Chri≈øtian, Admini≈øtrator of Mersburg, Oct. 27. 1683.

He had by his fir≈øt Wi≈øe,
1. Loui≈øa Elizabetha, born Feb. 22. 1673.
2. Chri≈øianus Ulricus, born and died 1674.
3. Leopoldus Victor, born 1675. died 1676.
4. Frederica Chri≈øtiana, born and died 1676.
5. Sophia Angelica, born May 20. 1677.
6. Eleanora Amaena, born 1678. died 1679.
5. Julius Sigi≈ømundus, born Aug. 1. 1653. He dwelt in the Ca≈øtle of Juliusburg, with his Wife Anna Sophia of Mecklenburg, whom he married March 25. 1677. and had by her,
1. Maria Sophia, born March 5. 1678. died Sept. 8.
2. Leopold Frederick, born Feb. 29. 1680. died April 5. 1681.
3. Charles, born March 1. 1682. after which, the ≈øaid Julius died, Octob. 15. 1684.
6. Cunigunda Juliana, born March 20. 1655. and died the ≈øame Day.
7 Sylvius, born and died May 8. 1660.

div.head: Of the Augmentations of this Family.
div.p: ¬ß. VII. IN the Year 1072. Conrade Earl of Wirtenburg, got the Earldom of Beutlesbach by Right of Inheritance. In the Year 1214. Count John II. had the City of Stutgard in Dowry with his Wife, it having formerly belong'd to the Marqui≈øate of Baden. In 1240. the Earldom of‚Äî was added to it by Purcha≈øe. In 1336. the Earldom of Gruningen. In 1346. the Earldom of Calbe. In 1397. Eberhard V. got the Earldom of Mompelgard by Marriage; and in 1439. brought the Dutchy of Teccen into the Family by the ≈øame way. In 1495. Eberhard VI. procur'd to it the Ducal Dignity. In 1620. Duke ∆≤lrick bought the Ca≈øtle of Hobentwiel. In 1646. Sylvius Nimrod was inve≈øted in the Principality of Oel≈øen, and the Signories of Starenberg and Metzibor in Moravia.

div.head: Of the Decrea≈øe of this Family.
div.p: ¬ß. VIII. IT ≈øuffer'd much in the la≈øt French War; for the King of France took from it the Earldom of Mompelgard, with all its Dependencies; in re≈øpect of which, it has a manife≈øt Pretence to it.

div.head: CHAP. XIV. Of the Family of the Marqui≈ø≈øes of Baden.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THat this Family had the ≈øame Original with that of: Au≈øtria, Hi≈øtorians ≈øcarce ≈øuffer us to doubt it. From the ancient Princes of Al≈øatia, ≈øprang the Family of Zeeringen, who bore Rule far and wide in Bri≈øgow; from that, Herman, Brother of Berthold II. Son of Berthold I. Duke of Zeeringen, had the Earldom of Hochbergen, and died 1074. His Son Herman married the Lady Judith, and with her, had the Marqui≈øate of Baden; but of what Family this Judith was, cannot be certainly affirmed: It ≈øuffices, that Henry Auceps (or the Falconer) brought it to be a Marqui≈øate, and that the afore≈øaid Herman was the fir≈øt of his Family that was Marqui≈øs of Baden, and died 1130. His Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Herman II. who died 1660. and left Herman III. whom the Emperour Frederick I. made Marqui≈øs of Verona, and was the Father of Herman IV. and Henry, the Enlarger of the Line of Hochbergen, which went out, in Philip Marqui≈øs and Earl of Hochbergen, Sept. 7. 1503. This Herman IV. the Common Father of the Marqui≈ø≈øes of Baden, had to Wife Irmengard (or as others, Gerdruth) Daughter of Henry of Brun≈øwick, Count Palatine of the Rhine; by whom he had,
1. Herman V. who in Right of his Wife Gerdruth, Daughter of Henry of Au≈øtria, became Heir of Au≈øtria and Stiria. He left a Son and Heir Frederick, from whom yet Ottocar King of Bohemia unju≈øtly wre≈øted Au≈øtria; on which, he got off with Conradine Duke of Suabia into Sicily, where he lo≈øt his Head, 1269.
2. Rodolphus, who by rea≈øon of his Tallne≈øs, was ≈øurnam'd The Great: He died Nov. 19. 1288.

¬ß. II. Herman VI. elde≈øt Son of this Rodolph, was Father of Frederick II. who died June 22. 1333. and of Rodolph V. the Pre≈øerver of his Family. His Son was Frederick III. Father of Rodolph VI. al≈øo ≈øurnam'd The Great, who died 1372. and left his Son and Succe≈ø≈øor Bernhard I. Father of James I. a prudent Prince, and a Lover of Ju≈øtice: He died Octob. 12. 1453. and had by Catharine, Daughter of Charles Duke of Lorrain,
1. Margaret, married to Albert Elector of Brandenburg, 1446. died 1457.
2. Bernhard, who died an Infant, 1431.
3. Bernhard III. who was profe≈øs'd, and died 1459.
4. John, born Feb. 9. 1459. He became Archbi≈øhop of Triers, and died Feb. 9. 1503.
5. Charles, ≈øurnamed The Stout, of whom a little after.
6. George, Bi≈øhop of Metz; died 1484.
7. Mark, a Canon of Strasburg; died 1478.

Of the≈øe, Charles was the Succe≈ø≈øor of his Father: He had War with Frederick the Palatine, but un≈øucce≈øsfully; for he was taken Pri≈øoner, and came off on very hard Terms. He died 1475. and by Catharine, Daughter of Erne≈øtus of Au≈øtria (be≈øides three Daughters) left three Sons:
1. Christopher I. born Novemb. 13. 1453. of whom in the next Section.
2. Albert I. born 1456. kill'd with a Great≈øhot, at the Siege of The Dam in Flanders, July 23. 1486.
3. Frederick, born July 8. 1458. He was Bi≈øhop of Utrecht, and died Septemb. 24. 1517.

¬ß. III. This Chri≈øtopher I. was a wi≈øe and fortunate Prince, and died April 19. 1527. His Wife was Ottilia, Daughter of Philip, Earl of Catzenelbogen (in Germany) by whom he had,
1. James II. born June 6. 1471. elected Archbi≈øhop of Triers, 1505. died unfortunately at Cologne upon the Rhine, 1511.
2. Mary, Abbe≈øs of Lichtenthal; died 1519.
3. Bernhand IV. born 1474. of whom in the next Section of the Line of Baden of Baden.
4. Charles II. born May 21. but uncertain whether in 1475. or 1476. He was Canon of Triers and Strasburg; died 1510.
5. Chri≈øtopher II. born July 21. 1477. Canon of Strasburg, and died March 29. 1508.
6. Philip I. born 1478. His Wife was Elizabeth, Daughter of Philip the Palatine; by
whom he had one only Daughter that ≈øurviv'd him, viz. Maria Jacobea, born 1507. married to William IV. Duke of Bavaria; died Nov. 15. 1580.
7. Ottilia, born 1480. was Abbe≈øs of Pfortzheimen.
8. Rodolphus XII. Canon of Cologne and Strasburg; died Sept. 21 1533.
9. Erne≈øtus, born Octob. 7. 1482. the Founder and Enlarger of the now Line of Durlach (in Germany) of whom in the Line of Durlach.
10. Wolfgangus, born 1484, died 1522.
11. Sybilla, born 1485. married to Philip III. Earl of Hanouer, 1503. died 1527.
12. Ro≈øina, born March 5. 1487. married to Wolfgangus, Count Hohen-Zollern; and after his death, to John of Aven; died 1554.
13. John, born and died 1554.
14. Beatrice, born June 22. 1492. married to John III. Palatine of Simeren; died April 15. 1535.
15. George, born 1493. died 1494.

div.head: Of the Line of Baden of Baden.
div.p:
¬ß. IV. ANd here we go back to the before-mentioned Bernhard IV. the Father of the now Line of Baden of Baden. He took up the Doctrine of Luther, planted it throughout his Dominions, and died June 29. 1566. His Wife was Frances of Lutzelberg, by whom he had,
1. Philibert, born Jan. 22. 1536. ≈ølain in Battel at Momonturne, Octob. 3. 1565. and left his Son and Succe≈ø≈øor Philip II. born Feb. 19. 1559. but died without I≈ø≈øue, June 17. 1588.
2. Chri≈øtopher III. he dwelt in the Ca≈øtle of Rodemachem, and died 1575. His Wife was Caecilia, Daughter of Gu≈øtavus King of Sweden, who brought him,
1. Edward, ≈øurnamed The Fortunate, born Septemb. 16. 1565. of whom hereafter.
2. Gu≈øtavus Chri≈øtopherus, born Aug. 13. 1566. died 1609.
3. Philip III. born 1567. died 1620.
4. Charles IV. born March 7. 1569. died in the City of Genoua, 1590.
5 Bernhard, born 1570. died 1571.
6. John Charles, born 1572. a Knight of the Order of St. John of Jeru≈øalem, before that time transferr'd to Malta; died in the Low-Country Wars, 1599.

Of the≈øe Edward the Fortunate, born in England, his Cou≈øin-Germain, Philip the Second, being dead, came to the Government. He embrac'd the Catholick Religion; and being pre≈øs'd with Debt went into the Low-Countries, where he ≈øerv'd under Albert, Arch-Duke of Au≈øtria. He was married at Bruxels, to Mary, the Daughter of Jodochus of Eicken, free Baron of Riviere, and was Slain at his Secretaries Wedding, June 18. 1600. and left Three Sons,
1. William, born 1593. of whom in the next Section.
2. Albert Charles, kill'd with a Shot, 1626.
3. Herman, ≈øurnamed The Fortunate, born 1596. He liv'd in the Ca≈øtle of Rademachem, where al≈øo he dy'd, 1664. nor left he any Po≈øterity behind him.

¬ß. V. We go back therefore to William the Fir≈øt, Elde≈øt Son of Edward the Fortunate, who had much to do e're he obtain'd the Marqui≈øate, for Erne≈øtus Frederick. of the Hou≈øe of Durlach, a next Kin≈øman by the Father's ≈øide, would not acknowledge the ≈øaid William and his Brothers as Legitimate; for that they were born of the afore≈øaid Mary of Eicken, and therefore having gotten fir≈øt Po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Marqui≈øate, ≈øo held it, till the Emperor Ferdinand the Second declar'd in favour of the Children of the ≈øaid Edward, and gave Sentence that they ≈øhould be re≈øtor'd to the E≈øtate of their Ance≈øtors: On which William was made Prince Regent, 1622. And, in 1640. the Emperor's chief Delegate in the Diet of Ratisbonne; after that, Pre≈øident of the Imperial Chamber
at Spires; and dy'd May 22. 1677. in the Eighty Fourth Year of his Age. His fir≈øt Wife w ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢
Catharine Ur≈øula, of the Hou≈øe of Zollera
‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ ; after who≈øe death he married Mary Magd ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ s, of the Hou≈øe of Oetingen; and had, by both of them, Nineteen Children, of whom Ten dy'd Young: The re≈øt were,

1. Ferdinand Maximilian, born Sepember 23. 1625. a ≈øingular Prince, but kill'd, by the bur≈øting of a Gun, as he was Hunting, October 8. 1669. He married Loui≈øa Chri≈øtiana of Savoy, Daughter of Thomas, Prince of Carignan, 1653. now a Widow, and had by her one only Son,

Lewis William, born Apr. 8. 1655. the now Marque≈øs of Baden; who, after the death of his Father, was brought up by his Grand-father, who≈øe Succe≈ø≈øor al≈øo he was, till being di≈øturb'd by the French, and de≈øpoil'd of mo≈øt of his Territories, he betook him≈øelf to the Emperor, by whom he was honourably receiv'd; and after ≈øeveral great Actions by him perform'd, made Mare≈øchal de Camp again≈øt the Turks. A Prince to be reckon'd among the chief of his Time.

2. Leopold William, born Sept. 16. 1626. He was Captain of the Emperor's Yeomen of the Guard, and in the Turki≈øh War headed a ≈øelect part of the Army, and having given ≈øeveral proofs of his Valour, dy'd 1671. leaving one Son,
Leopold William the Second, born Jan. 20. 1667. He has an Imperfection in his Speech; and now lives in the Ca≈øtle of Labo≈øchitz in Bohemia.

list.item: 3 Philip Sigi≈ømund, born Aug. 15. 1627. he was a Knight of Malta, and Slain in the Battel of Orbitel, 1647.
4. William Chri≈øtopher, born Oct. 11. 1628. a Canon of Cologne and Strasburg; and and dy'd unfortunately, 1652.
5. Herman (his Twin-Brother) who, after many extraordinary Actions by him perform'd, is now the Emperor's Delegate in the Diet at Ratisbonne.
6. Bernhard the Sixth, born 1629. dy'd at Rome, 1649.
7. Catharina Franci≈øca, born 1631. a Nun in the Cloy≈øter of Be≈øan≈øon in Burgundy.
8. Maria Anna Wilhelmina, born 1655. married to Ferdinand Augu≈øtus of Lobkowitz, Duke of Sagan, 1680.
9. Carolus Bervhardus, born Jan. 14. 1667. He ≈øerv'd the Emperor in the la≈øt War again≈øt France, and was Slain at the Battel of Reinfelden, July 5. 1678. but his Body not found.

div.head: Of the Line of Durlach.
div.p:
¬ß. VI. THe Founder of this Line was E ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ e≈øtus, of whom before in the third Section, Numb. 9. among the Sons of Chri≈øtopher the Fir≈øt. He had the Lower Marqui≈øate, with that other of Rotelen, by the di≈øpo≈øition of his Father; liv'd at Durlach, was a Lutheran,
and in great reque≈øt for his Prudence, with the Emperor Maximilian the Fir≈øt. He dy'd Feb. 6. 1553. and, be≈øides Seven Daughters, left Three Sons,
1. Bernhard the Fifth, born 1517. dy'd the ≈øame Year with his Father.
2. Charles the Third, born July 24. 1529.
3. Albert the Second, a Valiant Warrior, but dy'd without Children, 1642.

Of the≈øe, Charles the Third, ≈øucceeded his Father, and dy'd March 23. 1577. His fir≈øt Wife was Cunigund, Daughter of Ca≈øimire, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, who dying 1558. He married Anne, Daughter of Rupert, Palatine of Veldentz, who dy'd March 30. 1586. and left him,
1. Dorothy Ur≈øula, born 1559. married to Lewis the Fifth of Wirtenburg, and dy'd 1583.
2. Erne≈øt Frederick, his Succe≈ø≈øor, born 1560. who, as has been ≈øaid, Section 5. had a Di≈øpute with his Kin≈ømen, the Sons of Edward the Fortunate, touching the Upper Marqui≈øate, or Baden of Baden; He was a ≈ømart Defender of Lutherani≈øm: Founded a famous School at Durlach, and dy'd April 14. 1604. but left no I≈ø≈øue, tho' married to Anne, Daughter of Etzhard, Earl of O≈øtfri≈øe, Son of Frederick the Fourth, Elector Palatine.
3. James the Third, born May 26. 1562. dy'd Aug. 15. 1590. And, by Elizabeth, Daughter of Florence, Earl of Cullenburg, left Anne, born 1587. who was married to Wolrad, of Waldeck, and brought him
the Earldom of Cullenburg, and dy'd 1648. And one Po≈øthumous Son, James Erne≈øtus, who liv'd not long.
4. George Frederick, born Jan. 10. 1573.

¬ß. VII. This George ≈øucceeded his Brothers, and ≈øuffer'd much by means of the Palatine, Frederick the Fifth, who≈øe Party he adher'd to. He dy'd at Geneva, Sept 14. 1638. and had to Wife Juliana Ur≈øula of Raugrave, who dy'd 1614. and after that Agatha of the Hou≈øe of Erpace, by whom he had Seventeen Children, of which Eleven dy'd untimely. The re≈øt were,
1. Catharine Ur≈øula, born Jan. 19. 1593. married to Otto of He≈ø≈øe-Ca≈ø≈øel, 1613. dy'd Dec. 21. 1616.
2. Frederick the Second, of whom pre≈øently.
3. Anna Amalia, born 1595. marry'd to William of Na≈ø≈øau, in Saarbrucken 1615. dy'd 1652.
4. Charles the Fifth, born 1598. dy'd in his Travel through France, July 27. 1625.
5. Chri≈øtopher the Fourth, born March 16. 1603. Slain at the Siege of Ingol≈øtadt, Apr. 30. 1632.
6. Sibilla Magdalena, born July 21. 1605. married June 7. 1629. to John of Na≈ø≈øau, in Saarbrucken.

Frederick the Second, born July 6. 1594. ≈øucceeded his Father. He was a Prince of a general Learning, took part with the King of Sweden, which occa≈øion'd him divers Troubles, which he in a manner got out of by the Treaty of O≈øenburg, dy'd Sept. 8. 1659. and
had by Five Wives Eleven Children, Six of which dy'd Infants. The re≈øt were,
1. Frederick the Third, born Nov. 6. 1617. of whom in the next Section.
2. Sibilla, born Feb. 5. 1620. dy'd unmarried, Aug. 20. 1679.
3. Charles Magnus, born March 17. 1621. he did the King of Sweden good Services and by that means came to be Lieutenant General of his Army: dy'd Nov. 19. 1658. and left one Son, Charles Frederick, born 1651. He was a Knight of Malta, and dy'd without I≈ø≈øue, 1677.
4. Johanna, born 1623. married to John Barnim, Camp-Mar≈øhal of Sweden; and after his Death to Henry, Count of Thun, 1648. and has been dead ≈øome Years.
5. Gu≈øtavus Adolphus, Abbot of Fulda (in Germany) and Cardinal: He dy'd D ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ . 24. 1677.

¬ß. VIII. Frederick the Third ≈øucceeded his Father: He was a Prince, ≈øo great a Ma≈øter of all the Arts of Peace and War, that he w ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ General to the Emperor in the la≈øt War again≈øt the French, and di≈øcharg'd it with Honour, but having recover'd Philipsburg to the Empire dy'd 1677. in the Sixty Sixth Year of his Age, His Wife was Chri≈øtiana Magdalena, Daughter of John Ca≈øimier, Palatine of Bipont, whom he married at Stockboim, 1642. and had by her,
1. Frederick Ca≈øimier, born 1643. dy'd 1644.
2. Chri≈øtiana, born 1645. married 1665. to Albert, Marque≈øs of Brandenburg An≈øbach,
and after his death to John Frederick, Duke of Saxon-Gotham, 1681.
3. Eleanora Catharina, born and dy'd 1646.
4. Fredericus Magnus, born Sept. 27. 1646. the now Reigning Prince. He married Augu≈øta Maria, Daughter of Frederick, Duke of Sle≈øwick, May 15. 1670. by whom he had Ten Children, of which Four dy'd Infants: The re≈øt now living are,
1. Catharine, born Oct. 10. 1676.
2. Carolus Wilhelmus, born Jan. 17. 1679.
3. Johanna Elizabetha, born Oct. 3. 1680.
4. Alberta Frederica, born July 3. 1682.
5. Chri≈øtopher, born Sept. 28. 1684.
6. Charlotte Sophia, born March 1. 1686.
5. Carolus Gu≈øtavus, born Sept. 27. 1648. a Warlike Prince, and had to Wife Anna Sophia, Daughter of Anthony Ulrick, Duke of Brun≈øwick and Lunenburg, married to him 1677. who brought him,
1. Chri≈øtiana Juliana, born Sept. 12. 1678.
2. Charles, born and dy'd 1680.
3. Frederick Rodolph, born 1681. dy'd 1682.
4. Charles Anthony, born Jan. 29. 1683.
6. Catharina Barbara, born 1650. yet unmarried.
7 Johanna Elizabetha, born 1651. married to John Frederick, Marque≈øs of Brandendurg Ansbach; dy'd Sept. 8. 1680.
8. Eleanora Frederica, born and dy'd 1658.

But the afore≈øaid Frederick's Wife dying, he had Two natural Sons by a Private Gentlewoman, her Father tho' a Colonel of Hor≈øe,
to wit, Frederick and Bernhard, call'd the Barons of Muntzenheim, which Fief being po≈ø≈øe≈øt by the Baron Hoffart and E≈øcheated to him, he conferr'd on them.

div.head: Of the Augmentations of this Family.
div.p: ¬ß. IX. HOw this Family got the Marqui≈øate of Baden, we have already ≈øhown: After that Herman the Fourth had Durlach, Heilde≈øheim, and Etlingen, with his Wife the Daughter of Henry, Count Palatine of Guelffe. In the Year 1246. Herman the Fifth obtained the Dutchy of Au≈øtria and Stiria, in right of his Wife. In 1415. the County of Hochberg was further added. A great part of Sponheim, in 1437. and at the ≈øame time Mahlberg, and Lobra in Ortenaw. In 1444. Chri≈øtopher hook'd in Baden-Weiler and Wel≈øchberg; and after that Rodemachern, Her≈øpringen, and Ufeldingen: And upon the death of his Kin≈øman Philip, the Landtgraviate of San≈øenberg, and the Seigniory of Rotelen, fell in to the re≈øt: And la≈øtly, the Family of the Earls of Eber≈øtein being extinct, the greate≈øt part of that County was added to that Family.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øings.
div.p: ¬ß. X. THis Family ≈øuffer'd a lo≈øs about the middle of the Thirteenth Century, at what time Ottocar, King of Bohemia, took Au≈øtria and Stiria from Frederick the rightful Heir: But in the La≈øt, and this pre≈øent French War, both the Lines of this Family have ≈øuffer'd, and do yet ≈øuffer: And moreover, has a pretence to the Principality of Geroltzeck.

div.head: CHAP. XV. Of the Family of Anhalt and Saxon-Lawenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THo' this Family be for Antiquity pa≈øt all Memory, yet it was known in the Year 524. by the Name of the Counts of A≈øcania and Ballen≈øtedt: After which, Albert the Sixth, of that Hou≈øe, was, by the Emperor Henry the Second, created Marque≈øs of Soltquel, and died 1005. But, when under Conrade the Third, the Family of the Ancient Marque≈ø≈øes of Brandenburg, de≈øcended from the Counts of Staden and Ringelheim, began to wear out, Albert Ur≈øus, Marque≈øs of Soltquel, Ballen≈øtedt, and Wolpe, was made Marque≈øs of Brandenburg, 1142. and dy'd Nov. 18. 1169. He had Two Wives; fir≈øt Sophia, Daughter of Otto, Earl of Reneck. Secondly, Helica, Daughter of Conrade, ≈øurnamed The Pious, Marque≈øs of Mi≈ønia. He had by his fir≈øt Wife,
1. Otto, Marque≈øs and Elector of Brandenburg, who≈øe Po≈øterity went out in Woldemar, II. 1322.
2. Bernhard, who, upon the Pro≈øcription of Henry Leon, had the Dutchy by the Gift of Frederick Barbaro≈ø≈øa, and dy'd 1212. leaving,
1. Albert the Fir≈øt, Duke and Elector of Saxony, who dy'd 1260. and left,
1. Albert the Second, Duke and Elector of Saxony, who≈øe Po≈øterity fail'd in Albert the Sixth, 1422.
2. John the Fir≈øt, who was the Founder of a new Line, to wit, Lawenburg, in who≈øe Male I≈ø≈øue it la≈øted till the Year 1688. at what time Julius Franci≈øcus, born 1640. the la≈øt of that Line dy'd, leaving only Two Daughters,
1. Anna Maria Franci≈øca, born June 13. 1672.
2. Franci≈øca Sibilla Augu≈øta, born June 21. 1675.
2. Henry the Elder, who, by the Emperor Frederick Barbaro≈ø≈øa, was made the fir≈øt Prince of Anhalt.

¬ß. II. This Henry therefore we reckon the common Father of the now Family of Anhalt. He dy'd 1257. and from whom we may go in a right Line to Joachim Erne≈øtus, born 1536. His Father was John the Fourth, his Mother Margaret, Daughter of Joachim the Fir≈øt, Elector of Brandenburg, Widow of George Duke of Pomeran; and after the death of his Brothers, ≈øole Governour of the Provinces of Anhalt: His Re≈øidence was in the Ca≈øtle of De≈ø≈øaw (in Germany) and dy'd Dec. 6. 1586. having had to Wife, Agnes, Daughter of Wolfgang, Earl of Barbye, who dy'd 1569. and after her, Eleanora, Daughter of Chri≈øtopher, Duke of Wirtenburg, and by both of them had Sixteen Children,
1. Anna Maria, born 1562. married to Joachim Frederick, Duke of Lignitz, dy'd 1604.
2. Agnes, born 1562. dy'd 1564.
3. Elizabeth, born 1563. married to John George, Elector of Brandenburg, 1577. dy'd 1607.
4. Sibilla, born Sept. 28. 1564. married to Frederick, Duke of Wirtenburg, 1581. dy'd 1614.
5. John George the Fir≈øt, born March 9. 1567. of whom in the following Line of De≈ø≈øaw.
6. Chri≈øtian the Fir≈øt, born 1568. of whom Section 4. in the Line of Bernburg.
7. Bernhard the Eighth, born 1570. or as others, Sept. 25. 1572. Slain, as its ≈øaid, in a Battle at Erlaw in Hungary, Sept. 25. 1596.
8. Agne≈øa Hedewig, born March 12. 1573. married to Augu≈øtus, Elector of Saxony, 1586. who dying 1588. ≈øhe married John, Duke of Hol≈øtein, of the Line of Sunderburg, and dy'd Nov. 3. 1616.
9. Dorothea Maria, born July 2. 1574. married to John the Second, Duke of Saxon-Vinar. 1593. dy'd July 18. 1617.
10. Augu≈øtus, born July 14. 1575. of whom more in the fifth Section.
11. Rodolphus the Fifth, born Oct. 28. 1576. the Founder of the Serve≈øtan Line, of whom Section 6.
12. John Erne≈øtus, born May 1. 1578. He gave ≈øeveral In≈øtances of his Courage, but more e≈øpecially in the taking Alba
Regalis, in Hungary, by Storm, 1601. dy'd Dec. 12. 1602.
13. Lodovick the Fir≈øt, born June 17. 1579. He was the beginner of the Line of Coctan, now extinct; and dwelt in the Ca≈øtle and City of Coctan, where he was the Founder of that fruitful Society of Jruchtbringenden Ge≈øel≈øchafft, dy'd Jan. 7. 1650. His fir≈øt Wife was Amaena Amalia, of the Hou≈øe of Benthem (in We≈øtphalia) who dying 1625. he married Sophia, of the Hou≈øe of Lippien, the Year following, who dy'd 1650. by both which he had
1. Lodovick the Fir≈øt, born 1607. dy'd 1624.
2. Loui≈øa Amalia, born 1609. dy'd 1625.
3. Loui≈øa, born 1634. dy'd 1635.
4. Wilhelmus Lodovicus, born Aug. 3. 1638. who ≈øucceeded his Father, and took to Wife Elizabetha Charlotta, a Niece of the Hou≈øe of Hatzgerod, 1663. but dy'd without I≈ø≈øue, Apr. 13. 1665.
14. Sabina, born 1580. dy'd unmarried.
15. Joachim Chri≈øtopher, born 1582. dy'd 1583.
16. Anna Sophia, born 1584. ≈øhe was the Wife of Gunther Albertus of Swartzburg, dy'd 1657.

div.head: Of the Line of De≈ø≈øaw.
div.p:
¬ß. III. MAtters thus brought together, we go back to John George the Fir≈øt, Elde≈øt Son of Joachim Erne≈øtus, the Founder of this Line, who, in the divi≈øion of the E≈øtate, had to his ≈øhare, Ge≈ønitz, Schander≈øleben, Worbtzig, and Radega≈øt. He profe≈øt the Reform'd Religion, and dy'd May 13. 1618. His fir≈øt Wi≈øe was Dorothy, the Daugher of Albert, Count Mansfeldt, who dy'd 1594. His ≈øecond, Dorothy, Daughter of John Ca≈øimier, Palatinate of Simmeren (in the Lower Palatinate) who was married to him 1595. and dy'd 1618. He had, by his fir≈øt Wife Five Children; and, by his latter, Eleven, as they here follow,
1. Sophia Elizabetha, born Feb. 10. 1589. married to George Rodolphus, Duke of Lignitz, dy'd 1622.
2. Agnes Magdalena, born March 29. 1590. married to Otto, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, 1617. dy'd 1626.
3. Anna Maria, born 1591. dy'd unmarried, 1637.
4. Joachim Erne≈øtus the Second, born July 16. 1592. dy'd May 28. 1615.
5. Chri≈øtianus, born 1593. dy'd 1594.
6. John Ca≈ø≈ømier, of whom a little after.
7. Anna Elizabetha, born 1599. married to William, Earl of Bentheim.
8. Frederick Mauritius, born 1600. dy'd 1610.
9. Eleanora Dorothea, born Feb. 6. 1602. married to William the Second, Duke of
Saxon-Wimar, 1625. dy'd 1664.
10. Sibilla Chri≈øtiana, born Jan. 10. 1603. fir≈øt married to Philip Mauritius; and after his death to Frederick Ca≈øimier, Earl of Hanouer.
11. Georgius Albertus, born June 3. 1606. dy'd Nov. 14 1643. leaving by Johanna Elizabetha, of the Hou≈øe of Kro≈øegg,
1. Chri≈øtianus Albertus, Count Beringen, Lord in Walder≈øee and Radega≈øt, dy'd 1677.
2. Sophia, now living with her Mother in the Ca≈øtle of Radega≈øt.
3. Eleanora, married to John George of Solms, dy'd 1677.
12. Cunigunda Juliana, born 1608. married to Herman, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe-Ca≈ø≈øel, dy'd 1656.
13. Henricus Woldemarus, born and dy'd 1609.
14. Su≈øanna Margareta, born 1610. Wife to John Philip of Hanouer, dy'd 1663.
15. Johanna Dorothea, born 1612. married to Mauritius of Bentheim.
16. Eva Catharina, born 1613. dy'd unmarried, Dec. 15. 1679.

Of the≈øe, the before-mentioned John Ca≈øimier ≈øucceeded his Father, and dy'd Sept. 15. 1660. His fir≈øt Wife was Agnes, the Daughter of Mauritius of He≈ø≈øe, married to him, 1623. who dying May 28. 1650. His ≈øecond was Sophia Margareta, a Fir≈øt Cou≈øin of the Hou≈øe of Bernburg, who dy'd Dec. 28. 1673. He had by his fir≈øt Wife, be≈øides Loui≈øa, born 1631. married 1648. and dying April 25. 1680.

John George the Second, born Nov. 7. 1627. who, after the death of his Father, took upon him the Government, and now ≈øupplies the place of Deputy to the Elector of Brandenburg. He married Henrica Catharina, Daughter of Henry Frederick, Prince of Orange, by Amalia of Solms, 1658. and had by her,
1. Emilia Loui≈øa, born 1660. dy'd an Infant.
2. Henrica Amalia, born 1662. dy'd an Infant.
3. Frederick Ca≈øimier, born 1663. dy'd 1665.
4. Elizabetha Albertina, born 1665. made Abbe≈øs of Hervorden (in We≈øtphalia) 1680.
5. Amalia, born 1666. married to Henry Ca≈øimier, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, Hereditary Governour of We≈øt-Frie≈øland, 1684.
6. Loui≈øa Sophia, born 1667. dy'd 1668.
7. Maria Eleanora, born 1671. married to George, Prince of Ratzevil in Lithuania, now a Widow.
8. Henrica Agnes, born Jan. 9. 1674. married to Henry, Duke of Saxony, 1689.
9. Leopoldus, Hereditary Prince; born July 3. 1676.
10. Johanna Charlotta, born Apr. 6. 1682.

div.head: Of the Line of Bernburg.
div.p:
¬ß. IV. CHri≈øtian, ≈øecond Son of Joachim Erne≈øtus, was the Beginner of this Line: To his ≈øhare in the Divi≈øion of the E≈øtate, fell the Lord≈øhip of Bernburg, the County of Ballen≈øtedt, the Pre≈øidency of Hatzgerod, with the Covent of Gernrod; a Prince either for Field or Coun≈øel. He died April 20. 1630. and left fourteen Children, by Anne Counte≈øs of Bentheim, of which four died young; and Sybilla Elizabetha, Agne≈øa Magdalena, Amalia Sophia, Loui≈øa Amalia, Dorothea Bathild, died unmarried: The re≈øt were,
1. Chri≈øtianus II. of whom by and by.
2. Eleanora Maria, born Aug. 7. 1600. married to Albertus II. Prince of Meckleburg and Gu≈øtrow (in Germany) died 1657.
3. Erne≈øtus II. born May 19. 1608. ≈ølain at the Battel of Lutzen, 1632.
4. Frederick, born Novemb. 16. 1613. The Branch of Hatzgerod ≈øprang from him: He died June 30. 1670. His fir≈øt Wife was Johanna Elizabetha, of the Hou≈øe of Na≈ø≈øau, who died March 2. 1647. his ≈øecond, Maria Elizabetha, of the Hou≈øe of Lippa. By the fir≈øt of which he had,
1. William II. born Aug. 18. 1643. he ≈øucceeded his Father in Hatzgerod, and married Julia Elizabetha Albertina, Counte≈øs of Selms, of the Line of Laubach, with whom he lives as yet Childle≈øs.
2. Anna Ur≈øula, born 1645. died 1647.
3. Elizabetha Charlotta, born Feb. 11. 1647. married 1663. to William Lodovick, a Cadet of the Line of Coten; and after his death, to Augu≈øtus II. Duke of H ‚Ä¢ l≈ø. Plonen.
5. Sophia Margareta, born Sept. 16. 1615. married to John Ca≈øimier, a Cadet of the Hou≈øe of De≈ø≈øaw: died Decemb. 28. 1673.

Of the≈øe, Chri≈øtian II. ≈øucceeded his Father, and made his Re≈øidence at Bernburg, where he died, 1565. He married Eleanora Sophia, Daughter of John Duke of Hol≈øat. Sundurburg, 1625. by whom he had a great many Children, of whom yet the here named only came to maturity, viz.
1. Victor Amadaeus, born Octob. 6. 1634. He ≈øucceeded his Father, and married Elizabetha, Daughter of Frederick, Palatine of Bipont, who died April 17. 1677. having brought him

Five Children:
1. Carolus Frederick, born July 13. 1668.
2. Lebrecht, born June 28. 1669.
3. Sophta Juliana, born Octob. 26. 1672. died Aug. 21. 1674.
4. Johannes Georgius, born Feb. 14. 1674.
5. Chri≈øtianus, born and died 1675.

list.item: 2. Eleanora Hedewig, born Octob. 28. 1635. not yet married.
3. Angelica, born June 6. 1639. unmarried.
4. Anna Sophia, born Septemb. 13. 1640. married to George Frederick, Count Solms, 1664.
5. Carolus Ur≈øinus, born 1643. died at Parma in Italy, Jan. 4. 1660.
6. Anna Elizabetha, born March 19. 1647. married to Chri≈øtian Ulrick, Duke of Wittenberg, of the Line of Sile≈øia, 1672. died Sept. 3. 1680.

div.head: Of the Line of Plotzkow, now Caethane.
div.p: ¬ß. V. AUgu≈øtus, third Son of Joachim Erne≈øtus, had his Seat in the Ca≈øtle of Pletzkow, a Prince worthy of all Prai≈øe, dying, ≈øpent with Years, Aug. 22. 1653. and 78th. of his Age. He married Sybilla, Counte≈øs of Solms, 1618. who died a Widow, March 23. 1659. by whom he had

Eight Children:
1. Johanna, born Nov, 24. 1618. a Deacone≈øs of Quidlenburg, in Saxony.
2 Erne≈øtus Gottlieb, born Sept. 4. 1620. died 1654.
3. Lebrecht, born April. 5. 1622. He reviv'd the extinct Line of Caethane; died I≈ø≈øuele≈øs, Sept 7. 1669.
4. Dorothea, born 1623. died 1637.
5. Ehernprei≈øz, born 1625. died 1626.
6. Sophia, born 1627. died Nov. 24. 1679.
7. Elizabeth, born March 31. 1630.
8. Emanuel, born Oct. 26. 1631. He return'd from the Defence of Candia; ≈øucceeded his Brother, and married Anna Eleanora, Counte≈øs of Stolburg, March 23. 1670. but died the ≈øame Year, leaving his Wife with Child of Emanuel Lebrecht, born May 20. 1671. the only ≈øurviving Branch of the Line of Caethane.

div.head: Of the Line of Serve≈øtan.
div.p:
¬ß. VI. THe fir≈øt of this Line was Rodolphus V. fourth Son of Joachim Erne≈øtus, who in the Divi≈øion with the City of Serve≈øtan, had the Lord≈øhips of Lindaw, Co≈øwigt, and Ro≈ølaw. He died 1622. His Wives were, 1. Dorothea Hedewig, Daughter of Herry Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, who died 1608. 2. Magdalena, Daughter of John, Count Oldenburg, who died 1657. By both which, he had,
1. Dorothea, born Sept. 25. 1607. married to Augu≈øtus Duke of Brun≈øwick, Octob. 26. 1623. died Sept. 26. 1634.
2. Eleanora, born 1608. married to Frederick Duke of Hol≈øtein, of the Line of Nordburg, 1632. died 1681.
3. Elizabeth, born 1617. died 1639.
4. John V. born March 24. 1621. As al≈øo two other Daughters, who≈øe Names are unknown.

Of the≈øe, John ≈øucceeded his Father: He was brought up by his Uncle Anthony Gunther, Earl of Oldenburg; and died July 4. 1667. His Wife was Sophia Augu≈øta, Daughter of Frederick Duke of Sle≈øwick (in Denmark) whom he married, 1649. She died a Widow, 1681. and brought him Fourteen Children:
1. John Frederick, born 1650. died 1651.
2. George Rodolphus, born 1651. died 1652.
3. Charles William, born Octob. 26. 1652. He ≈øucceeded his Father, and is the now Prince of this Line. He married Sophia, Daughter of Augu≈øtus, formerly Pre≈øident
of Magdeburg, June 18. 1676. by whom he had,
1. John Augu≈øtus, born July 20. 1677.
2. Charles Frederick, born July 8. 1678.
3. Magdalen Augu≈øta, born Oct. 20. 1679.
4. Anthony Gunther, born Nov. 11. 1653.
5. John Adolphus, born Dec. 2. 1654.
6. John Lodowick, born May 4. 1656.
7. Joachim Erne≈øtus, born 1657. died 1658.
8. magdalena Sybilla, born 1658. died 1659.
9. Frederica, born and died, 1660.
10. Hedewig Maria Eleanora, born and died 1662.
11. Sophia Augu≈øta, born March 9. 1663.
12. Albertus, born and died 1665.
13. Augu≈øtus, born 1666. died 1667.
14. A Daughter without Name, 1668.

div.head: Of the Augmentations of This Family.
div.p: ¬ß. VII. WE have already noted how Albertus Ur≈øus was, in the Year 1152. made Marque≈øs of Brandenburg. In 1180. Bernhard obtained the Dutchy of Saxony, with the Electoral Dignity. In 1630. Julius Henricus of Saxon Lawenburg, got the Principality of Slackwerd in Bohemia, in right of his Wife: And about the Year 1650. John of Serve≈øtan had the Soveraignty of Jervan, by the Beque≈øt of Anthony Gunther, Count Oldenburg.

div.head: Of its Decrea≈øings.
div.p: ¬ß. VIII. IN 1315. the County of A≈øcania, with the City of A≈øcher≈øleben, came to the Bi≈øhop of Halber≈øtadt. In 1322. the Country and Electorate of Brandenburg fell from this Family. In 1418. it lo≈øt the Upper Saxony, with that Elector≈øhip. In 1640. William Duke of Brun≈øwick in Lunenburg, ≈øurnamed The Victorious, took from it the County of Wolpe, which yet remains in the Family. In the next French War, the King of France outed the Line of Serve≈øtan of the Soveraignty of Jervan, and gave it up to the King of Denmark; which yet by an amicable Compo≈øition, was re≈øtor'd again, in Augu≈øt 1689. Yet the Family of Anhalt makes Preten≈øion to the Dutchy of Lower Saxony, vulgarly call'd Sach≈øen, or Saxon-Lawenburg, by the death of Julius Franci≈øcus, in 1689. the la≈øt Duke of Lower Saxony, and of that Lineage.

div.head: CHAP. XVI. Of the Family of Na≈ø≈øau, and Orange.
div.p:
¬ß. I. OF this Family, there are ≈øome things to be enlarg'd on, in regard the now King of England, William Henry, is de≈øcended from it. But not to perplex our ≈øelves too much in ≈øearching out its Original, which, certain it is, flouri≈øh'd in the IX. Century, it ≈øufficeth at pre≈øent if we take notice, That from Walram and Otto, Sons of Henry ≈øurnamed The Rich, Earl of Na≈ø≈øau, ≈øprang two Capital Lines, viz. that of Id≈øtein, afterwards call'd Saraepont from Walram, and that of Dillenburg, which now enjoys the Principality, from Otto; and therefore we ≈øhall confine our ≈øelves ≈øingly to that. This Otto, in the Divi≈øion of the Patrimony, had to his ≈øhare the Counties of Dillenburg and Biel≈øtien, and left one Son, Henry, Father of Otto II. who married Adelheid, Daughter of Godfrey Earl of Viand; by whom he had John, Father of Engelbert; and Adolphus, who died without I≈ø≈øue: But Engelbert married very advantageou≈øly with Joan of Poland, Daughter and Heir of Philip, Baron of Leck and Breda, who brought him John II. born Aug. 1. 1410. who by his Wife Mary, Counte≈øs of Lohen and Hein≈øburg, had Engelbert II. who died without I≈ø≈øue; and John III. who by Elizabeth, of the Hou≈øe of He≈ø≈øe, had two Sons, Henry, and William the
Elder, of whom and of his Po≈øterity we ≈øhall ≈øpeak, Sect. III.

¬ß. II. Henry, born Aune 12. 1483. His fir≈øt Wife, Frances, the Daughter of James Earl of ‚Äî being dead, he took Claudia, Daughter of John Cabillonius, Prince of Orange, 1515. who al≈øo dying 1521. he married Mencia Mendora, Daughter of Radericus, Marque≈øs of Genett, afterwards Duke of Calabria. He had I≈ø≈øue by Claudia only, to wit, Renatus, whom his Uncle Philibert, Prince of Orange, having no I≈ø≈øue of his own, adopted, and left him Heir of the Principality, 1530. Renatus al≈øo dying without Children, 1544. he bequeathed all to his Cou≈øin-German William; who being content with what he had in the Low-Countries, and Orange, gave up all beyond the Rhine to his Brother John; and was a Prince worthy of all Memory. His fir≈øt Son was Henry Philip William, who died without I≈ø≈øue 1618. by which means the Principality came to his Brother maurice, a well-experienc'd Prince, either for Peace or War. He died April 23. 1625. but unmarried; whereby, having no legitimate I≈ø≈øue, he was ≈øucceeded by his Brother Henry Frederick, third Son of William the Younger; whom after the death of the ≈øaid Maurice, the States of the United Provinces of the Low Countries, made Stadt-Holder, which he manag'd with a ≈øurpa≈ø≈øing Courage and Conduct: He died 1647. and by Amalia, Counte≈øs of Solms, who died in 1675. left

Four Daughters:
1. Loui≈øa, married Decemb. 7. 1646. to Frederick William, Elector of Brandenburg; died June 6. 1667.
2. Henrica Aemilia, born Oct. 26. 1628. married 1648. to William Frederick, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, and Hereditary Governour of Frie≈øland; now a Widow.
3. Henrica Catharina, born 1637. married 1658. to John George II. Prince of Anhalt.
4. Mary, born 1641. married to Lewis Herman Maurice Francis, Palatine of Simmeren; died in March, 1678. by whom he had two Sons, William, and Lewis who died an Infant: The former, a magnanimous Prince, how unfortunately ≈øoever he died, Nov. 6. 1650. He was married in the Fifteenth Year of his Age, to Mary, elde≈øt Daughter of Charles I. King of Great Britain, who died Decemb. 24. 1660. From which Marriage, but born after the death of his Father, came

William Henry, born Novemb. 4. 1650. He was re≈øtored to the Dignity of his Ance≈øtors, in the Stadt-Holder≈øhip of the United Provinces, 1672. and as born to greater, was elected and proclaimed King of England, Feb. 13. 1688. and thereupon Crown'd, April 10. following, and not long after declar'd King of Scotland. He married Mary, elde≈øt Daughter of James Duke of York, ≈øecond Son of Charles I. and after the death of his elder Brother Charles II,
King of England, with whom he now lives.

¬ß. III. We now now to John III. Son of William the Elder, and Brother of William Prince of Orange. He dwelt in the Ca≈øtle of Dillenburg, and had 25 Children, of which 4 only are chiefly to be remembred in this place; viz. John, George, Erne≈øtus Ca≈øimier, and John Lewis; for from them ≈øprang the ≈øeveral Lines of Siegen, Dillenburg, Diezen, and Hademar; on each of which, the Emperour Ferdinand III. in the Diet of Ratisbonne, March 3. 1654. conferr'd the Honour of having a Voice and Seat among the Princes of the Empire.

div.head: Of the Line of Siegen.
div.p:
¬ß. IV. THe Beginner of this Line, was John, ≈øurnamed Medius, Son of John III. who had 23 Children by two Wives; but we ≈øhall fir≈øt mention tho≈øe of the Second Marriage:
1. John Mauritius, ≈øurnamed Americanus; a Prince the mo≈øt remarkable of our time. He was Prior of the Order of St. John of Jeru≈øalem, ‚Äî Vicegerent of the Dutchy of Cleves, and the Principality of Mindane, &c. Died Decemb. 20. 1679. in the 75th. Year of his Age.
2. George Frederick; he commanded the Prince of Orange's Regiment of Hor≈øe-Guards; and died without I≈ø≈øue, 1674.
3. Henry, Governour of the City of Huy in Flanders; and died fir≈øt of his Brothers. He had to Wife Mary Elizabeth, Daughter of John Erne≈øtus, Earl of Limburg, who died 1653. and by her,
1. Frederick, who in the Leagure of Mae≈øtricht got the Bloody Flux, of which he died at Ruremond, in Septemb. 1676.
2. William Maurice: He was Colonel of a Regiment of Switz, and General for the States of the United Provinces in the Low Countries. He married Erne≈øta Charlotta, Daughter of Adolphus Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, of the Line of Dillenburg, Jan. 6. 1678. by whom he had one Son, born Feb. 20. 1680. who≈øe Name yet has not occurr'd to us.
3. Sophia Amalia, married to Frederick Ca≈øimier, Duke of Courland. She died Dec. 25. 1688.

By his fir≈øt Marriage he had two Sons; John the Younger; and William, born of Magdalen, Counte≈øs of Waldeck. William was married to Chri≈øtian, Counte≈øs of Erpach; but left no Son by her, and died 1642. John went off to the Church of Rome; and by Erne≈øtina of Arenburg, and after his death, which was in 1638. left One Son and Two Daughters:
1. John Francis De≈øideratus, who ≈øerv'd the King of Spain, and was by him made Knight of the Golden Fleece; and in 1680. Governour of Gelderland in Lower Germany. He was twice married; Fir≈øt to Johanna Claudia, Counte≈øs of Conig≈øeck, who died 1664. next to Maria Eleanora
Sophia, Daughter of Herman Fortunatus, Marqui≈øs of Baden, who died 1668. From both which, the≈øe only, that I find, got up to years:
1. Mary Leopoldina, married to Maurice Henry, a Kin≈øman by the Father's ≈øide, of the Line of Hademar: She died June 27. 1675.
2. Erne≈øtina Eleanora.
3. Clara Chiliana.
4. Albertina Gabrielis.
2. Erne≈øtina, married to Maurice Henry, of the Line of Hademar: She died Aug. 15. 1668.
3. Clara Maria, fir≈øt married to Henry Erne≈øtus, Prince of Lignitz; and after that, to Claudius Lamorald, his Brother; now a Widow.

div.head: Of the Line of Dillenburg.
div.p:
¬ß. V. GEorge, as we have already ≈øaid Sect. III. was the Founder of this Family. His fir≈øt Wife was Anna Amalia, a Neice of the Hou≈øe of Sarsbruck, who brought him many Children; of whom though only Lewis Henricus propagated the Line. His Wives were three: 1. Catharine, Counte≈øs of Sain≈øem. 2. Elizabeth the Rhinegrave. 3. Sophia Magdalena, a Coulin-German of the Line of Hademar. By the fir≈øt and ≈øecond he had a numerous Progeny; and of the third, we ≈øhall only now reckon George Lewis, Adolphus, and Augu≈øtus, who though young, perform'd Actions beyond his Years, and died Jan. 7. 1681. George Lewis married Anna Augu≈øta, Daughter of Henry Julius, Duke of Brun≈øwick, and died May 19. 1656. of whom there are now living,
1. Henry, born Aug. 28. 1641. who married Dorothy Elizabeth, Daughter of George Duke of Lignitz in Sile≈øia; and ≈øaw living from her,
1. Sophia Augu≈øta, born April 18. 1666.
2. George Lewis, born June 21. 1667.
3. Albertina, born Aug. 8. 1668.
4. William, born Aug. 28. 1670.
5. Adolphus, born March 7. 1673.
6. Frederica Amalia, born in Decemb. 1674.
2. Sophia Eleanora, born May 2. 1640. unmarried.
3. Charlotta, born 1643. married 1665. to Augu≈øtus Earl of Lignitz; and he dying in 1680. to Ferdinand Gobert, Earl of A≈øpremont.
There remains Adolphus, Uncle to Henry, who was ≈øeated in Schaumburg; where, by Elizabeth Charlotta, Daughter of Peter Earl of Holtzapfel, he had

Three Daughters:
1. Erne≈øtina Charlotta, born 1662. married to William Maurice, a Kin≈øman of the Hou≈øe of Siegen.
2. Johanna Elizabetha, born 1663.
3. Charlotta, born 1672.

div.head: Of the Line of Diezen.
div.p:
¬ß. VI. THe fir≈øt of this Line was Erne≈øtus Ca≈øimier, who ≈øucceeded his Brother William Lodowick in the Government of Frie≈øland and Greeningen: He was Major-General to the Con≈øederate States of the ∆≤nited Provinces, and ≈ølain by a Shot at Ruremond (in Guelderland) June. 5.
1632. His Wife was Sophia Hedewig of Brun≈øwick, who died 1642. by whom he had,
1. Henry Ca≈øimier, Governour of Frie≈øland and Groeningen, who was ≈ølain at the Sconce of Na≈ø≈øau in Flanders, June 6. 1640.
2. William Frederick, who ≈øucceeded his Brother in his Commands, but unfortunately ≈ølain, Oct. 13. 1664. for blowing into a Pi≈øtol to try if it were charg'd, it went off, and ≈øo wounded him, that he died in three Days. His Widow, Henrica Aemilia of the Hou≈øe of Orange, is yet living, who brought him,
1. Henry Ca≈øimier, born Jan. 1657. He ≈øucceeded his Father in his Hereditary Dignities; and married Henrica Amalia, Daughter of John George II. Prince of Anhalt.
2. Sophia Wilhelmina, born 1664. and is yet unmarried.

div.head: Of the Line of Hademar.
div.p:
¬ß. VII. THis Line began in John Lodovick, who went off to the Church of Rome, and was by the Emperour Ferdinand II. made Chamberlain of the Empire. Ferdinand III. made him of his Privy-Council, and ≈øent him Amba≈ø≈øadour to the Treaty of We≈øtphalia. He was the fir≈øt of the≈øe Four Lines, on whom the Honour of having a Vote and Sear among the Princes, was conferr'd; and died March 6. 1653. His Wife was ∆≤r≈øula, Counte≈øs of Lippen; by whom he had Twelve Children, ≈øeven of which were but ≈øhort-liv'd: The re≈øt were,
1. Johanna Elizabetha, born 1619. married to Frederick Prince of Anhalt, of the Hou≈øe of Hatzgerod; died 1647.
2. Sophia Magdalena, born Feb. 6. 1622. married to Lewis Henry, a Cou≈øin-German of the Line of Dillenburg; died Feb. 6. 1659.
3. Maurice Henry, born 1626. the Succe≈ø≈øor of his Father. He married Erne≈øtina, Daughter of John the Younger, a Kin≈øman of the Line of Siegen, 1650. and after her death, in 1668. Maria Leopoldina, Daughter of John Francis De≈øideratus, of the ≈øame Line; who al≈øo dying, he married Anna Lodovica, Counte≈øs of Mander≈øcheid, and died Jan. 24, 1679. leaving by the ≈øaid Counte≈øs a large Progeny, of whom yet the≈øe are only living:
1. Francis Alexander, born Jan 27. 1674. and bred under the Tuition of his Mother-in-Law, and his Uncle.
2. Albertina Johannetta, born May 9. 1681.
4. Herman Otto, born 1627. He was Bi≈øhop of Cologne, &c. and died July 26. 1660.
5. Francis Bernhard, born Sept. 21, 1637. Dean of the Chapter of Cologne, as al≈øo of Strasburg.

div.head: CHAP. XVII. Of the Family of Lorrain.
div.p:
¬ß. I. WE have hitherto ≈øhewn, be≈øides the Regal, the Principal Families of the Princes of Germany; and come now to tho≈øe of other Countries, where, in the fir≈øt place, the Family of Lorrain comes in our way; which, that it had the ≈øame Original with tho≈øe of Au≈øtria, Wirtenburg, and Baden, Antiquity gives us not the lea≈øt rea≈øon to doubt. For Gerhard de≈øcended of the ancient Landtgraves of Al≈øatia, the old Family of Lorrain de≈øcended from Charlemaigne, being extinct, was created Duke of Lorrain by the Emperor Henry the Third, An. 1048. His Wife was Hadwid of Namur; by whom, him≈øelf dying, 1070. he left Two Sons, Theodorick and Gerhard, who was created Earl of Valdemont; but his Po≈øterity went out in Henry the Fourth Earl, and his Niece Margaret, who was married to Frederick of Lorrain, of whom we ≈øhall ≈øoon ≈øpeak again.
