But Theodorick ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy, from whom in a right Line are de≈øcended the Dukes of Lorrain, to Charles the Fir≈øt, ≈øurnamed The Bold, who dy'd 1430. and left no Son: His Brother Frederick before mentioned, married Margaret, Counte≈øs and Heir of Joinville and Valdemont, and brought back this County into his Family: He was Slain at the Battle of Agincourt,
Oct. 25. 1415. His Son was Anthony, Earl of Valdemont, who had ≈øharp Conte≈øts about the Succe≈ø≈øion to his Uncle, with Renatus Andine, King of Naples, who had married I≈øabel, the Daughter of Charles the Bold, which came to Blows: Andine was beaten and taken Pri≈øoner, 1431. and at la≈øt matters were ≈øo made up, That Andine ≈øhould give up his Right, and his Daughter Jolantha in Marriage to Frederick the Son of Anthony; by which means the ≈øaid Frederick came at length to be the Succe≈ø≈øor of Charles the Bold: He dy'd 1470.

¬ß. II. The Son of Frederick was Renatus, to whom no Duke of Lorrain was ever equal for Power, and largene≈øs of Territory: He had hot Wars with Charles, ≈øurnamed The Stout, Duke of Burgundy: Made his la≈øt Will 1506. by which he made his Sons Anthony and Claudius his Heirs, as having de≈øign'd his other Sons to the Church, and dy'd Dec. 8. 1508. By this di≈øpo≈øition Claudius had the County of Aumale, the Baronies of Gui≈øe and Joinville, the Lord≈øhips of Elbeuf, Maine, &c. but his Po≈øterity fail'd in Francis Jo≈øeph, the only Son of Lewis Jo≈øeph, Duke of Gui≈øe, Joyeu≈øe, and Augoule≈øine, who dy'd 1675. There yet remain'd Mary, the Si≈øter of Lewis the Grandfather, Dutche≈øs of Gui≈øe and Joyeu≈øe, Prince≈øs of Joinville, but ≈øhe dy'd 1687.

Anthony the Elder Brother, born June 4. 1489. had the Dutchy of Lorrain and Barry; and dy'd June 15. 1544. leaving I≈ø≈øue by Renata of Bourbon, Daughter of Gilbert, Earl of Montpen≈øier; Francis, Duke of Lorrain and
Bar; a Prince adorned with all the Beauties of Mind and Body, but taken off by an Apoplexy in the Flower of his Youth. His only Son was Charles the Second, Duke of Lorrain and Bar, born Feb. 18. 1543. married Claudia, Daughter of Henry the Second, King of France, and died Dec. 10. 1608. His I≈ø≈øue were,
1. Henry, Duke of Lorrain and Bar, born Nov. 8. 1563. who ≈øucceeded his Father, and took to Wife Catharine, Daughter of Anthony, King of Navarre, An. 1599. But ≈øhe dying in 1604. he Two Years after married Margaret Gonzaga, Daughter of Vincent, Duke of Mantua: By the la≈øt Lady he left I≈ø≈øue Two Daughters, Nicholaea, born 1608. and Claudia: The one married to Charles the Third, and decea≈øed Feb. 20. 1657. The other to Nicholas Francis, and died 1656.
2. Chri≈øtina, born Aug. 6. 1565. married to Ferdinand the Great Duke of Tu≈øcany, 1589. decea≈øed Jan. 19. 1637.
3. Charles Bi≈øhop of Metz and Strasburg, born July 1. 1567. he was likewi≈øe promoted to the Dignity of a Cardinal, on Dec. 12. 1588.
4. Antonia, born Aug. 26. 1568. married to William, Duke of Cleves and Mons, 1599. decea≈øed Aug. 18. 1610.
5 Anne, born and decea≈øed 1570.
6. Francis, Count de Vaudemont, born Feb. 27. 1571. of whom in the next Section.
7. Catharine, Lady Abbe≈øs of Remirmont, born Nov. 3. 1572. decea≈øed March 7. 1648.
8. Elizabeth, born Nov. 3. 1573. married to Maximilian, Duke of Bavaria, 1595. decea≈øed Jan. 4. 1635. And,
9. Claudia, born and decea≈øed 1574.

¬ß. III. We now return to Francis Count de Vaudemont, who ≈øucceeded his Brother Henry in the Dutchies of Lorrain and Bar; married Chri≈øtina, Daughter of Paul, Count Solms, and died 1632. leaving I≈ø≈øue Five Children, who≈øe Names were;
1. Henry, decea≈øed an Infant.
2. Charles the Third, his Father's Succe≈ø≈øor, born 1603. a Bold and Valiant Prince: yet, by rea≈øon of ≈øome Divi≈øions and Di≈øcontents in his Family, but chiefly ≈øeeing him≈øelf like to die, without I≈ø≈øue, ≈øold all his Dominions to the French King: But beginning to repent of what he had done, and willing to evade his Contract, was forced to ≈øtand to it by the French, who beat him out of his Dutchy, which he could never again recover. His fir≈øt Dutche≈øs was Nicholaea, Daughter to his Uncle Duke Henry, whom he Divorc'd, and married Beatrix de Cu≈ø≈øance, Daughter of Eugenius, Prince of ‚Äî after who≈øe decea≈øe, he in 1665. took Mary, Daughter of Charles, Count d' A≈øpremont, to his third Wife; yet died without lawful I≈ø≈øue, An. 1675.
3. Nicholas Francis, Bi≈øhop of Toul, promoted to a Cardinal's Hat in 1626. yet afterwards quitted his Orders, and acted a ≈øecular Prince; marrying the Lady Claudia,
Daughter to his Uncle, Henry, Duke of Lorrain, which Match gave Birth to the mo≈øt Illu≈øtrious Hero, Charles Leopold Sixtus, of whom in the next Section.
4. Henrica, born 1606. decea≈øed 1660. having had Five Husbands, namely, 1. Lewis de Gui≈øe. 2. Jerom Grimaldi. 3. Chri≈øtopher de Moura. 4. Charles de Ga≈øcoigne: And, 5. The Baron de Cantelou.
5. Margaret, born 1616. married to Ga≈øton John Bapti≈øt, Duke of Orleans, 1632. decea≈øed Ap. 13. 1672.

¬ß. IV. We are now come to ≈øpeak of Charles Leopold, the now rightful Duke of Lorain, born 1643. A Prince highly e≈øteem'd by His Imperial Maje≈øty, who≈øe General he is. A Prince, without di≈øpute, the greate≈øt Hero of the Age; having, by his late Renowned Actions again≈øt the Turks, which can ≈øcarce be Parallelled in Story, joyned with what he daily performs again≈øt the French, already rai≈øed him≈øelf to ≈øuch a pitch of Glory, as will render his Name Immortal to all Po≈øterity. In 1678. he married Eleanora Maria Jo≈øepha of Au≈øtria, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent Emperor, and Dowager of Michael, late King of Poland; who hath born him I≈ø≈øue at In≈øpruck, in the Principality of Tyrol, as followeth, viz.

list.item: 1. Leopoldus Jo≈øephus Carolus Agapetus Hyacintus, born Sept. 11. 1679.
2. Jo≈øephus Johannes Antonius Ignatius Felici≈ø≈øimus, born Nov. 24. 1680.
3. Another Son decea≈øed before it was Chri≈øtened.
4. Ferdinandus Jo≈øephus Philippus Romanus Laurentius, born Aug. 17. 1683.
5. Jo≈øephus Innocentius Emanuel Felicianus Con≈øtantinus, born Oct. 20. 1685.
6. Franci≈øcus Antonius Jo≈øephus Maria Ambro≈øius Nicholaus, born Dec. 8. 1689. N. S.

div.head: CHAP. XVIII. Of the Family of the Duke of Tu≈øcany.
div.p:
¬ß. I. WE remark'd above in the Life of the Emperor Rudolph the Fir≈øt, That he alienated from the Empire, and gave their Freedom to ≈øeveral Cities in Italy; among≈øt which, the City of Florence paid for her Liberty 6000 Shillings. But upon the breaking out of great Heats and Tumults between the Commons and the Nobles, in the Year 1311. it ≈øubmitted it ≈øelf to the Protection of Robert, King of (Naples according to Machiavil) Sicily, but it did not long continue in that State, but was afterwards under the Government of the Duke of Calabria; and after him, of the Dukes of Athens, who having renounced the Government, and the Nobles being over-powered by the Commonalty it became Monarchial: For An. 1434. Co≈ømo de Medices, a Citizen, and who≈øe Ance≈øtors were Merchants, was elected Prince by the Populace, Piero or Peter de Medices, Prince Co≈ømo's
Grand≈øon, having, without the Senates knowledge, entred into a League with the French King, Chap. VIII. was ejected by the Flerentines, who enjoy'd their ancient Liberty, till An. 1512. Ferdinand the Catholick King re≈øtor'd the Medicean Family; which, neverthele≈øs, in the Year 1529. was again expell'd by the Flerentines: And altho' the Emperor, Chap. V. ≈øeized on the City, and made Alexander de Medices, who had married his natural Daughter, Margaret, their Governour, yet he being Slain, the Populace made choice of his Kin≈øman Co≈ømo de Medices.

¬ß. II. This Co≈ømo, commonly called the Fir≈øt, was declared King of Tu≈øcany, by Pope Paul the Fifth, in 1569. But upon the Emperor Maximilian the Second's much oppo≈øing it, he threw a≈øide the Title of King, and took that of Great Duke of Tu≈øcany: His Son Francis, in 1575. married Joan, the Daughter of the Emperor Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, by whom he had,
Ferdinand the Fir≈øt, Father of
Co≈ømo the Second, who died 1670. and left a Son,

Co≈ømo the Third, born 1642. the pre≈øent Grand Duke, who, by Margaret Lovi≈øe, Daughter of Ga≈øton John Bapti≈øt, Duke of Orleans, has a Son, viz. Ga≈øton, who, in 1688. married Violanta Beatrix, Daughter of Ferdinand Maria, and Si≈øter to the pre≈øent Elector of Bavaria.

¬ß. III. As for what concerns this Prince's Dominions: In Tu≈øcany and Pi≈øa he is Soveraign: But Feudatory to His Catholick Maje≈øty for Siena and Ma≈ø≈øa, and great part of the I≈ø≈øe of Elbe, to whom, upon that account he yearly pays 10000 Florins. La≈øtly, he holds the City Saturnia as a Fief of the Empire. His Power may be gue≈øs'd by his Yearly Revenues, which are e≈øtimated at 1800000 Shillings.

div.head: CHAP. XIX. Of the Hou≈øe of Savoy.
div.p:
¬ß. I. THo' the Dukes of Savoy may not improperly be referred to Germany, and contained in the Upper-Circle of the Rhine; yet, becau≈øe they are po≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øed of all Piemont in Italy, as al≈øo many places in France, we thought more convenient to treat of 'em in this place. Now this Family is ju≈øtly to be numbred among≈øt tho≈øe of the greate≈øt Antiquity, ≈øince little that is certain can be ≈øpoke of its Original by rea≈øon thereof. This, neverthele≈øs, is without Di≈øpute, That Beraldus, Marque≈øs of Italy, Earl of Savoy and Maurienne, flouri≈øh'd in the beginning of the Eleventh Century, and died about the Year 1023. His Son was Humbert the Fir≈øt, ≈øurnamed Albimanus, Earl of Savoy and Maurienne, Lord of Chabais and Valois, who departed this
Life in the Year 1048. being ≈øucceeded by his Son Otho, Earl of Savoy and Maurienne, Lord of Chablais, Valois, and Aou≈øte, Marque≈øs of Italy and Su≈øa, and Duke of Turin, who died in 1091. This Otho was ≈øucceeded by his Brother Amadeus the Second (for his Elder Brother Caudatus died before his Father) who begat Humbert the Second, Earl of Savoy, Maurienne, and Piemont, Lord of Chablais, Aou≈øte and Tarento, Marque≈øs of Su≈øa and Italy, which Humbert departed this Life on Nov. 18. 1103. and left the Government of his Provinces to his Elde≈øt Son Amadeus the Third, who died at Nic ‚Ä¢ ≈øia in an Expedition to the Holy Land, on Apr. 1. 1149. Amadeus the Third was followed by his Son Humbert the Third, ≈øurnamed The Saint, who died March 4. 1186. Humbert's Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Thomas the Fir≈øt, Earl of Savoy, &c. and Vicar-General of the Empire in Lombardy and Piemont, born May 20. 1177. decea≈øed Jan. 20. 1233. This Prince le≈øt many Children, whereof we ≈øhall mention only Three, and as ≈øerviceable to pre≈øent purpo≈øe; namely, Amadeus the Fourth, Thomas the Second, and Philip. Amadeus, the Elde≈øt of the Three ≈øucceeded his Father, and begat Boniface, ≈øurnamed Roland; which Boniface died without I≈ø≈øue, in 1263. and was ≈øucceeded by his Uncle Philip, who likewi≈øe had the ≈øame Fate, Nov. 17. 1285.
¬ß. II. Return we therefore to Thomas, who departed this Life in the Year 1259. leaving Mac Three Sons, who≈øe Names were,
1. Thomas of Savoy (the Third of that Name) born 1248. decea≈øed 1282. who≈øe Son,

Philip obtained all Piemont, except the Marqui≈øate of Su≈øa, upon the death of his Great Uncle Duke Philip, without I≈ø≈øue, where his Po≈øterity ruled, till the Year 1418. at which time it became extinct in Prince Lewis of Savoy.

list.item: 2. Amadeus the Fifth, who, in the divi≈øion of Duke Philip's Inheritance 'twixt him and his Nephew Philip, had the County of Savoy, &c. for his Lot: Of this Prince more below.
3. Lewis of Savoy, Baron of Vaud, who≈øe Po≈øterity failed in another Lewis, An. 1350.

div.p:
Amadeus the Fifth, by rea≈øon of his great Exploits, ≈øurnamed The Great, was born in 1249. and died Oct. 16. 1323. In 1310. he was created a Prince of the Empire, by the Emperor Henry the Sixth. The Children that ≈øurvived him, were,
1. Edward, born 1284. who ≈øucceeded him, but died without I≈ø≈øue, 1329. And,
2. Aymon, ≈øurnamed Pacificus (or Peacemaker) born Dec. 15. 1291. who ≈øucceeded his Brother Edward, and died June 1343. leaving the Government to his Son Amadeus the Sixth, who died in the Year 1383. and was ≈øucceeded by his Son Amadeus the Seventh, ≈øurnamed The Red, who begat Amadeus the Eighth, of whom in the next Section.

¬ß. III. Amadeus the Eighth was born Sept. 4. 1383. and created Duke of Savoy by the Emperor Sigi≈ømund, on Feb. 19. 1416. In 1418. Piemont in Italy, &c. fell to him upon the death of his Cou≈øin Lewis without I≈ø≈øue. In 1434. he gave up the Government to his Son Lewis, betaking him≈øelf to an Eccle≈øia≈øtick Life, and died in the Year 1451.
Lewis who ≈øucceeded him, was born 1402. married Anne Lu≈øignan, Daughter to Jean, King of Cyprus, An. 1432. and died 1465. Among≈øt the Children that ≈øurvived, we find,
1. Amadeus the Ninth, who ≈øucceeded him, and died 1472. being ≈øucceeded him≈øelf by his Son,
Charles the Second, Duke of Savoy, who died 1490. leaving his Son,
Charles John Amadeus, Duke of Savoy, and King of Cyprus, born 1448. to ≈øucceed him. This Charles John died Childle≈øs, An. 1496.

2. Philip, ≈øurnamed Sans Terrae (or Lack-land) born Feb. 5 1438. neverthele≈øs, in the extremity of his Age he came to be Duke, and Heir to a farthing, to all the Lands and E≈øtates of his Grand-Nephew, Duke Charles John Amadeus above-mentioned. He departed this Life on Nov. 7. 1497. and left the Government to his Son,
1. Philibert the Second, born 1480. decea≈øed without I≈ø≈øue Sept. 10. 1504. whereupon the Government fell to his Brother
2. Charles the Third born 1486. decea≈øed 1553. who≈øe Son was Emanuel Philibert, of whom in the next Section.

¬ß. IV. Emanuel Philibert was born July 1 1428. and from his very Youth proved him≈øelf an excellent Souldier, in the Service of the Emperour Charles V. On July 9. 1559. he married Margaret, Daughter to Francis I. King of France, and died Aug. 30. 1580. leaving only a Son.

Charles Emanuel, Duke of Savoy, and King of Cyprus; born Jan. 12. 1562. a Prince (to u≈øe the Words of the Learned Im. Hoff, in his Geneal. Gall.) of ≈øublime Parts, and happy Memory; excellently well read in all ≈øorts of Learning, e≈øpecially Mathematicks. He had a very ≈øharp War with the French, but with bad ≈øucce≈øs. On March 11. 1685. he married Catharina Michaelis, of the Hou≈øe of Au≈øtria, Daughter to Philip II. King of Spain; and died July 26. 1630. leaving I≈ø≈øue,
1. Philip Emanuel, Prince of Piemont, born 1586. decea≈øed 1605.
2. Victor Amadeus, of whom in the next ¬ß.
3. Emanuel Philibert, Knight of Jeru≈øalem, Prince of Oneglia, and Vice Roy of Sicily, born 1588. decea≈øed at Palermo, 1624.
4. Margaret, born April 28. 1589. married to Francis Gonzaga, Duke of Mantua, 1608. decea≈øed June 26. 1655.
5. I≈øabel, born March 11. 1591. and married to Alphon≈øus of E≈øte, Duke of Modena. She died 1626.
6. Maurice, Cardinal of S.R. E. born Jan. 10. 1593. but afterwards coming to be Prince of Oneglia, he married Aboi≈øia
Mary, his Brother Amadeus's Daughter, yet died without I≈ø≈øue, Oct. 4. 1657.
7. Mary, a profe≈øs'd Nun; ≈øhe died 1656.
8. Frances Catharine; ≈øhe was likewi≈øe profe≈øs'd, and died 1641.
9. Thomas Francis, Prince of Carignan, Dec. 21. 1596. of whom in the la≈øt ¬ß.
10 Joan, born and decea≈øed the ≈øame Year, viz. 1597.

¬ß. V. 'Tis now time Victor Amadeus again appear: He was born May 3. 1587. and ≈øucceeded his Father in the Dutchy of Savoy. This Prince was a great Lover of Peace; neverthele≈øs, a new War breaking out 'twixt France and Spain, he declared for the fir≈øt; which involv'd him in ≈øo many Difficulties, that being oppre≈øs'd by 'em, he fell into a Fever, whereof he died in a few Days, Oct. 7. 1637. His Dutche≈øs was Daughter to King Henry IV. of France; by whom he had I≈ø≈øue as followeth; viz.

list.item: 1. Aloi≈øia Mary Chri≈øtina, born July 27. 1629. and married to her Uncle Maurice, Prince of Oneglia.
2. Franci≈øcus Hyacinthus, Duke of Savoy, born 1632. decea≈øed 1638.
3. Charles Emanuel, of whom below.
4. Margaret Joland, born 1635. married to Rainulius, Duke of Parma, April 29. 1660. decea≈øed 1663.
5 Adelais Henrica (or as others, Henrietta Adelheid) born Nov. 6. 1636. married to Ferdinand Maria, Elector of Bavaria, 1652. decea≈øed March 18. 1676.
6. Catharina Beatrix, her Twin-Si≈øter, decea≈øed 1637.

div.p: Charles Emanuel, who ≈øucceeded his Father, was born June 20. 1634. He perform'd all his Exerci≈øes very finely on Hor≈øeback; for the improvement of which Art, he cau≈øed an Academy to be opened at Turin; and was ≈øo ab≈øolutely perfect in all other Endowments, both of Mind and Body, that his untimely death, which hapned June 12. 1675. is never enough to be lamented. In 1663. he took to Wi≈øe Frances Magdalen, Daughter to John Bapti≈øt Ga≈øton. Duke of Orleans; but ≈øhe died May 11. 1665. After which, he married Mary Joan Bapti≈øt of Savoy, Daughter to Charles Amadeus, Duke of Nemours, whom he left, as ≈øhe ≈øtill remains, a Widow. By the la≈øt he had

Victor Amadeus Francis, the pre≈øent Duke of Savoy, born May 17. 1666. On April 9. 1684. he married Anne Mary, Daughter to Philip Duke of Orleans; by whom (as far as I can learn) he has hitherto had only,
1. Mary Adelheid, born Dec. 6. 1685. And,
2. Another Daughter, born Aug. 30. N.S. 1688. who≈øe Name as yet I know not.

¬ß. VI. It ≈øtill remains we ≈øay ≈øomewhat of Thomas Francis, younge≈øt Son to Charles Emanuel I. Duke of Savoy, mentioned already by us in Sect. IV. Numb. 9. who ≈øpent his Life, for the mo≈øt part, in the Wars. Jan. 22. 1624. he married Mary of Bourbon, Daughter to Charles Count de Soi≈ø≈øons; who bare him,
1. Charlotte Chri≈øtina, not long-liv'd.
2. Aloi≈øia Chri≈øtina, born Aug. 1. 1627. and married to Ferdinand Maximilian, Marqui≈øs of Baden, 1693.
3. Emanuel Philibert Amadeus of Savoy, Prince de Carignan, born Aug. 20. 1628. He was both deaf and dumb, and ≈øo wholly unfit for Bu≈øine≈øs of State; neverthele≈øs he was married in 1684. to Mary Catharine of E≈øte, Prince Bor≈øus his Daughter.
4. Jo≈øeph Emanuel John, born June 24. 1631. decea≈øed Jan. 12. 1656.
5. Eugenius Maurice of Savoy, Count de Soi≈ø≈øons, born May 3. 1635. of whom beneath.
6. Amadeus, and both which died in their youth.
7. Ferdinand, both which died in their youth.

As for Eugenius Maurice, he departed this Life June 7. 1673. On Feb. 20. 1657. he married Olympia, Daughter of Michael Laurence of ‚Äî by Cardinal Mazarine's Si≈øter, whom he left a Widow, and by her a numerous I≈ø≈øue; viz.

list.item: 1. Lewis Thomas, Count de Soi≈ø≈øons, born Decemb. 15. 1657. His Prince≈øs's Name is Urania de la Cropte, Daughter to the Noble Baron de Beauvais, whom he married Decemb. 17. 1682.
2. Philip, born 1659.
3. Lewis Julius, born May 2. 1660. and ≈ølain in the Turki≈øh Wars, July 13. 1683.
4. Emanuel, born 1663. decea≈øed 1676.
5. Francis Eugenius, born 1665.
6. Frances, decea≈øed Feb. 24. 1671.
7. Mary Joan Bapti≈øta, born Jan. 1. 1665.
8. Aloi≈øia Philiberta, born Nov. 22. 1667.

div.head: CHAP. XX. Of the Hou≈øe of Mantua.
div.p:
¬ß. I. WE now come to the Family of the Dukes of Mantua, and ≈øhall derive the ≈øame from one Hugo, who married one of the Gonzaga's, a Family of a Noble Extraction in Lombardy; which was the rea≈øon that his Son Gerhard, who was inve≈øted in Mantua by his Cou≈øin Adelbert, in 1009. as an immediate Feudatory of the Empire, took on him the Name of Gonzaga. Hugo his Father died in the Year 946. and is ≈øaid to be the Son of another Hugo, who was Earl of Provence, and King of Italy, and Son to King Lotharius III. Grand≈øon to K. Lotharius II. and great Grand≈øon to Lotharius the Emperour. Aloi≈øius, or Lewis Gonzaga, was the Eleventh in de≈øcent from Gerhard, and created Captain of Mantua by the Emperour Charles IV. in the Year 1329. His Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Guido, who begat Lewis; which Lewis was ≈øucceeded by his Son Francis; all of 'em Captains of Mantua. Francis's Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was John Francis, created the fir≈øt Marqui≈øs of Mantua, by the Emperour Sigi≈ømund, Sept. 22. 1433. His elde≈øt Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Frederick I. who begat Francis II. Francis II. begat Frederick II. who was created the Fir≈øt Duke of Mantua, by Charles V. April 8. 1530. and left three Sons: (1.) Francis, who died without I≈ø≈øue. (2.) William, who ≈øucceeded
his Brother Francis. And (3.) Lewis of whom in the next. William's Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Vincent, Duke of Mantua, who≈øe I≈ø≈øue was as followeth:
1. Margaret Gonzaga, married to Henry, Duke of Lorrain.
2. Eleanor, married in 1622. to the Emperour Ferdinand II. decea≈øed June 27. 1655.
3. Francis II. who left only a Daughter.
4. Cardinal Ferdinand. And,
5. Vincent, in whom the Ducal Line in Italy failed, Anno 1627.

¬ß. II. Return we therefore to Lewis III. Son to Frederick above-mentioned, who married the Lady Henrica, Heire≈øs to the Dutchy of Nevers in France; which was po≈ø≈øe≈øs'd by his Po≈øterity, 'till the Year 1659. at what time they ≈øold it to Cardinal Mazarine. His Son was Charles Gonzaga, Duke of Nevers, who became Duke upon the death of his Cou≈øin Vincent, and Heired all his E≈øtates. He departed this Life in the Year 1637. having begot Charles II. who, contrary to the Cour≈øe of Nature, died before his Father, 1631. Neverthele≈øs, he was fir≈øt married, and left I≈ø≈øue as follows:
1. Eleanor, born May 18. 1629. married to the Emperour Ferdinand III. 1651. decea≈øed 1 ‚Ä¢ 86.
2. Charles III. the pre≈øent Duke, who married I≈øabella Clara, Daughter to Leopold V. Arch-Duke of Au≈øtria; but has no I≈ø≈øue by her.

div.head: CHAP. XXI. Of the Family of the Dukes of Parma and Placentia.
div.p:
¬ß. 1. THe Dukes of Parma owe their Original to the ancient Line of the Farne≈øe's in Italy, from whence Pope Paul III. (otherwi≈øe Alexander de Farne≈øe) was de≈øcended; who in 1545. created his Natural Son, Peter Aloi≈øius de Farne≈øe, Duke of Parma and Placentia. Neverthele≈øs, by rea≈øon of his vicious Di≈øpo≈øition, and intolerable Cruelty, he ≈øo far incen≈øed both the Nobility and Commonalty, that they con≈øpired again≈øt him, and ≈ølew him. His Son Octavius married Margaret, Natural Daughter to Charles V. Alexander de Medices, Great Duke of Tu≈øcany's Widow; and of this Match Alexander de Farne≈øe, Prince of Parma, was born; a Prince worthy the noble≈øt Character, and hardly to be equall'd by the greate≈øt Men of that Age. He married Mary of Portugal, by whom he had Rainulius I. Duke of Parma and Placentia; and Odoardus I. who became a Cardinal. The fir≈øt of the≈øe begat,
1. Alexander the Dumb, who by rea≈øon of that Imperfection, was unfit to Govern. And,
2. Odoardus II. who ≈øucceeded his Father; and died 1646.

¬ß. II. This Odoardus II. had four Children that ≈øurvived him, the elde≈øt of which was Ratnulius
II. the pre≈øent Duke of Parma and Placentia; who, on Apr. 29. 1660. married Margaret Joland, Daughter to Victor Amadeus, Duke of Savoy; but ≈øhe died in 1663. After which, he took to Wife I≈øabel d' E≈øte, Daughter to Francis, Duke of Modena, who likewi≈øe is ≈øince dead. As far as we can hear, he has but one Son, viz. Odoardus the Third, lately married (as is reported) to Hedewig Elizabeth Amalia, Daughter of Philip William, Elector Palatine.

div.head: CHAP. XXII. Of the Hou≈øe of Modena.
div.p: ¬ß. I. THe Dukes of Modena are de≈øcended from the Ancient Marque≈ø≈øes of E≈øte, who≈øe common Father was Hugo, Lord of Padua, and Marque≈øs of E≈øte. Among≈øt the De≈øcendants of this Lord, we find one Bor≈øus, who was created Duke of Modena, by the Emperor Frederick the Third, and of Ferrara, by Pope Paul the Second. He was ≈øucceeded by his Brother Hercules the Fir≈øt, who died in 1505. being ≈øucceeded by his Son Alphon≈øo the Fir≈øt, who, by his Wife Lucretia, Daughter to Pope Alexander the Sixth, had Hercules the Second, Duke of Mantua and Ferrara, to whom the Government fell, upon the death of his Father in 1534. His Son and Succe≈ø≈øor was Alphon≈øo the Second, who died without I≈ø≈øue, in the Year, 1597.

¬ß. II. Now there was ≈øurviving at this time, Cae≈øar d' E≈øte, Son of Alphon≈øo, Marque≈øs of Monte Ca≈ø≈øo, natural Son to Alphon≈øo the Fir≈øt, Duke of Modena, by Laura Eu≈øtachia, a Woman of ob≈øcure Birth, who afterwards got the name of Labella Ferratarina. Duke Alphon≈øo dying without I≈ø≈øue, left this Cae≈øar his Heir, by the con≈øent of the Emperors Maximilian the Second, and Rodolph the Second; But the Pope ≈øeized on Ferrara, as a Fee Farm of the Church, vacant by the death of the la≈øt Duke. However, he was Inve≈øted in that of Modena, in the Year 1598. and was ≈øucceeded therein by his Son Francis the Fir≈øt, who died 1656. leaving I≈ø≈øue,
1. Alphon≈øus the Third, who ≈øucceeded him, and in 1655. married Laurentia, Cardinal Mazarine's Niece, by his Si≈øter; of which Match came Alphon≈øo the Fourteenth, the pre≈øent Duke, who was born 1656. and married a Prince≈øs out of the Family of the Barberini.
2. Almerick, Prince of Modena; where he is at pre≈øent, we cannot ≈øo well ≈øay.
3. I≈øabel, married to Rainulius the Second, Duke of Parma, &c. but ≈øome time ≈øince dead.
4. Mary Eleanor Beatrix, married in 73. to James the Second, King of Great Brittain; the now lives in France.

div.head: CHAP. XXIII. Of the Family of the Dukes of Curland.
div.p: THe Dukes of Curland are Originally of We≈øtphalia; for Gothard the Fir≈øt, Son to Gothard Redlar, a We≈øtphalian Knight, and Grand Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order, was created Duke of Curland and Semigallan, by Sigi≈ømund, King of Poland; and begat James, who ≈øucceeded in that Dukedom. Duke James, in 1645. married Charlotte, the Daughter of George William, Elector of Brandenburg, who died in 76. having born him the following I≈ø≈øue.

list.item: 1. Frederick Ca≈øimier, the pre≈øent Duke, who married Sophia Amalia, of Na≈ø≈øau-Siegen, on Dec. 25. 1688. by whom he has hitherto had only Two Daughters.
2. Ferdinand, a Noble and Valiant Prince, Lieutenant-General in the Elector of Brandenburg's Army.
3. Alexander Wounded with a Cannon-Ball at the Siege of Buda, and died in his way towards Vienna.
4. Lovi≈øe Elizabeth, married to Frederick Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, of the Line of Hamburg, 1671.
5. Mary Amalia, married May 21. 1673. to Charles, Landtgrave of He≈ø≈øe, of the Line of Ca≈ø≈øel.
6. Charlotte, who as yet lives unmarried in the King of Sweden's Court.
